L-7wOwgeSoQJYpr-LnAZdA.text: I LOVE This old school steakhouse....food is delicious!! My Only recommendations are  make a reservation and more importantly ask to not be seated in the bar area.  The noise level is over the top. It ruined my dinner.

XttQHB2yZ7gssS3FyNan5A.text: Don't let the outside of this place fool you.  The atmosphere inside is reminiscent of some of the good steakhouses I grew up with in NY and the food is amazing.  Personable staff, amazing food, smart-casual attire, -it just oozes comfort and quality.  My wife and I recently celebrated our anniversary here and had the following:  Cocktails to start: -Old Fashioned (made good and strong) -Jack and Coke (also made good and strong)  Appetizers: Shrip Cocktail (We wish we had ordered more!) Frog Legs (These were good sized and good) Escargot (delicious)  Entres: NY Strip with shredded King Crab on top (Huge cut and super tasty) Filet Mignon with crab cake (equally as tasty)  We also shared: Sauteed mushrooms (Order these!!) Creamed Spinach (so rich and creamy) A bottle of Pinot Grigio (crisp and perfect)  In the end we were incredibly stuffed and brought a bunch of food home.  Ahhh... delicious, delicious leftovers!  We cannot wait to go back!

w0vgMZJ2dXLOicN4r5gmBQ.text: Hands down my wife and I' s new secret get away. The steak is perfect! The mushrooms and creamed spinach was by far the best I've had in years. Did I mention the staff was attentive and just plain courteous! The dressing for our salad was homemade and our veggies were cool and fresh.. will be back this weekend with family!

_jGvv2dtasFgKehw8hddKg.text: If I had just had their steak... I'd give them 5 stars... Unfortunately there's more to a night out then just a single steak.   I know it's supposed to be 'a hole in the wall' local steak house, but we were seated on the back 'patio'... which resembled a sports bar more than a steak house... really loud and disappointing place to be seated since we were celebrating my father's birthday.   Service was just okay... not bad, but she was not very attentive.   Like I said, the steak was excellent (and the only thing saving this review)... The salad was as plain as they come and poorly prepared. (The house made dressings were pretty good though).   The sides were terrible... I mean pretty much inedible. My dad added a king crab leg, and it was half terribly cooked... way over done.   The icing on the cake... our waitress hand wrote "20% gratuity = $X" and added it all up on the check A.) I can do math, B.) I always tip 20%, but I don't need to you suggest your tip C.) That's just tacky for supposedly high end restaurant... it's not Olive Garden.   Overall a huge let down... especially considering it was just over $300 for 5 people. (not bad for a steakhouse, but bad for what we got)

j3d6KiUZ9_6y7ZVzWDqo-g.text: So I will acknowledge that I'm in the minority here. It's been around since 1958 so what do I know? That said, we won't be going back. First, the positives: easy parking, seated immediately (although the reservation was for 5pm and the place was mostly empty) and greeted pleasantly by the bus boy and waiter. Our steaks (mine a filet, the wife's a Delmonico) were excellent and the baked potato perfectly baked.  Then the negatives: * both my wife and I noticed a distinctive unpleasant taste to the water poured from a pitcher by the bus boy - sort of like it came out of a hose. We asked for a replacement which was much better but that was an off-putting way to start the evening.  * our waiter never made it clear that my onion soup appetizer could have taken the place of the included salad for a small up charge. * then there's the supposed "classic salad." Really? Iceberg lettuce accompanied by a plate of large cut vegetables (onions, green pepper, radish, cucumber, and cherry tomatoes) that you have to assemble yourself. Tremendously wasteful in my opinion since neither of us are fans of green pepper and I hate cucumbers. Where's grated cheese, croutons, carrots, etc? The dressings were OK but nothing spectacular. It's only a "classic salad" cause they call it one.  * No bread was offered - only crackers already at the table. I've since read reviews raving about their bread but we wouldn't know since we never got any.  * a different server delivered our main courses after which no one, including our original waiter, checked back to see if the meals were to our liking. Heck, that's a basic "waiter 101" which happens at virtually every other place I've eaten at. Very disappointing not to have it happen at a high dollar restaurant.

AJLACEJvOkUbHqA8d3xyNA.text: Best steak house in Charlotte! Service is great and so are the steaks. It's an old school feeling in the restaurant, something straight out of the 60's. Not your normal chain steakhouse (in a good way)

pEtA1gXE5t_FD6RoAHNX4Q.text: A mixture of great food and even better service. The drink options, many appetizers and great choices in entrees made the choices to eat very difficult. Try the shrimp w cocktail sauce for sure. Huge, fresh, and tasty. Salmon melting in my mouth and the stakes were juicy and well seasoned. No need for any steak sauce nor A1. The service was even better than the food and if you can request Kate Kovats' section you will be more than pleased. She made our eating experience the Nordstrom's of dining!!!!

ZN_aNPDq8YMrULZK6EY9jQ.text: I am in love with this place!!!! Truly a gem. The entire staff is amiable and are genuinely dedicated to your experience here. We both ordered 6 oz filets, medium. They were cooked to perfection all the sides came with the steak wich is not common. I ordered a martini extra dry, extra olives, I almost immediately had a drink in my hands. They were obviously busy and working hard but they did not rush or give the impression that it was hectic.  The outside appearance can deter most it can give the impression of a biker bar but the inside is intimate and quiet. It is like most other yelpers have said, a good fellas vibe. I LOVE BEEF N' BOTTLE.

QGIkq3guFUSUFLxNukv_DA.text: I was excited to find another steak joint and such an iconic one at that. I hate to say my husband and I will never go back. Do they know what garlic is?  The bread everyone said was amazing, was just toasted bread. How about some garlic?  I ordered the shrimp cocktail. I love spice but man I thought my head would explode.  As spicy as the cocktail sauce was, you would think they would spice up their other food. Nope. The steaks were bland and the mashed potatoes just as bland. I was excited to get an onion ring. Looked good but way to bready.  My husband had to ask for 57 sauce for his steak and a couple we ate with put ketchup on her steak. I think maybe the people who like this place haven't had a really good steak.  Maybe they just have been going here for 30+ years they haven't tried anything else.  I promise there is better out there. I didn't mind it was a dive. Amazed it's been open this long.

hHWeQB6JK2FH2DCCbdN93w.text: Food was amazing and the staff was super friendly! Don't let the outside of the building deter you!

E_sKNe0VZPyd1XFRFEDBkg.text: Very cool, old school steak restaurant (since 1958).  My favorite place for a special meal.  Steaks are top notch,  service is friendly and very good.    Expect a dumpy looking exterior, cramped 1960s styled interior, low light and an older crowd.  Dress up a little and have a backup planned if you drop in without reservations.  If you're looking for a trendy place, in a nice area of Charlotte with a young, hip crowd; this ain't it.

PCl5GtuxEDv9tJrDfOZUFg.text: Don't judge a book by its cover. The outside may look a little dated, and the inside is a throwback to the heydays of Sinatra and Dean, but the atmosphere and food is great. Its got so much charm and the staff is so very nice.  In these days of the cookie cutter chains, its nice to set something unique, something that has nostalgia. When traveling, I always ask the locals where to go, and they said here. Later on, at a different place , I sparked up a conversation with some more locals and their eyes lit up when I told them we went to the Beef & Bottle.  You aren't going to get a cranberry walnut arugula and microgreens salad with a port wine reduction dressing here or a fine selection of cheeses with artisan bread baked today, but you will get some wholesome standard fare that's prepared well.  The seafood player was good size and the crab cakes were excellent. Lots of crab meat and little stuffing.  I'd go back again.

WOcf6_5PfGZZqCub08l7eg.text: Had a wonderful meal. It was very loud and difficult to talk to friends we were dining with. We wanted dessert but to our shock were  told they needed the table and dessert was not an option for us. Extremely disappointed and will never return. Would not recommend. Way overpriced for the treatment we received. We were literally asked to leave because they needed the table. Only reason they get 2 stars is because the steak was great.

l0zyJ6zOpRQbe4cBtZisfg.text: Had reservations last nite ( couldn't get in this weekend )... 41/2 STARS...service was great food even better...B'day wife broke her wrist while playing tennis and they cut up her steak so I wouldn't have to !!!! Mgr came by to see how we were doing and address me by my last name...pretty cool Try the clam chowder....home-made Don't care about the $$$...You get what you pay for Brett B

eJfC-3ejX1IAc_m_MWA1sg.text: We came late on a Monday night for half price bottles.  Was definitely worth it as we tried the steak and the salmon to check out the variety.  We shared the ribeye which was nicely cooked and the salmon was not overdone as well.  I liked the fact that the entrees came with the sides, as opposed to having to order sides for $7-8 more each.  Definitely a good value for a steakhouse.  The atmosphere was dimly lit booths with decent service, nothing special, which probably differentiates them with the more expensive steakhouses.  I would come back for good steak that won't break the bank for a special occasion with the significant other.

xxfEE73zx4hy70zyrJ_s3A.text: This was recommended by my Uber driver while I was in town for the weekend. Excellent recommendation.  Probably the most flawless dining experience I've ever had.  Our server, Dean, was knowledgable and personable.  His recommendations were on point.  The food was perfect.  The atmosphere is very laid back and relaxing.  I will make sure to stop by here any time I'm passing through Charlotte.

PzaZT_SMwm0otztfOg_smw.text: We've been here twice, and both times it has been really, really good. Service is always great, the food is excellent, from the salads all the way to the desserts. A little pricey, but worth it. The building is pretty old, and feels a little claustrophobic with its low ceilings, but it does have a certain nostalgic appeal. This place was built in the 50's, and they have opted to play to that without trying to get too fancy or "modern". A nice, casual dining experience with food quality that far surpasses most similarly appointed restaurants. Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States. 12 oz ribeye and lobster tail.

L5IqEtX53Ype8ell0GQQiA.text: Cool eccentric atmosphere. The manager greets you as you walk in. Best steaks I've had in CLT and their apps are great too. They also have the best dirty martini in CLT.

7jNUGOZbM8Hl-sIW2mCdvg.text: I debated on the 5th star, but you know what?  The Manager asked me if there I was anything he should change and I told him "Please don't change a thing, you can only mess it up".    Concerning the commentary about how it looks from the outside:  Don't judge a book by it's cover.  Yeah, it has some "Mafia hideout place to bring your mistress maybe it's really a strip club" look to it - but if you haven't figured it out by now, that IS part of the charm and the appeal.  One reviewer here thinks none of the clientele are locals.  Perhaps he is clairvoyant, but I don't think it is possible to make such a claim.  Pricey?  Not really.  Making comparisons to Outback?  You should probably stick with Outback.  To start - our waitress (also the bartender) Hillary made me one of the better Old Fashioneds with Dark Rum I've had.  She left out the orange but it was still pretty great.  Now she knows she has Myers on hand, too.   We had "the cheese" but with Panini bread instead of crackers.  Sounds silly, I know.  I thought the cheese was to die for, and the danger here is eating too much of it.  Next time I will eat the cheese with a spoon when no one is looking.  The bread is crazy good, too.  There is a reason they bring this out to your table when you are seated - it's tastes really good.  We also had French Onion Soup, Salad with Blue Cheese, Shrimp Scampi (prepared perfectly), Trout (perfect), Ribeye (it was hard to resist licking my plate in public when it was gone), Creamed Spinach (awesome) and Mushrooms.  (I love mushrooms, but these are prepared in a wine sauce, wheras I am more of a garlic butter fan).  We had a hard time choosing a bottle of wine, but we described what we were looking for and another waiter made a recommendation - it was spot on.  I think it may be crowded on Mon and Thurs for half-priced wine nights, so remember you probably need a reservation any night of the week.  When we were leaving a van full of seniors showed up with no reservations.  The Manager was trying to accommodate, and I hope they were able to work it out but...trust me, make a reservation.  We had to skip the dessert this time, but it was tempting.  We thoroughly enjoyed the entire experience, and sincerely hope it doesn't change a bit.  We are new fans and cannot wait to go back.  To anyone who didn't like it, you should probably stick with chain restaurants.

fvOSpJvnuJR8U24_M0G8rg.text: We arrived at the Beef and Bottle at 6:25 pm for a 6:30 pm reservation on the December 21st.   There was a lady from behind the register that snorted 'Name?' while she was busy attending to another customer wanting gift certificates.   Nothing more was said.  We waited.  About five minutes later, the lady handed four menus to an elderly gentleman sitting near the counter and gave him a table number.  We found out later that the elderly gentleman was in fact a co-owner.  The elderly gentleman sat us down, looked as his watch and said 'Enjoy the meal.  This table is booked at 8:00 pm. [pause to look at his watch], You should have enough time.'  We all looked at each other in surprise.   First allow me to mention that we booked the table on OpenTable and there is no mention of a time limit.  Second, we are in Charlotte, NC - not some hot restaurant in NYC.  Suffice it to say, for the rest of the meal, we felt like we were running against the clock.  By the time the main meal service was done it was 7:45 pm.  We were asked if we wanted dessert and we declined as our table time was soon to be up.  Around that time the elderly gentleman, who is a co-owner, came back and asked how things were.  We stated our frustration with the 'time limit' and he just shrugged his shoulders, said that 'this was the only way they had figured out how to do things' and then... he walked off!  We did not even have time to tell him about the disappointing food...            Concerned about the time allotment, we skipped appetizers and just went for the mains with their sides.  Three of us ordered the filet and lobster tail combo.    One of us ordered just the filet.  Each entree came with two sides.  For those of us with the lobster tail, they arrived overcooked and barley warm (they were probably sitting under a heat lamp).  The clarified butter was starting to congeal.  My steak was actually fine and medium rare as I had ordered.  However, two of us had ordered the fillets as medium well, yet they clearly arrived as medium rare.  Each of the steaks is served with an onion ring on top.  In each case, the onion rings were cold and basically inedible.   Sides were fine, but baked potatoes and iceberg lettuce salads are hard to mess up.   All of that for 4 people came to $350 with one $60 bottle of wine.             Our server that night was fine.  However, the food issues coupled with the co-owner, his comments and his attitude were all a real let down.   Some will say that Beef and Bottle is 'old school' or 'an institution'.   Don't get sucked in.  At best this place is below average and is clearly in decay.

7kL79emusMlOudH8nkJDHQ.text: This was my second visit to Beef and Bottle. The first time I ate here (3 years ago), I had a pleasant experience...good service, awesome food. Tonight, I left pretty pissed off.  When I arrived, the table was set up for us, but it took at least fifteen minutes for the server to greet us. They had half priced wine (hell yeah), but the wine list was not even on the table. The crackers and cheese whiz thing just made me feel insulted. When paying $30 a plate, one shouldn't have to unwrap captain's wafers while waiting for beverages. If they pride themselves on being a local landmark, couldn't they buy a few loaves of bread from Nova's or Suarez?  The oysters Rockefeller were overcooked. They looked like they had sat in the window for twenty minutes (and quite possibly could have). My filet had to be sent back, but did eventually taste great. The salad consisted of iceberg, radishes, (not so fresh) tomatoes, green peppers. Served on warm salad plates. The salad dressing, however,  was pretty good.  A manager/ owner was present, but never stopped by our table. This place is too f*%#$@* small to not have a manager/owner check on the guest satisfaction at tables, especially if a steak had to be recooked.    As we left, the manager/owner turned the inside lights off before we got to the door. Rude . Had the service and food prep been quicker, we would have already been out the door an hour prior to that. I do not recommend this restaurant.

8oCsUnDbkjPIRicNqvB1gw.text: Okay, so I love old school steakhouses (maybe it's the wood panelling), so I really wanted to love Beef and Bottle; but I couldn't.   The atmosphere is unique from the make your own salad table side to the crackers and cheddar cheese spread. The pricing is very reasonable and the service was great. The downside (and it's kind of a big one) was the actual steak itself. I don't know if it wasn't fresh, a bad cut of meat or if it was heated up in a microwave but regardless it was disappointing.   I probably would have only given two stars, but as I mentioned I love old school steakhouse.

0PUYlDYB8xWGLTL3O25PlQ.text: Beef and bottle always has wonderful food. The dim, secret, off- the- beaten -path atmosphere is also very attractive. However, I was underwhelmed by the service tonight. We spent $107 on dinner for two and the waitstaff was (kind) but rushing around all night, distracted and inattentive. (btw they were.not busy) I.do.expect amazing service when paying a triple digit bill, which seems appropriate. They did not talk about any of their menu options,brag about the specials or recommend a good wine. A place like this deserves great service. We are hopeful though and will give it one more try.

Q7AeL5kqeyo-UGHajk7R6w.text: This place is great.  It is SUPER dark as most of the reviews mentioned but that does not bother me.  I had a fillet that was cooked perfectly.  I also like that the steak came with a side and a salad.  Christopher was our server and he was really great.  Friendly, funny and comfortable.  If I am ever in Charlotte again, I will definitely be eating here!

VZr9Z61deaYhYOSbCjASXg.text: The owners need to visit Bern's Steakhouse in Tampa to see how a real steakhouse is run.  Steaks are tasty but ours weren't cooked as ordered (medium rare) and the rest of the food was just so-so.  Very pricy for a mediocre meal. Service was okay but nothing special.  Oysters Rockefeller were good but sauteed mushrooms were awful.  We won't be back.

gqyVg4Mc7WBLkH7G84cz7Q.text: OK so I was secretly really excited to go here with what I had been told by a lot of my clients. But alas I have experienced better.  My fiancee and I purchased a deal here through living social and we were both confused and excited to go here. We were told the steaks were to die for and the atmosphere was something to be seen.  It looks bad on the outside and to be 100% honest with you the 5 years I have lived in my house and driven by here I thought it was a biker bar. So I was surprised when I looked up the website and saw the prices of the meals but that aside I was very curious. My Mom had also bought the deal and we were all going to go together.  My fiancee called and the restaurant said if we all wanted to sit together we had to have at least 5 people with us, so we invited my friend as we made reservations at 7. Jerry and I arrived at 6:55 and we went in the back door not knowing it was the back door, but a very nice waitress grabbed us and usher us up front we were sat at a table for 10 even though we only had 5 which was a little odd but oh well. We got water right away but that was it. The rest of our party got there at about 7:05 so  not to bad but still only water.... When the waitress did come she very quickly took our drink order but did not wait 5 min to see if we wanted appetizers. She brought the drinks back and our Brandy Old Fashions were in extremely small glasses, trust me when I say EXTREMELY SMALL.  Still they were quite perfect which is really hard to find.  Again she quickly took our orders and almost seemed annoyed to answer any questions. Salads took about 25-30 min which is funny because you build your own. The ranch dressing though amazing!!  No one took our salads plates away nor did I ever get a chance to order another drink and we had to literally grab the waitress when we need more water at least.  About 35-40 min after the salad we finally get our steak. Now we all ordered rare or med rare so we were surprised that it took so long. The steak I had was very very good I will not down play that the flavor was incredible but my mom's was wrong and over cooked THREE times! Finding the waitress was like finding a needle in a haystack.  Over all great atmosphere, I loved the decor and music it is totally a rat pack hide away. Food was pretty good but really expensive for what you get and service was fair if not bad. They treated us well they comped my moms steak and let her use her living social thing. But the service was so sub-par for the amount we were paying that it really bothered Jerry so I do not think we will be going back .

TY1EKXqFWqbGJYbiqOXMMg.text: Celebrated my mother-in-law 70th birthday dinner, the food was ok...some of the vegetables were cold, lobster tail was a bit salty; however the servers were nice.

un-xd4mOlpEm2NSB91hR2Q.text: Our dinner was delicious and our waiter, Christopher, was the BEST! He made us feel special and took GREAT care of us! We definitely want to go back.

E5pvWnj4MzKpt_PrmJMlgw.text: Am I missing something here? I've gone to BnB 3 times and it's never blown me away. Good service, good steaks, but I haven't ever seen the same angle so many others apparently have that this place is a magical diamond in the rough. Last night we got the frog legs, which I was told were much bigger and meatier than most...There was half a bite worth of meat on each. I feel like this place is hurting from word of mouth OVERselling it. It's like when someone tells you they saw the best movie ever and inevitably the overhyping takes away from something just being good. This is an iconic restaurant from the history it's shared with Charlotte and offers good food. Period.

2aAECrbppf9W9dbnRCekxA.text: If you have been to Morton's and other pretentious steakhouses, you are in for a treat.  This place is very retro steakhouse, almost corny.  I love it. Steaks are great salads are build you own with ingredients delivered to the table.  The outside looks like a windowless bar but the inside is warm and inviting.  Is that Bogart in the corner with a martini?

SRAAj-6-F8MVAKFUpmiMcw.text: Over rated.Drinks and Food are over price.

WJXRyLVkhMAlagxPXD8apA.text: Eaten here a couple of times and everytime I feel like I"m walking into something from the Sopranos.  Good steaks, attentive wait staff

Xxg0HGezeiZY22e4c_pzKw.text: LOVED Beef and Bottle!  Like others, I have driven past thisplace for years and been told how good it was, but it was a Living Social that finally got me there. WHY DID I WAIT SO LONG????  I have been to all the fancy steak houses in Charlotte...they are great, but for my money, I will come back to Beef and Bottle every time.  I had the filet and lobster tail combo; for $45 I got a salad, a side item, a 6 oz filet that was expertly prepared and a LARGE lobster tail....you just can't get that quantity of food or quality for $45 anywhere else in CLT.  I also loved the atmosphere; so laid back...it was refreshing.  Folks aren't there to been seen (like at Del Friscos); just there for some great steak/seafood.  Also, on Sunday and Thursday night, wine is 1/2 price by the glass or bottle.  I had a glass of excellent Argentinan Malbec for $3.75 and it was the largest pour I have ever received in a restaurant.  My husband and I each had drinks, steak, lobster tail, salad and sides...and the bill totaled $110.  You won't find that anywhere else  Run, don't walk to Beef and Bottle.

mJd_f1n9R0dqc2Hw2_ttuA.text: Great service, delicious food and an overall great experience. It might now look like much from the outside, but this place is a hidden gem. I go there every time I'm back in Charlotte.

vHuY7gOrVswdG-rPdnomrA.text: In town for business and went here on Monday night . Yes it is old school steak house . It was packed might call first we got lucky and got the seat by the kitchen door and servers / food was soo good that I didn't even notice the seating. Had the onion soup sand friend had scampi appetizer soup was awesome haven't had onion soups since. I was a kid and it was every bit of the cheesey goodness I remember . We both had Cajun ribeye and they were cooked to perfection . Grilled toast/bread is great....yes I would go again and will....

970N4nX-iQECAsUJoVPpPw.text: I've read the reviews below and feel comfortable giving a 4.75-star review to Beef & Bottle.  Here's why:  I called Rick on Tuesday night at 5:40PM and requested a table for two at 6:00PM.  No, I didn't NEED a reservation but upon arriving, Rick greeted me with a handshake and a personal greeting, used my name, and sat me at my "reserved table," as if I were a regular.  I'm not actually on a first name basis with Rick, and I'm not a regular, though I do go there once every three months or so.  All of this personal attention isn't unique to me, it's just the way Beef & Bottle does business and it is one of the ways that they separate themselves from all other steakhouses in Charlotte.  We were greeted instantaneously by our server, whom was quick to suggest a bottle of wine.  Her mid-priced suggestion was appreciated; I quickly lose respect for a restaurant whose staff automatically suggests the most expensive item on the menu. The wine was exactly as promised.   The French Onion soup was perfectly hot, and served quickly with just enough cheese... 4 stars.  My guest was pleasantly surprised by the salad (each person receives a plate of lettuce, and the table receives trays of fresh vegetables to share).  We both ordered NY Strips medium-rare and they were cooked perfectly.  I can say the same for the ribeye and the filets as well. Well seasoned and accompanied with your choice of potato, sweet potato, fries, etc.  I've never eaten dessert here, as I'm always far too full, but they do look delicious.  The 1950s decor (dimly lit, wood paneling) really does add to the atmosphere.  If you've ever seen Goodfellas, you'll think that it's the perfect place to talk about getting somebody "Whacked."   A great place for a date or a business deal or both.  The staff is responsive, warm and welcoming, the drinks are above average, and the steaks are some of the best in town.  My guest, a buddy in from New York, noted repeatedly that B&B is exactly the type of place that a single guy needs to become a regular at for the benefit of his dating life.

m48JcnvC4oRHfOKEQIf8rg.text: My husband and I had a great time at beef n bottle, service was amazing, food was wonderful, we will be going there again!!

LqYMU5qiAAGhRMg2edm7iA.text: This place has absolutely delicious food. I brought my spouse here for a date night, and the lighting was very romantic. We sat down and proceeded to enjoy the best steak and scallops we've ever had in our lives. The mood was very calm and I never felt like I was being rushed. The servers are very friendly and I would go back again any day!

EzaLsecfBjUTi0u0AwWD5Q.text: Perfect. In town for business meetings found this place on Yelp.  It is great. My group loved it. Going back a second time with another group of folks.

8PwHRlbargLIKJZ7grQEUw.text: This was a recommendation from the front desk person at the Marriott.  Normally I shy away from recommended restaurants by hotels, but I thought I would check it out given the strength of the recommendation.   It doesn't look like much from the road, you need to drive around back and park and then you walk through a well-lit area with some sort of air hearing/cooling device that is installed close to where the seats are. This must be the overflow seating or a special events area.   You walk though this area and then down a step into the darkness. It's really dark. A hostess cheerfully greets you and directs you to a candle-lit table with red lights in the ceiling. It takes your eyes a while to adjust to the darkness. It must be the darkest restaurant I've ever been in with the exception of the Buddha Bar in Paris. That's so dark that you have to hold the menu to the candle to see what's available.   After a while I got used to the lack of light and had a great waiter walk me through the menu. The food is not really fancy, but it's very tasty. Their emphasis is on steaks and seafood. I had the shrimp scampi with a salad (huge). For dessert try the apple pie with the melted caramel.   The server was very professional and engaging. It seems like most folks here know each other, it must be a community icon having been around for 50+ years.   All in all a positive experience, definitely a throw-back to the past glories of steakhouses. I left a good sized tip and plan to return to Beef & Bottle for another round the next time I'm in town.

s0QeewB_TAjs4WufrvGjXw.text: Best steak I've ever had.  Even better than Golden Steer in Vegas! Food and service were great.  Very old school feel to the place.  The owner came around to check on us as well.  Definite Charlotte landmark. Only steak place I will visit in Charlotte from now on.

aV8809oxz4IaKmrYIyRuXw.text: Sure do like this  place.  It does not look like much from the outside other than maybe a one-time restaurant popular in a long past era.  BUT...it is still a popular steak house from the 1950s that has that formal aura that you might have experienced at times eating out with your parents.  At least it was with mine.  When you sit down you are served a relish tray and a nice pimento cheese spread with crackers.  THAT is really old time that I remember was common in the 1950s, dying out through the 1960s.  Always thought the relish tray was a class act.  We are stuck in a beef rut always ordering the filet.  The meat is prime quality, at least it looks, tastes and cuts that way and is a treat.  Served with a loaded (or not) baked potato and a couple of fried onion rings you have a wonderful meal.  Dimly lighted, large menu, linen topped tables and attentive and personable wait staff that have been working there for years.  Certainly a special event kind of restaurant and they do have a separate area for larger parties.  Their menu has a lot of other choices, so maybe I will get brave and venture out from the filet...but maybe not?  Their fresh made apple pie is split-able/shareable as you will be full after your meal.  Get it with ice cream...why not?  Wine bottles and glasses of wine are half-price on Mondays and Thursdays.  Why those days is beyond me other than if you do dine here during the week you might get in without a reservation.  But don't count on it, so please reserve ahead.  Weekends are really a mob scene, but regardless of crowds, the service and food quality does not falter.    Great place.

_P8RdI_vFaFr68oVSzY4lA.text: If you don't like steak and you are forced into a steak dinner for your boyfriends 30th birthday, go to Beef N Bottle!!! Everything from the ambience to the staff to the food was awesome!   The inside of the restaurant is so cute. The minute you walk in you feel like you're transported back to the 60s. There are a ton of old pictures up of stars from then and the decor matches t perfectly. It was a very classic feel.   We started at the bar for a few drinks. The bar area isn't super big but big enough to feel intimate with some space if that makes sense. They have some high too seating and some normal tables as well. Seems like an area for a larger party.   We then went into the dining room for dinner. Again, such a beautiful setup. We sat in a huge, high seat booth. Very comfy! Our waitress was very prompt and very friendly especially for how busy she seemed! Definitely make a reservation, this place is busy no matter the time or day!   We started with the crab dip and French onion soup, both amazing. The dip was just the right amount and not too heavy that it filled us up. The French onion soup was the best I've ever had! The cheese was perfect. I ordered the Delmonico with a salad and cheesy fried potatoes and my boyfriend ordered the NY Strip with broccoli and spinach (I think-can't remember!). My salad was so good, weird for just a salad but the way it's presented is great. You get a plain plate of greens and then all the add-ons on the side, so you make your own. And the blue cheese is to die for!!! A must!   My Delmonico was perfect. Cooked to perfection, seasoned perfectly, and tasted great! If I wasn't so full, I probably would have eaten the whole thing!  Cheesy fried potatoes  My boyfriend didn't like the NY strip, he said it was very chewy and not too tasty. So they took it back and gave home a Delmonico instead at no extra charge. Very accommodating! So in the end, we are both pleased. They brought out a birthday Sunday which was also delicious!   I'm already planning my next visit and I can't wait!!

Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab dip
Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States. Birthday fun

c8HZRkm-jvUhWlhDaw6AOg.text: Things have changed - my first visit here a few years ago was perfect. Last night, with a lot of friends, was pretty mixed. Oysters Rockefeller was very good, and the onion rings were outstanding. But when my medium rare delmonico arrived, it was a medium well New York strip instead. Those things are a lot drier and chewier than what I ordered, but since it took over an hour and a half to get the steak, I didn't say anything after the first few bites. After less than half the steak was eaten, I gave up, I just flat didn't like it, it wasn't what I ordered. By then the wait staff was quite scarce. When she finally reappeared to start taking plates, I tried to mention it and she made it quite clear she wasn't concerned at all. I decided not to be an ass in front of everyone, even if it WAS a 34 dollar steak that was substituted for a tougher drier cut and then cooked too long.  On the other hand, they did store a cake we brought (birthday thing for me)  and keep it safe until we wanted it, and they added candles to it when they brought it out for us at the end of the meal. So all in all I liked everything about my birthday dinner legendary steakhouse except the steak. Unfortunately I cannot recommend it to any one any more if they are going to be doing this now.

qAp01BOTUvBAWEjlAATfTA.text: I made a reservation 4 weeks in advance of our dinner Saturday night at 7pm. The night of our reservation I called to confirm the time and was told they needed the table back by 8:30. Ok? Weird.  We were running a few minutes late for our reservation time so we called to let them know and were told again, they needed the table back at 830. Yes, we understand. We arrived at 7:10.  Once again when we checked in at the restaurant the rude hostess practically shouted at us they need the table back by 8:30.  We almost walked out. The only reason we stayed is we were with a friend for his birthday and he had a gift certificate to use.  I understand it is a small restaurant, but they should know better than to so rudely rush their patrons. The server, John, was excellent and gave us no indication that we needed to hurry. In fact he took long time to take our orders. If you need us to leave at a specific time you might want to communicate that to your staff and not stress your patrons into checking their phones every 10 minutes for the time. John did not rush us through our meal nor did he move with any kind of fire when we asked for the check and waited for our receipts. We left at 8:45. I've never been told what time I needed to leave a restaurant. I will not be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States. Time limits for patrons with reservations.

y057Y3_y3Y0dCHiuVq_QUw.text: We've been here twice and have been very happy each time. Its a classic steak house. Definitely recommend requesting to sit inside opposed to the patio when making your reservation as it has so much more character.  Dinner here for two will be $100 plus if you have cocktails, appetizer, and your steak. However, its definitely in line with other top steakhouses and you get what you pay for. We've had the shrimp cocktail (soo good and the sauce will open your sunus'), oysters rockerfeller, and cajun crab dip as appetizer and all ahve been really good. The first time I had the filet and scallops combo and my husband had the filet and fried oysters combo. The last time I had the 6oz filet and my husband had the ribeye special. We both decided to skip the salad and get 2 sides each. We're tried the creamed spinach. fried cheesy potato, asparagus, and mashed potatoes. Again, all have been wonderful. Our server ech time was great and fun! You can bring your own wine and pay the corkerage fee which I did the first time, but did not most recently as I knew I wanted a martini and wine by the glass. When we want a great steak, this is where we go now.

oDS1Mr81yLgXMDvxRsTLHA.text: Ate here for the first time almost 40 years ago. Is one of the "old time" steak houses that were so popular- like The Ranch House (my fav!) for so long.  My food has always been good. But to me it lost some of intimate feel when it expanded.  There has been a loyal customer base that that came weekly and sat at the same table each time. I am sure this older generation is disappearing and don't know if customers will try it without a past link to going there.  But I recommend giving this restaurant a chance & experience the atmosphere of being at a classic steakhouse that has the feel that Sinatra & gang would have hung out here. There is tons of Charlotte history here.

a4PX0Gd7D1ooB_VJ42EXAA.text: This is probably my favorite restaurant in Charlotte. You really can't find a better quality steak for a decent price. The atmosphere inside is awesome so don't let the outside fool ya. Make sure you try this place if you haven't already. Heaven

0kNKJtE8aCwsKkJwwyvmmA.text: Such an amazing restaurant! My boyfriend and I came here for our anniversary dinner and couldn't have been more pleased. Not only was the food amazing (the steaks were cooked to a perfect temperature and mushrooms and mash potatoes were amazing) but the service was fantastic. Everyone from the host to the food runners were so polite and accommodating. Our server, Edwin was the best. He had great recommendations and great conversation. There's no wonder this restaurant has been in business so long. They've stuck to the basics; great food and great service!

OjdxmGtbDfag7BR2fsawuw.text: I only came because I heard they had awesome reviews & were also featured on a tv show.  Very average I must say/  not bad though but definitely not a favorite.  I actually enjoyed my shrimp, oysters & scallops more than I did the steak.  My Cosmo was also awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States. Yummy&#39;  kettle one Cosmo!

Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States. Our sides were also tasty!  Creamed spinach, mashed potatoes &amp; asparagus!

8E3T5bfMFBL8uEcvB-5fHA.text: Definitely one of my favorite restaurants. I always order calamari, frog legs, filet mignon, mashed potatoes, and a red wine. The atmosphere is unique because it doesn't look fancy on the outside at all. Honestly if I didn't know the reputation, I'd probably drive on by. But when you get inside, the service is amazing, the food is even better, and it's really nice to be in a quaint little place. Highly recommended!

6Ty6YrDGVMsaH9iikuWilA.text: This place has been in Charlotte forever and I understand that it's good - but it's not great. While it must be doing well enough to stay open for so long, the culinary scene in Charlotte has evolved immensely over the last several years. The market this type of place appeals to - the market that likes a good (not great) meat and two - is dwindling because there are so many other options and at the same or lower price point for the same/better caliber of food.   I had the filet mignon - good but not great. Ambiance so outdated that it doesn't even have classic charm - it's just dark and loud. Service is fine but not great.   Bottom line - it's cool if you feel like you have to see a Charlotte staple but honestly just go somewhere else. For all the culinary gems this city has to offer you'll be better off.

7BJVtBuAZDizgV2742SBpA.text: Finally made it to the Beef and Bottle after all these years!  Not sure what took so long. My wife and I wanted to go old school this year for our anniversary and the place was superb. We tend to eat out at the newer trendy places but skipped that idea, and so glad we did. Loved the old traditional atmosphere and coziness. Loved sitting with portraits of Clark Gable and Tom Jones over our shoulders and Clint Eastwood across the room! Also, was really nice to hear Billy Holliday singing softly overhead. Our waiter Edwin was perfectly attentive without being overbearing, and even served us a pre-meal bottle of champagne since it was an anniversary reservation we called in.The wife's filet mignon medallions were cooked to perfection, and my filet mignon and salmon in bourbon sauce was supreme! Nice cold beer from the tap and the wife's merlot was outstanding. Get back to the classics, my young friends, and fellow yelpers! You won't regret it!

5izisigsXkk1sYrzeem9Ig.text: Such a great date place!! Took my boyfriend here for his birthday and he loved it! We split a nice bottle of red wine and had the steak and salad!! The waitress was awesome and attentive and gave us suggestions for her favorite wine. The only complaint I have to say is the change we got back from our gift card was not correct and it was honestly a hassle to get the correct amount back. Other then that awesome experience!!

z8TPwd2TyJI_i9qOhvQFag.text: Was told of place from Friend that busted the city. After selling at the 2018 Christmas Show and a long day we thought we were in for a surprise! We had a reservation and was there on time and had to wait. The place was busy and again we had to wait for a waiter to come and show us the menu he was as I saw was in a rush . Finally came to our table was pleasant asked what we would want to drink I myself-just wanted club soda my daughter wine we waited again we ordered prices were high my daughter and wife ordered food came out the steak which my daughter came out on a plate with incision in it we asked about it the waiter said that's how they checked how done it was my wife ordered shrimp didn't look like the quality that should have been prepared for this type restaurant. When my food came out it was cold on inside told waiter about it my food didn't come back until my party was almost done . Would never recommend this place to any of my business associates whom fly in . Good luck ! Also the bathrooms are from 1958 old.

l2U0idVrOR86l7F13gqE0Q.text: Came here for a co workers birthday dinner at the recommendation of some Charlotte locals. Was not disappointed and thoroughly enjoyed a good steak dinner!   Atmosphere: the restaurant is tucked away off a decently busy road out of the Uptown area. From the outside looks like a modest, brown house from the 50's. Upon entering it feels immediately as though you have taken a step back in time to an old school clubhouse. Dark, wood paneled walls, contrasted with stark white table clothes and black and white pictures of icons from past decades adorn the walls. Almost feels like an old New York Italian restaurant. I felt like we should have been wearing bowler hats and puffing on cigars.   Food:  Appetizer: I ordered a cup of clam chowder which was thick and creamy and stock full of potatoes, clams, and some carrots. Only note -- it should have been a bit hotter as it was lukewarm when it was placed in front of me. Tasted homemade.  I didn't order a salad but some others at the table did. All the dressings are made in house with the exception of one (don't remember which) but only heard positive things around the table. Was interesting that additional vegetables for the salad were served on a side platter for everyone to share so you could pick and choose whether you wanted bell peppers or radishes or red onions etc...   Entree: I ordered the filet mignon (6 oz) medium rare with two sides of mashed potatoes and asparagus. I hadn't had steak in a while so this really hit the spot. Perfect medium rare pink inside, very tender and very high quality cut of meat. Each bite was velvety and the steak was well seasoned, letting the flavor of the beef come through well. Nice griddle marks on the outside as well. The onion ring that came with it could have been left off. It didn't taste quite fresh (could have been from the oil) and was very under seasoned. I understand they wanted to include a crunchy garnish but I think it would have been more effective with maybe onion straws or just reworking the batter/ seasoning for the onion ring.  Asparagus was good, nothing spectacular but also not bad. Mashed potatoes had subtle hints of garlic and a was kept slightly chunky which I really enjoyed. Not overly garliced and also not overly salted. A nice creamy complement to the snap of the asparagus and the star that was the filet.   Colleague ordered the surf and turf pictured and I think was silent throughout the whole meal, completely enraptured by the food-- so I assume it was good?   Overall: cool atmosphere, good quality food and a nice and authentic nod to a past time without being over the top or gaudy.
