OPYyqyvbln3eso02TvWYHw.text: The hubby and I went here for dinner the other night. We have always wanted to go and we finally made it. The restaurant itself isn't much to look at. It's a very old building and very dark inside. There isn't really much ambiance it's just very old school.   We got salads to start with. Nothing special here. The waitress said they are known for their blue cheese dressing. I didn't think it was that great. I have had better.  I got the 6 oz fillet and my husband got Fettucini Alfredo. My steak was amazing. Cooked to perfection and melted in my mouth. My husband loved his fettucini and it was a very generous portion.   This place is expensive. The food is ok. I don't think we will go back here. I like more modern places. Not sure why this place is an institution in Charlotte.

eBEN55J1tcgTq856aLqRRw.text: We were recommended to beef and bottle by friends and even people we just asked  "where should we go for ou anniversary ". Many people said the same place. We loved it. Filet Oscar was great. The scallops were a HUGE surprise! The size and the portion were incredible. My wife and I were also giving a free dessert for our anniversary.  Great service and a perfect night out with my bride.

jFbXRI6Q_RS_VzsFrKG4tQ.text: We heard such good things about this place we couldn't wait to try it out. Unfortunately, we were VERY DISAPPOINTED in the experience. First of all, the place is a dump. Knowing that you can get some fantastic food in some divvy places, we were willing to look past the environment.   The hostess walked us to our two-top, bar-height table where she handed both menus to my husband and walked away. Ok??? I'm in a dress and bar-height was not my idea of the perfect table for our celebration. Additionally, there were way too items on the table to function. Two placemats (dinner napkins folded into triangles), two small plates, crackers, cheese, dinnerware, water glasses, and our drinks.... I started to get concerned where the food would sit.    Next comes the waiter. Proceeds to tell me that I shouldn't order fish in a steak place. Oh how I wish I'd listened to him. It was disgusting. My husband's steak was an overlooked cheap cut of meat, so I'm not sure that was a good choice either.   I could go on, but suffice it to say we will NEVER go back. This may have been the place to go back in the day, but its course has run and you should too.

RvCXyFc60tQGEdDXs_LNBQ.text: 1st time at the B&B and my last, waitress/bartender was very nice. Placed my order; salad, appetizer ( which she recommended) and my main course. Salad (nothing to right home about) than came the Ribeye ( Ok not the best) made to order middle rare. Few things were missing, I never received my appetizer and she never asked me if I like a desert. No big deal, but if you recommend a dish, you should make sure I receive my order. The kicker and the main reason I will never step foot into the establishment, while waiting outside for my driver by the front door, a young man in a moron shirt with the restaurant logo starts digging through the ash tray outside, being from a large Metropolitan city I see this all the time by homeless people. After he digging a few bits out, he walks over to another gentleman and asked for a light, takes a few puffs than heads back into the restaurant. Are you kidding me !!!

HVpl747R6Th-6B99uhzk4g.text: Love this place, go there every time I visit Charlotte.  Great steak, potatoes and homemade blue cheese dressing.

ybqcPdZUrpGwiJp5oSUvkg.text: We were evacuated from our island vacation near Charleston and came to this local steakhouse for dinner.  This was an excellent choice for our whole group. Steaks were delicious. A bit dark inside but otherwise the atmosphere was very nice.

HzxG48IWChcqNsTcpL4DPA.text: What can you say about a place that has been serving steaks since 1958? It's an old school steakhouse (or at least what I would expect an old school steakhouse to be like as I am not quite that old). Don't let the exterior or the interior scare you off. The food is fantastic!  We started with a shrimp cocktail--the cocktail sauce has a TON of horseradish, the server warned us. Shrimp were large and good. Followed by a salad-they served each of us with a plate of lettuce and then serve the table a plate of various veggies so you can make your own salad. Pretty cool, light and refreshing. They claim to make the dressings in house. Basic offerings for the dressing---ranch, italian, 1000 island, etc. I ordered the NY strip while the others at my table ordered the filet and a NY strip. My steak was cooked as ordered and served with a loaded baked potato. The others at the table were pleased with what they ordered. Dessert was the only thing lacking. Definitely not made in house and not very good. I had the cheesecake with blueberry topping. Definitely a place to check out if you haven't been!

gDb2THZQ-VYXNDUTpbTR_A.text: My wife and I just ate there over the weekend. The food was delicious . There blue cheese salad dressing was very good. Steaks were cooked to perfection. Price was a little high but you pay for what you get. I gave it a four star because of the sitting. Nobody wants to sit next to the kitchen door.

clUbUSYvzVp6P84ZKMyPbA.text: Steakhouse circa 1971. Perfection. Terrible bathroom but still gets 5 stars. If you come here expecting Ruth Chris you will be disappointed-- so don't expect Ruth Chris. The steaks are better and the decor, price, and service are more relaxed.

WA6hF0ReuCVQ7eWvwGcZWw.text: 2 New Yorkers looking for a good steak at a reasonable price.. found it tonight. NY STRIP was done to perfection , salad fresh, wine was reasonable and service was great considering it was Sat. before Mother's Day, definitely make a reservation you will not be disappointed.

91t0ndIvqXA6DW41X4K3Gg.text: Great staff, amazing food, great prices!! No complaints. Steak was cooked exactly as ordered.  The house salad with home-made Bleu cheese dressing is phenomenal.  As a world traveler, I highly recommend this place. Some of the best food I've ever had!

_ODVIoHmykSkq6NjMuN3IA.text: Food is great! The only problem I have with this place is the bathroom situation. They have one VERY small men's and women's bathroom in the middle of the dining floor with an outside shared sink. For a restaurant that serves fine rich buttery foods this is a mistake. If you have to go everyone will know you blew it up. Very embarrassing.

rP-II7DkszxLgqxiv_-FiA.text: I love the food but the service here leaves something to be desired. This isn't the first time I've had bad service here but it will definitely be the last. The waiters generally ignore you if you aren't ordering multiple entrees, appetizers, and sides.

7_Iqvn1LGoixMea505pbfg.text: Under NO CIRCUMSTANCE will I EVER eat at Beef 'N Bottle again!!!  First, because I was alone, I was seated in a small room off the main dining room, and when I asked the hostess to re-seat me, she said that if I wanted the main dining room, I would have to specify that when making my reservation!!  She refused to seat me at a table that was indeed available, and said that the table I requested had been reserved weeks in advance!  I doubt that.  Then, my waiter finally came, and after taking my drink order, I saw him only once again the ENTIRE evening.  When I wanted a second glass of wine during dinner, I had to ask another wait person.  My meal was less than enjoyable, and I can't imagine why anyone would recommend this place.  Never again!!  I had dined at the Capital Grille the night before, and I wish I had chosen to dine there again rather than waste my evening......and my money......at Beef 'N Bottle!!

SgTL-vX4dM1zmMwBYNlXYg.text: This place was great! We went for our three year anniversary because we had heard so many good things from friends and they were right! We each got filets and it melted in my mouth. I got a Caesar salad with mashed potatoes and both were excellent. I got a great glass of red wine to go with it. We ended our night with key lime pie even though we were stuffed and it was worth it. We will be coming back soon. Great service too! They were all very nice.

U9-swD19lhR2KJJDaMa5gA.text: After reading the reviews, I was really hyped on arrival. I was looking forward to the onion soup which the waiter acknowledged was an "excellent choice". The complimentary cheddar cheese accompanied by cheap crackers was exceptional ! Between the cup and bowl of onion soup we were served, we actually counted  SEVEN pieces if DICED onions ! A nondescript cheese floating on salad croutons and broth completed the dish. My companion pronounced the filet as the best she had  ever had. My choice of the Delmonico fell short of my expectations but it was served rare as requested and I was willing to give the place a second chance. As the waiter remove the plates, he noticed a pile of gristle and a piece of uneaten meat. He said he would talk to the manager as that was below their standards. Now I as impressed ! The manager came by, announced that Delmonico was actually a small ribeye (Hey Rube !) and that gristle was to be expected, turned tail and walked away. An obvious graduate of restaurant management school !. So ended my plans to give the place a second chance.

jLO298J82JF3tCxn_dATPg.text: My wife and I planned our anniversary dinner for 7:00 on July 27, 2017.  We were seated right on time and the waiter asked if we had been there before and we said yes-several times.  Our drink order was taken and we were asked if we were ready to order and we said no, we were going to look over the appetizers first.  When our drinks arrived we ordered an appetizer.  After 17 minutes of being there 7:17, our waiter came to the table rushing us to order and spilled my wine trying to fill the water glasses while trying to ask us for our dinner order again.  We said we needed a few minutes and he said "did you read the sign out front".  My wife said which sign and he said the one that says you have 1 1/2 hours to eat here.  We said we knew that, we have been here several times.  We ordered on his next return, just to get out of there. We experienced the most uncomfortable and rushed dining experience ever.  We were done with the entire meal after 57 minutes, but stayed for the full 1 1/2 hours for spite.  #neverbeefandbottleagain  #worstrestaurantexperienceincharlotte

mraYx_hFgjC4yDdhrerTng.text: I heard a lot about this place. I heard that a lot of our sports celebs eat here etc. So a buddy of mine and I decided to try it out. I ordered the steak - it was crazy expensive but, I figured - it's going to be awesome for this crazy price. It was awful!!!! Full of fat and gristle, I was in shock. The wait staff didn't seem to care at all. I'm horribly disappointed and every time I pass this place - I make sure to comment to whoever is with me - "that place is the worst".  Just because I'm not famous or a football guy, doesn't mean I deserve bad customer service - I can't believe the staff and food were so bad - I paid through the nose and wouldn't dare set foot in this place again. I recommend avoiding it at all cost (and it will cost). Edit 09-25-15 I was talking to a co-worker about worst places to eat in Charlotte - we both came up with this place - just saying - it's not just me.

aazUzoXOUrUsC41wQTWFlA.text: This is my FAVORITE steakhouse in Charlotte!  Yes, it looks like a dump from the outside.  Inside it is dark and romantic with old photos on the walls and cozy booths.  I always get the 6oz filet medium rare.  It is salty perfection, tender and never fatty.  The sides are solid with lots to choose from - the boyfriend made me go to Texas Roadhouse recently and they put BACON in the green beens (which were from a CAN!!!) and i am still having horrific flashbacks.    Beef & Bottle always does it right - super fresh veggies, delicious homeade salad dressings.  The salads are 'make your own' which i LOVE because I can control the portions of the things on my plate and not pick through stuff I dont like.  This is an awesome way to serve salad - everyone should do this!!    We had awesome service and made it out in time to see our musical.  Love you Beef & Bottle!!!  :-D

7b4-PRXkbyNFbBJbLppu6w.text: First of all, I'm from Charlotte and have been eating here for years. I love this place. It's an old school style steakhouse with all the quaint details. The steaks are always cooked to perfection and the apple pie is the stuff of dreams. We actually ordered a bunch of the apple pies to serve at our wedding reception. It is a limited menu but everything that I've tried has been great. They're obviously known for their steaks but the Salmon is delicious also.

-LUksLvDJ_WS9TizYeKVLQ.text: When choosing a restaurant for Valentine's Day dinner we were recommended to go to beef and bottle. We were running a little bit late (13min), but at the time of making the reservation they told me it was an hour and a half table time.  When we arrived at the restaurant it was very disappointing from the outside but had already been warned about that. When we walked inside it was also still very disappointing. It was a very small place with just a bunch of pictures on the walls. Very similar to Bucca de Beppo but less of an ambience. My husband and I heard that the food was amazing so we were still going to give it a try. The hostess said that they gave our table away because we were late. Even though the sign on the door said reservations only. (which means there should've been an open table for the hour and a half.) So we were given a high top table in the bar.  Our waitress was actually the bartender. She was nice but definitely not attentive! The regular dinning table that sat behind us, had a waitress that gave them the list of specials they were offering, what was recommended, etc. (we got non of that!)  Shortly after being sat, the waitress brought a basket of prepackaged crackers  like you would receive on an airplane. No bread or anything. And a dollop of cheese spread. We ordered a bottle of wine and after she poured my glass she took the bottle back behind the bar. Each time I wanted more wine I had to flag her down to bring it back to the table. After the third time I just told her to leave it at the table. My husband and I both ordered salads and were unaware that they would bring us a plate of lettuce and we had to make our own. From the plate of vegetables they also placed on our table.  Our entrees were decent, nothing too exciting but not horrible either. We both ordered the cheesy scalloped potatoes for our sides. When they arrived mine looked pretty good but my husband's were half the size and burnt.  Our waitress did take the burnt ones back and replaced them with ones that looked a little bit better. But there was nothing cheesy about them. It just tasted like a hash brown patty.   Just as others have said, extremely overpriced!  We will NOT be returning!!!

Ehivut6MsZDIhMoUexCcKA.text: I have eaten here too many times to count. You will not feel the need to dress to impress to enjoy the best steak in Charlotte. Took a group and everyone wanted to know when we were going back. The staff is polite and you don't feel like you are treated any different if you are in a suit or shorts.

apN8p9adLc5pUatVXqj5Nw.text: Probably a top 5 steak I've ever had was from here.  The girlfriend and I used a date night oppurtunity last week to dine here and really had no set expectations.  We were blown away by the steaks.  Perfectly seasoned and cooked exactly to our liking (Medium for me).  Outside of that I was left a little underwhelmed.  The salads where brought out as a "build your own" presentation.  Meaning, here's your lettuce, now here is the onions, beets, etc. to put on it.  The girlfriend loved this approach, me on the other hand don't like to work when I'm paying a certain amount.  The side dishes were preseneted in cheap cafeteria style dishes which was another turnoff.  The steak came out directly on a skillet pan which is the old school way to do it and I actually liked that.  I really wish I could get more excited about this place but unfortunately I just can't.  A couple shining stars for me regarding this place is the desert (Carrot Cake).  It was simply perfect.  Great moisture and big enough for two.  The other thing is I do actually like that fact that I don't have to dress up to get a high dollar steak, unlike Capitol Grille, Palm, etc.

XjNT4K_PCP1WvE5ww02eqw.text: I've waited more than 4 years to hit up Beef & Bottle...and I can't give a reason as to why it took me so long. While the exterior definitely looks a bit shady, the interior and overall experience is old school -supper club - Rat Pack - style fun.   Hubs and I serendipitously hit up B&B on a Monday evening...for half price wine night! Yes. The entire wine list, bottles and glasses are half priced on Mondays and Thursdays. And it's most definitely worth noting that the wine list is pretty fab and spans across plenty of taste profiles and price points. Jordan, Cakebread, Mirassou, Cambria, Mondavi, Stags Leap and more.   Let's talk about the meal and the overall experience:  Salad: 4/5: Comes with a steak (or entree). This is appreciated! The dressings are definitely made in house and I like the make-your-own salad option. Veggies were fresh, too.   Filet mignon, 6 oz: 4/5: My filet was cooked as I requested and I enjoyed the nice char on the outside. Mmmm hmmm.   Cocktail shrimp: 2/5: I ordered the special of the evening that came with my choice of a shrimp side. Since I was informed the cocktail sauce was nice and spicy, I went with the shrimp. Sad, small, soggy shrimp. They had no "snap" to them at all. The cocktail sauce, however, was pretty snappy and spicy.   Baked sweet potato: 4/5: Also came with the order. I love me a baked sweet tater. Cinnamon butter sugar on the side!   Onion rings: 5/5: Even though my order only came with one (gratis, natch) I was thiefing onion rings from hubs' plate while he was attacking his strip steak.   Ambiance: 3.5/5: I dig the old school decor, but it super, super dim in here. However, it was almost hard to see your dining partner at times. The booths, however, are large and comfortable and there's an addition added on to the back that looks similar to a covered (and I assume air conditioned) patio.   Service: 5/5: Kindly greeted and seated and our server, Nicole, was friendly and very efficient. We never went without full water and wine glasses and she made sure we always had everything we needed.   I'll definitely head back to Beef & Bottle...it was a good meal and a nice change (price and ambiance) from the other big wig steakhouses in Charlotte.

CDAwVyhNz4jLckGAOz7d0Q.text: 2nd visit for us since we have moved to Carolinas. It is our special place ! Love the atmosphere and the food is the best !!

9yZ0OVS2GL5ryGNDBhnp3w.text: Yeeeeaaaaa.....about that outside. I agree with a yelper who said it looks like a 1970's rural strip joint! Once you go in, it is cozy and warm. I received a very genuine, warm greeting by the hostess.  The restaurant reminded me of when we used to go out to "fancy" (kid lingo for fine dining) restaurants as a child in New York.  The drinks were traditional and made well.  One thing that was perplexing and contributed to the 4 and not a 5 was the cheese wiz cheese and packaged crackers they put on the table prior to the meal (not sure why that was happening).  Our meals came and everything looked yummy! I ordered the rib eye (med rare) and salmon (medium) with baked potato and cream spinach.  If you haven't tried putting cream spinach on a baked potato, just know it is FABULOUS!! Steak was flavorful and you can tell they used and open flame.    It was fairly clean on the inside, thought it could be a tad cleaner. Maybe I was biased after seeing the outside, maybe I just felt dirty walking in. lol.  All in All, good food, fair price, quant environment and good service.  Having all of these categories checked is better to me than having excellent service and crappy food or excellent food and horrible service.  I will definitely be back and I will definitely recommend this place.

-T9PZlV-PPry4um-4Gd5eQ.text: I ate here for the first time on "daddy's night out" after hearing about this place for as long as I can remember. I would give it three-and-half stars instead of three if I knew how because it's good -- not the best steakhouse in the world by a long shot, but decent and worth a visit. I had a gin and tonic that could have been mixed a little better. Instead of some warm, fresh bread to start your meal, you're given a basket of Lance crackers and something that resembles cheese whiz. Oh well, you can live with that. I ordered the ribeye medium rare, with sides of rice pilaf and asparagus. The meat was almost (almost) perfect -- a nice, thick cut; well seasoned, perfectly cooked, juicy and tasty. My only quibble was that a decent chunk of this cut had too much gristle in it. The rice pilaf was only average -- too clumpy, not enough flavor (was there anything in there except rice? No onions?). The asparagus was better -- a BIG helping, tasty and not overcooked. The service was good, maybe because I got there fairly late on a weeknight and the place wasn't too packed. Most of the servers were busy vacuuming the floor and setting things up for the next day. My bill came to $50 -- not too bad considering the size of the ribeye and the massive side of asparagus. I would recommend this place as a decent spot to get good food with a very old-school, informal vibe.

J-cKoVa68l7QGsV2pQRHwA.text: A Charlotte classic. Quality steaks, appetizers, and build your own salads brought to your table. Served in a classic steak house atmosphere.

enmCWX2HggRMEo-LM0PhEQ.text: My go-to meal will always be a steak dinner. My uncle took me to this restaurant for my birthday, and I have been dying to go back. The food was amazing, and the atmosphere was loud, and fun. I also recently heard that they are renovating, which is wonderful news.

dU9T7xrP74LYAYtBnVtbZQ.text: Really enjoyed everything about Beef and Bottle. Thought my rib eye steak was prepared perfectly medium rare. Our waiter Seth was great as well!  Also ordered creamed spinach, mushrooms and mashed potatoes which I really liked.

TL9B1mYlltfAH8fSYrr4Wg.text: Not one to write reviews usually BUT I will never return. My husband and I went with another couple. We had a reservation and were seated promptly. We were then informed that we needed to hurry and order because our table was only ours for ONE HOUR. We were a little dismayed, ordered, had wine, ate. The food was good BUT we were rushed to pay the bill and vacate the table. All four of us agreed that we will not be back. We spent 300 plus$ and were rushed from beginning to end. The whole dinner was ruined by the constant reminders of their time concerns.

pa8xQsiXAJWgegxqIx_vkw.text: Fantastic experience all around. Great food, even better service. We could tell that the staff cared that we were enjoying our dinner. We loved the mushrooms so much that the cook even came out to tell us how she prepared them. That's a personal touch that you don't get anywhere else. Thank you Beef N' Bottle, you will be seeing us again soon.

F3Bt5sPg1yZ9PDeNmmM3CA.text: First time at Beef and Bottle in two years and this experience wasn't as good. We had a reservation and sat in the back room and the heat was broke so the ladies had to wear their coats. My filet was perfect and the asparagus was excellent. The others who had baked potatoes said they were cold. The waiter was slow and not attentive enough.  My buddy's ribeye was good and another had the New York Strip and he said it was average. Overall it was a good experience but not great.

IAaFQ1z8rIYCxW2ji5XyBg.text: Just got done having a birthday dinner here. Ambiance is different a little nostalgic but very cool. Much different from outside. Food was great. I had the ribeye and it was delish and prepared to perfection. I had a side of broccoli which was ok and mashed potatoes. My date had the creamed spinach which was excellent. The food was all amazing. One thing that stood out to me other than the food was the staff. Our waiter Seth was awesome. Some how he had a sixth sense to realize it was my birthday and made the day that much more special. Not kidding on the sixth sense he was a little off cause he asked if it was my dated birthday. When I come back we may even ask for Seth.  Superb job as well by the other staff including the bus boy who did multiple other jobs I noticed. I look forward  to coming again!

vnBCZn0DFoOD4CuQjo8fyg.text: Cannot say enough good things about our meal here. The ambiance, the service, the perfect Food! Phenomenal. Mason was an exceptional server; knowledgable, fun and in-tune with the dining experience we wanted. You can  be sure our first visit to beef n bottle was the first of many! If you're looking for the quintessential steakhouse, look no further.

GatVMluhzlNQqKEhqoRDpw.text: The Beef and Bottle is one cool place to dine!  The atmosphere is great with a lot of old days music and a really nice staff.  The food is top notch!  I will be coming back when I am in the Charlotte area!

nIWxs4IykvkbWru_NP9ZFw.text: My new favorite place in Charlotte. We stopped in strictly by chance on New Years Eve, and we didn't have reservations so we had to sit in bar area. The French onion soup was the best we've ever had, perfection. The salad and dressing was fantastic and both our steak dishes were excellent. The ambiance was very 60's dinner club, and the wait staff was extremely friendly and fast. This place is not in the most frequented part of the city for fine dining but do yourself a huge favor and try it!    Can't wait to return.

PBEASJaPKwqkAZJ86i0Anw.text: So. Ive been here before. Steaks are second to none. Menu is great, service is great. But. And this is a BIG BUT. Be prepared  -  you are on a timer to eat. After dinner, for my mother-in-law's 60th birthday, and them kindly serving a chocolate mush with whipped cream and a sparkler for her (at my request, and free, for the record) I  asked for a dessert menu and a coffee. I was asked to wait a minute to see this that was ok. "What?" I know that's what you are thinking and is exactly what I was thinking.   Apparently there is an undisclosed policy that there is a 90 minute time limit for your meal. No idea if it scales based on your party size, but be sure to ask and avoid this place like the plague if you are intending on a cozy, relaxing meal.   Maybe in the future they will put an egg timer on your table so you can pace your food inhalation properly.  Really dissapointing when you are averaging 50-60 USD/pp to eat a full course meal.

wjnOSqNjKbxNGo144RsiFw.text: Good steak, good service, good experience.  Not cheap and prices right up there with Mortons.  It is old and worn but that gives it some old school charm.  Tried it once, glad I did, but once is enough for me.

uAlX8I1fZi4k0eGMXxyUqA.text: Great food but slow, slow service.  If I wanted another drink it was never an option, I guess 2 is the limit.  Ordered a ribeye on the waitresses recommendation got a strip and it was awesome so whatever, thought she made a mistake.  Got the bill and it was the kitchen that made the mistake as it listed a ribeye.

YRacVrO3edYn-8JZJ2TA3Q.text: I don't know whether to give the fifth star to the ghost or to the steak.  The Globe Road Part One  It wasn't having clouds of dirt kicked into my lungs by children, who if I had been able to get up from the dry-ass baseball diamond in the park and IF I could have caught them bicycle riding hooligans, I should have dragged their small fry tyrannical assets around by one foot in that dirt, just to show how it feels.   I had a friend to meet in the park. It's always good to meet people where, if you feel you are on decent footing with a business, you won't be seen. I felt that. All debts were paid, we had some months where we thought it was going to get a bit touchy, but all in all, we were seeing eye to eye and had business to catch up on. I say a friend like, you know a colleague, with whom I have previously done business and we had always gotten along. Pragmatic and easygoing, like most people who have had a drop or two of blood project into the eye from a bit too much fun-loving roughhousing after someone shows up with a lighter load than they should have. The kind of friend with whom when you have to relieve yourselves in a standoff that your girls enter the fray, take the pistolas so you can go, have a few more drams of mescal, and take the slug pushers back to continue the vigil. That kind of friend.  Apparently I need to pick my friends better because before getting dirtwashed by the guy, all I remember was his left hand and a pretty flash of gold make fireworks shoot from my  right eye.  No it wasn't that.  Maybe it was just the time and place.   We went to Beef and Bottle after my head cleared a little and I was able to tell my associates what I'd remembered.   There's two things, no three things about Charlotte, NC.   1. You can find a strip club on most any corner 2. You can barely find a place to drink 3. The service in this city is hands-down amazing across the board  We weren't looking for this place. I'll tell you that up front. We had found a Mexican joint right on the corner, but since the road to turn from the opposite side of the road is pretty odd and we had to take a hard right to u-turn it. No sooner had we laid eyes on the Beef and Bottle building, we were immediately in lovejoy.   This roadhouse shack that looked perfect for listening to Aerosmith and kicking anyone's ass that was stupid enough to look at me and my bruised eyehole in anything but the most obsequious manner.  Our black and chromed snub-nosed machine bumped up the curb and smoothed into the back lot, where I was shocked to see no Dixie flag waving from any tricked out pickemup truck. Here we were in the south for sh**s sake and at a roadhouse at that, and nary a car to tell me who my future bar fighters would be. My associates, very used to standing behind me by a number of feet, as my haymaker is as wide as it is deadly, begged me under their breaths to not start anything, to which I gave my most polite sound I could muster and walked in the door.  We all just stopped short as we adjusted to the low pink light. I wasn't alone when I thought that the place looked a steakhouse stuck in some type of watermelon jolly rancher colored fly trap.  The left eye adjusted a short amount of time before the other, which gave the room strange checkerboard appearance. Equalized, the checkerboard began to come into focus as Hollywood and Rat Pack type portraits and autographs dating to the  black and white portraits hung from the walls.  This change of expectation was almost as sparkly as my brass knuckle sandwich earlier that day. But the smell of Grilled steak and butter soothed my troubled soul like my baby's gentle red lips funneling her warm breath on my neck and onto the back of my ear. A Steak House!  Not just any steak house though. As we drifted in, the ambiance surrounded us. The tuxedo music and the dark wood walls and the pink lighting made everything as 1950's as it was any time. We could have been anywhere, plucked out of orbit, placed on an asteroid, hurtling toward and away from the sun, we could have been in SiriSiri BomBon, we could have been anywhere and this place would have made us feel completely flawlessly anywhere. In the dining room were quite tables of couples polishing off quantities of meat barely squaring a glare at us as would normally happen when a couple suits and a burly do-ragged leather wearing mother f@@ers walk in to most any respectable box. It literally was the rose light that made everything seem no less intense, yet non-threatening.  The waitresses there were all career women, even the cute petite blond who circled around us a few times over our stay. It was getting on in the evening, so none of us were really in the mood to share many improbable pleasantries. In fact the table behind us was filled with polished silver and glass to set the longish table w I ordered the fillet. Tho others ordered other meat cuts and to keep it all sanguine, we also had a house red brought to the table.

plhXu9swqesbrNrxdpkvvw.text: Picked this restaurant based on reviews and had family come to town to celebrate my daughter's 25th birthday. Atmosphere is what we expected and all steaks were cooked to perfection. Unfortunately the sides were served luke warm. The creamed spinach tasted more like a dip and the mushrooms were cold.  Our bread came late and the server just didn't seem like she knew what she was suppose to do. We never did get cheese and crackers.It was a busy night but shouldn't be an excuse.

0w-kF_pWfQ9xUupjQeHfWA.text: I am not a "steak person" and apparently made all of the faux pas you can make: I asked for it well done, and I asked for A-1.  Our server was Dean and he was awesome.  He held my dumb hand through all of my uninformed requests while my husband mocked me.  Keaton at the bar is a fantastic server and bartender and very friendly.  My revised steak order was fabulous, even with the cursed A-1 on top.  The peanut butter pie was ah-mazing as well. I had a great evening and I can't wait to return!

iqnm7KXRxlOHg8X6FVKxnw.text: Had something new happen when we went to Beef 'n Bottle for our anniversary.  We had a 7 pm reservation and arrived at 6:50 figuring we would wait for our table to open up.  Sat down right at 7.  My first clue should have been how fast our appetizer and salad came out. Our steaks came out pretty fast too.  Long story short we were finishing up our meal just slightly after 8.  Why is that significant?  Because as we contemplated dessert our waiter notified us that our 90 minutes were almost up and we likely wouldn't have time to order dessert unless we did so immediately.  I've never heard of a restaurant keeping a clock on customers but sure enough a manager came over to tell us each table has a 90 minute limit before they refuse to allow the customer to order anything else.  They have enjoyed the last dollar I will ever spend there.

wL2s3b_zC6xF5ctKU9ppfw.text: Delicious. Loved the crab dip and my steak was excellent.  Very good service. Enjoyed my experience thoroughly. Very pricey for what you get took a long time.

photos.caption: Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States

abVudRkx0VPMfmS_-2XE4A.text: Went Saturday night and Keaton was the bartender...she was amazing! Shrimp cocktail was on point! Spicy ! Filet was cooked to rare perfection! Sweet potato was huge and I couldn't even get to the mushrooms. Dirty martini with blue cheese stuffed olives were great too. I will definitely be back for dessert!!

hKhMW1ZKIvhdX82wDeWnNw.text: Ran into this place this evening after a Long day of work and the outside does NOT match the inside. It has about the best steak and crab legs I've ever had in my life! Go here for a romantic date or anniversary. The prices are up there but worth it! Go here one day, you'll never regret it!

K7Ptj2912imtPLnMLNu1HA.text: It's a time warp baby!  If experiencing a piece of Charlotte history is your jam this spot comes with a side of nostalgia.   Good stuff:  Ample parking Can make a reservation on Open Table Steaks are yummy Food comes out fast! The service is warm and inviting  Not the best: Food comes out fast, like scary fast. Our shrimp cocktail was on the table 30 seconds after we ordered it which made me feel like it had just been chilling in the kitchen.  For the price you can get equally good food elsewhere / more innovative food elsewhere  The sides that aren't covered in butter are pretty under seasoned

y4uxpRXK_JLwwKg607BrOg.text: Waiter was great. Very knowledgeable and enthusiastic.  Food was INCREDIBLE. By far, best steak I've ever eaten. Not an exaggeration.  Will say that everything was pretty pricey but you definitely get what you pay for.  Honestly the only thing I didn't like was the noise. It was deafening at times. But on average, still louder than a dull roar. Had to elevate our voices most of the night to have conversation.

SAtpow2wKPcrwC_QGrMRKA.text: Best steakhouse in Charlotte! Hidden behind the dated facade of a small building on South Blvd, you'll find a packed restaurant of locals who know where to find the best steak, staff, and salad dressing around!   A reservation is recommended, but not required - except you may end up with a very long wait time on a Friday or Saturday evening.   If you enjoy a kick of heat, start with the shrimp cocktail and go easy on the horseradish for your first shrimp. You'll find that the cocktail sauce will light you up - then you can gauge whether you can handle more on the next shrimp. More is better, but beware the nasal cleanse.   They have house-made salad dressings that make the house salad a great choice and you'll share a platter or vegetables to add. They also offer a Caesar salad that is equally delicious. (Not homemade, they'll remind you, but you still can't go wrong with it!)  Main entrees come in a number of varieties, but after the shrimp and salad, I stick with a simple filet, medium rare, and a side of potatoes. The onion rings are great, but each steak comes with an onion ring on top, so you get to enjoy one with an additional side.   Great place for a date or group of friends celebrating a birthday. Check it out!

a817bRY2DBADgTvUK5Xdjg.text: The only reason for 2 stars is because there was 1/2 priced wine and our server was nice. First we had a reservation and still had to wait even with clean open tables in the restaurant. Then we try to order 2 different appetizers, both of which were not available. The salad was from the 1950s which you build yourself. Maybe I was wrong for ordering the crab cakes hence the name, beef n bottles. Mind you this is not my first experience in "fine dinning" experience I have never had crab cakes that were deep fried. My husband said is steak was good. I can get a good steak anywhere without spending $175.

xjD9s2vFGltjik3Zf5Oj8A.text: I love the feel and atmosphere of this old steakhouse. I moved to Charlotte recently and loved hearing about all the history of this place. The aides and salad made my meal. The steak was not the best I've had but hoping it was just a because it was over cooked. The waitress and staff were so kind and helpful I will definitely go back! And I love being able to bring your own bottle of wine for a small corking fee. ($15)

photos.caption: Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States

Z8baoINhKfWYYRIg100tsQ.text: Absolutely love this place. Service was not a 10 but it wasn't 0 either. Looks like a home in a wall,but is a delicious establishment. Of recommend as look forward to returning with gaunt in a few weeks

I_0CjbElqgIkbUWa3n-aJA.text: Our experience was amazing! We were early and the table wasn't ready so we had a drink at the bar and the bartender was awesome. I forgot her name but she has worked there for 30 years and was funny and responsive to our requests. Our waitress Krystal was really friendly and professional. She was very helpful and made excellent suggestions.   The ambience of the restaurant is just awesome compared to how interesting it looks on the outside. You think a "hole in the wall" bar but on the inside it's a five-star, gourmet, upscale, white table cloth restaurant.    I highly recommend this hidden gem to anyone in Charlotte or visiting the area. We will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States. I recommend the bourbon salmon and the filet! Crab legs were awesome too but that is something I only get every now and again.

ZXuBUw7qccnVrGh-SH1Tog.text: Didn't even want to give this place 1star. Just left eating an excellent meal, BUT the server was racist. We were served by Lisa S sitting at table B-5 Friday night 03/29/19. While leaving in the parking (already in the car) my husband and I were stopped in the parking lot by the security and the waitress and was asked for our receipt. We were accused of not leaving our receipt with the signature. (I believe the waitress was concerned about her tip in which I know for sure my husband tipped) Mind you her service wasn't the greatest. She only checked on us once throughout the time we were there. And another server even took our order. Never in my life have I been accused of dining and dashing. She made it seem like we did not pay the bill. It's a shame that I have to experience something like this in 2019. I like to experience the nice  restaurants of Charlotte as we all should equally without being racially profiled. After experiencing this type of service I would not go back or recommend this establishment to eat.

tedHq7zbMRyj541uELPL8Q.text: Best Steakhouse in Charlotte! Went for first time and it was amazing! I will definitely be back!!!! FYI make a reservation...this place was busy!

sGh50dEHz2TDT-1S7Wcbvg.text: Long before Charlotte had a Capital Grille, a Del Frisco's, TWO Ruth's Chris's, and a Morton's, the only place in town to enjoy a great steak was probably Beef 'N Bottle, a freestanding joint on South Blvd that looks it could stand in for a the bar scene in GoodFellas ('I'm funny HOW?"). Native Charlotteans will swear by this place, but after my first visit, I suspect it's more out of nostalgia than anything else.   The wine list had some outstanding selections at prices to fit every budget, the signature Shrimp Cocktail appetizer was out of this world, and the service was excellent -- our party of 12 never felt like we had to wait for a server to attend to us.   But the steak itself was just OK. My Delmonico was tasty, but a bit overdone, and the filet my wife ordered was decent but forgettable. Yes, Beef 'N Bottle has some great character (although it could use larger restrooms), but with so many great steakhouses to choose from in the Queen City, this divey '50s holdout doesn't quite measure up.

AihsboZQpHIHB0EmQTlJeQ.text: "I ate so much, my butt hurt" - "but in a good way" - True quote  Yes, we had one of those meals where you consume such massive quantities of food that you gain enough weight to cause your legs and/or butt to fall asleep.   Beef and Bottle is straight up Hoboken New Jersey, Frank Sinatra/Rat Pack pimp. The only things missing are the velvet curtains and the ghost of Sammy Davis Junior.  It was no mistake that we ended up here on  1/2 price bottle of wine night and no mistake that Jon H and I were wearing bow ties so sharp they could cut through glass.  After the first bottle of Chilean Cab, it started raining appetizers. The Gulf oysters were so big and plump compared to their shells, I wondered if they had been evicted from their previous shells; that's what happens when shellfish don't pay their rent. The house cocktail sauce was loaded with fresh horseradish! Feel the burn! To this day I still have a piece of the cheese from the crock of House Made French Onion Soup lodged in my arteries, and I think I like it. Piping hot ooey gooey onion packed goodness! Warm crab dip- mmm. Build your own house salads with some of the chunkiest fresh blue cheese dressing I've had!  Our belly tanks were pretty much full when the main courses came. My Delmonico was cooked a perfect medium rare. If you've never had a Delmonico, you must - it's the heart of the ribeye and is packed with flavor. I ate half of her, until she twisted my arm and I said "UNCLE!". Well, that's what doggie bags are for. Tomorrow's breakfast = steak and eggs.  After loosening my pants - I tried the desserts that were passed around the table. The apple pie is so good you will take the Lord's name in vain and the Key Lime Pie will make you do an Olympic backflip (in your mind because you can't move at this point).  Our waiter informed us that the kitchen had recently been remodeled to maintain the quality and consistency of their awesome food. Now that's what I like to hear.   Bring plenty of moolah, plenty of good friends and wear pants with an elastic waistband!!

Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States

wfgTa202vrH7jlCPc91tCg.text: I know, I know, it's a Charlotte institution. Maybe I just don't get it. For me, Beef 'N Bottle is like reading The Great Gatsby; everyone tells you that it's amazing, but in the end, there are very few likable characters and you're left feeling like you wasted your time.  I'll start with the positives. I had no trouble making a same-day reservation, and we were seated immediately upon entering, even though we rolled in a bit early. Parking was a cinch. Our server was knowledgable and attentive. The menu is easy to navigate, and the kitchen is happy to customize your meal. Everything we ordered came out in a reasonable amount of time, and we left with full bellies.  There were, however, a handful of things that keep me from raving about Beef 'N Bottle like so many others. First, when our hostess seated us, she asked if we were celebrating anything that evening. I mentioned that it was my date's birthday. When our server greeted us a moment later, he came bearing glasses of champagne, declaring "happy anniversary!" Close enough.   The two of us were sat at a four-top table in the center of the restaurant. A wooden pillar was between our table and the next, and it's apparently used as storage for that folding table waiters use to support their trays upon serving. This led to servers reaching around us several times during our visit to grab the folding table and tossing it back with a clunk once their tables had been served.   We decided to start with a dozen raw oysters. I'm familiar with gulf oysters and know that their consistency is different from east coasters, but I still feel like you shouldn't *have* to chew your oysters. I could be wrong, but this tells me that those guys weren't at all fresh. Next we had the shrimp cocktail. The shrimp were enormous and presented well. Our server mentioned that "they like to make the cocktail sauce spicy," but even his warning didn't prepare us for the horseradish assault we were about to experience. I'll be sure to come back next time I have a cold, because that sauce cleared my sinuses within seconds.    Can we talk about the famous salad? While the bleu cheese dressing was exceptional, I can't understand why we're all so excited about building our own salads. The iceberg lettuce and provided toppings are basic at best, sliced too large for easy eating, and utterly wasteful given that the puny plate you're provided won't hold half of what you're served.   Our entrees came soon after. I had the filet and scallops, and I added crab meat on top. My four large scallops were served in a pool of wine butter sauce, which was easily the highlight of my meal -- my steak, though ordered medium, was quite dry and the butter was necessary. The scallops were tender, however, they still had the "foot" muscle attached, and both of us found shells in the crab meat atop our steaks. I can't help but feel that when you pay $50+ per entree, you shouldn't have to pluck inedible pieces out of your mouth.   Overall, Beef 'N Bottle didn't live up to the hype for me. Now that we've crossed it off our list, I can't imagine we'll bother with another visit.

6y6Sq9gUUL2VoJTZhPVBKA.text: This is a five minute walk from the four points Sheraton hotel. Had the clam chowder soup and crab cakes. The soup was good tasting but just luke warm. I mentioned this to our waiter and he said that they were having a electricial problem.   The crab cakes were large and tasty.   Wife had a grilled chicken salad (huge) and a glass of wine.  $52.00 bill

J0S4xIaPkT1GwTxV2Xhvgw.text: Old School!  This is like no other steakhouse in this city!  What a great special occasion or date spot.  They have a cool setup in here, don't let the exterior ward you off.  Better make a reservation too, place fills up every weekend.  Now to the food!  We went with a group of six to celebrate our upcoming nuptials.  We got the large shrimp cocktail, it was really fresh and comes with homemade cocktail sauce!  That is a theme here as most everything that can be made in house, is. The cocktail sauce is spicy so get ready!  After that we all ordered our entrees which include a side of your choice and a salad.  Not just any salad but a do it yourself salad bar that is brought to your table. I know that you are not following me, let me explain.  You get a plate of lettuce, option to add cheese and bacon, I of course did.  Then they bring a plate of all kinds of salad veggies for yeh table so you can add what you want to your salad.  Then the most exciting part, they bring the homemade salad dressing boat for you to choose your favorite dressing or two :).  The ranch and blue cheese are too thick to pour, I repeat too thick to pour.  You kind of just spoon them on your plate, mix up your salad and fall in love with it.  I don't even normally eat much salad but this is salad plus plus.  After that they bring your steak, ny strip for me, in a plate of warm butter to just push the experience to the stratosphere.  I had a side of asparagus, on a no carb diet.  They were perfect but I want to come back for the giant baked potato!  They have a solid craft beer selection, incredible wine list and a full liquor bar.  All in all, just a wonderful dinning experience.  See you again soon Beef and Bottle!

photos.caption: Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States. My 16oz NY strip topped with king crab and their signature onion ring!

LYXCkaGG1Fb5oB5GqipO6w.text: Loved everything about this place, from the quality food to the service to the ambiance. Not inexpensive, but worth every penny. Ordered the oysters and shrimp cocktail as appetizers (should have ordered 6 shrimp instead of 20 for just two of us). The cocktail sauce was spicy, but not too much so. Oysters were plump and tasty. I ordered the 10 oz filet and wife ordered 6 oz filet and scallops scampi. Filet was perfectly cooked (medium rare) for both of us, and scallops were equally delicious. Server was very professional and paid us the right amount of attention. Will absolutely be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States. Filet and scallops on far side.
Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States. 20 count shrimp cocktail.
Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States. 10 oz filet

n4MOzrrln85ABVOC_bhmFQ.text: Used to be our favorite.  Went last night and will never go back.  My view was an open coat Closet and it was a mess.  Our waiter Chip gave me attitude.  The food is delicious but for the price there are way too many other options.  When you are paying 35.00 for a steak the ambiance should be very nice and so should the service.  Sorry Beef and Bottle you lost what used to be a very satisfied customer.

afA85yOFD1X-eVpEVdpFPA.text: VERY GOOD . Very casual and who needs to dress to impress anyways? The food is what matters in my opinion. Step back in time. I have eaten at more steakhouses than most all over the USA. I'm visiting from out of state and working in Charlotte NC this weekend.  My work requires me to travel constantly coast to coast as well as internationally. So I have a lot to compare it to. Was the steaks spectacular ? No but it certainly was a step up from outback and other chains. I had the Filet Mignon (always my favorite) and lobster tail ,clam chowder ,sauteed mushrooms and I also gave the fired oysters a try as I'd never had this dish before. The clam chowder was amazing,the filets and the rest was cooked right. My waitress Crystal was on top of things and made sure I was taken well care of. All in all- I'd come back again. I give 5 stars ONLY to steakhouses where the filet mignon is so tender it can easily be cut with just a fork and no knife is needed. Beef and bottle needed a knife (as most places do) to cut the steak. Very good and I recommend it . Ask for Crystal if u want the best service .

photos.caption: Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States. Filet Filet Mignon &amp; Lobster Tail - was good
Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States. Clam chowder was the very best I&#39;ve had in years and I&#39;m from the New England region
Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried oysters where delicious

27d80LWs2ZCu0kkFCNsFCA.text: My husband and I went to Beef & Bottle tonight for our anniversary dinner.  It had come recommended to us by co-workers, and we also had a Groupon giving us a discount.  It seemed like as a good a choice as any.  Driving into the parking lot the place looked like a dive.  Seriously - the place has NO curb appeal whatsoever.  I was a bit worried.  We walked in the entrance facing South Blvd. and I was afraid I'd fall - it was SO dark inside that it took me a full minute for my eyes to adjust.  However, once they did finally adjust I was charmed by the interior.  Like it was straight out of the 1960s, this place was all wood - on the walls, the seats, the booths.  I love "old man" restaurants, and this one perfectly fit that ambiance bill for me.  Food ordered: Frog legs and shrimp scampi for appetizer. We had never had frog legs before and figured we'd go for it.  They taste just like chicken!  And were delicious.  The shrimp was also good - the butter/garlic was great and I was happy that we had bread on the plate so we could dip and enjoy that garlicy butter even after the shrimp was gone.  We also got salads with the meal.  As other people have said, the salads are done as "make your own," which was perfect for me.  I'm a minimalist with my salads.  I just want lettuce and dressing.  99% of the time when I get salads at restaurants I have to scrape off all the junk (cheese, carrots, tomatoes, cukes, etc.) and then I get to "enjoy" two bites of lettuce.  Not so at B&B!  I got to enjoy a full plate of lettuce with some of their home made ranch dressing (which was delicious as well).  Special sirloin steak with fries/baked potato for entrees. I ordered medium rare and it came perfectly cooked.  My husband ordered medium and it, too, was perfectly good.  The presentation was nothing fancy - just a piece of steak on a plate with a large onion ring.  The potato/fries came in bowls on the side.  This is not nouveau cooking.  But then, it's not supposed to be.  It's a steak place.  And my steak was delicious.  Buttery soft and just red enough in the middle to be close to rare - it was fantastic.  Chocolate silk pie for dessert. The slice of pie was huge - but a perfect serving for two people to split.  It had good flavor and was a nice way to finish the meal.  From beginning to end I thoroughly enjoyed our meal.  My husband did as well.    The only negatives were the drinks.  They didn't have the kind of liquor I usually drink, so I opted to have only water.  Their water glasses are very small, so I ended up having 10 refills during the meal.  Bigger water glasses would be better for the staff - our poor waitress ran a mile refilling my glass alone!  The other negative was the size of their beers.  It's a half pint if it's lucky.  But that's literally the only complaint I had.  This place is my new favorite steak place in Charlotte.  I will be telling everyone I know to check it out at their soonest opportunity!

dvK7vFYOw2GKFK6niURJoQ.text: The food was very poor.  The side items were cold, really cold.  The steaks were ok.  Two of us got a lobster tail added to our meal.  Both were inedible.  They were so tough that I had to ask for a steak knife to cut it.  It was sooooo terrible.  The best part was our arrival.  We made a reservation 1 week in advance for 5:30.  We got there at 5:20 and as we were pulling into the parking lot they were calling me on my cell phone asking me were we were.  I explained that we were walking in right now.  As we walked in, the owner yelled at me and told me and my guests that we would have to vacate our table by 7:00, no matter what.  If we were not finished, too bad.  We had to be out the door at 7!  As he walked us to our table the server gave us a sneer,and every time he walked past our table he tried to clear our salad or plate regardless if we were still eating.  He would not bring me a beer after dinner telling me that we did not have time.  Hope they get treated as badly as they treated us.

ZZBumvDjT8TS5TPNbIdahg.text: While I was here about a month ago on a business trip, I can agree with many about the old skool flava this place exudes when you walk in.   I personally enjoyed the ambience as im a big Rat Pack fan--and I had great company to enjoy it with. While the meal was 'meh' the drinks were cheap, desert was good and the parties seated next to us were a blast to chat with too.   Being from Dallas, we have lots of steak choices so I didn't think much of the steak but it reminded me of The Old Warsaw in Dallas, which is still going strong!

TlQldhFrsHLxb6zoMF8AGw.text: After a long day of flight delays we were looking for a nice place for dinner. Little did we know how good the place we picked would be. This restaurant that has been around since 1958 is right up my alley. It looks like a little hole in the wall but once inside you realize what a hidden gem it is. Our party of four were greater by fantastic, attentive waitress (Diane) who has worked there ten years. Her attitude and service was perfect. We ordered a nice red wine, appetizers, and our meal. The appetizers consisted of the escargot and the two napkin (be ready for the heat!!) shrimp and sauce. Both were amazing. Two filets and two delmonico steaks were ordered with a baked potato, a sweet potato, creamed spinach, and giant "tater tots". Everything was cooked to perfection and were some of the best steaks and sides we have had in years.  We were too stuffed for dessert by veiled love to try them!  Thank you for turning a very hard, frustrating, stressful travel day into something memorable. If you are ever in the area please give this place a try!!

HO4pXFQE00qQ-N2g0vBn7A.text: I've been eating here for 18 years. They are a True steak house. High back seating. Great atmosphere. Above all though really great steak.

-s8NXC8-tYJtYLqL77noCA.text: Saw a nice write up in the local paper so decided to give it a try. Service was friendly but lacking. Food was cold from appetizer to entree. If you want fine dinning and a quality steak stick with Sullivan's or The Palm.

w0h6IWiXS96q37CuC_NcUA.text: This place is an old school steakhouse. Absolutely delicious!! Hidden gem. This type of place is a dying breed. If I lived here it would be a regular spot. Ask for Chip!

0ptEVw4YDTJTyM9hZZVtsQ.text: We had the ribeye was cooked exactly medium rare! Also had the French onion soup., YUM! Drinks were very good.. Ask for Jamie or Sherri ! Ok ...had to have dessert had apple pie with cinnamon ice cream, enough said

IoJ7tOzvWFZrbzCAbaRqYg.text: High on nostalgia but not much else. The shrimp cocktail and oysters rock were okay, nothing special. I had the filet and lobster, and it was good but not great. The hubs had filet and fried oysters, and, again, it was fine. That was a theme. Everything was fine but nothing was great. The restaurant itself is far too dark and in great need of some updating. I get what they're going for, but it's not our thing. We won't be back.

znUw3fGrenQQ_3y4-UPW_A.text: I've been here twice now. Second time was for a bachelorette party. I appreciate that everything isn't a la carte like other high end steakhouses. Their steaks aren't cheap but they don't match the price. At the end of my first visit I felt like I would have gotten my moneys worth at Outback. I wouldn't have gotten the greatest steak at Outback, but I wouldn't have felt cheated either. Second visit I went with the kabobs. Haven't had those in ages and I felt the price was right. I liked the old school salad presentation. I didn't order the onion rings this time because they were cold on the first visit. The waitress recommended the home fried potatoes. Meal arrives and the beef on the kabobs had no flavor at all. Salt and pepper didn't even help. The home fried potatoes are nothing more than recycled mashed or baked potatoes formed into a giant tater tot type dish. This was equally bland. Could have easily been a great dish with some salt and pepper and some fresh herbs. Only way I'd come back is if someone else is buying. I'd rather spend my money on a great steak at Ruth Chris or Flemings

_jyLzSz7OzYz5QmOovMCRA.text: I took my wife to the Beef and Bottle last Friday. We could not have had a better time. We were greeted promptly, asked if we had a reservation, which we did and seated immediately. Diane came to our table and gave us a brief introduction, she was very friendly. We were then greeted by our server Lauren, she gave us a warm welcome and offered us a drink, she came back with a great Cosmo and a Tom Collins that were perfect. Lauren explained the features of the evening, prime rib and filet and lobster tail. She suggested the shrimp scampi as a appetizer, so we started with that, good call! Best we ever had! My wife ordered the filet and I ordered the feature filet and lobster. These steaks melted in your mouth, the Lobster tail was huge and cooked to perfection! From start to finish our meal was outstanding. We will be back, and often.  Thanks for a great night!

Kju3KNHZFYLl9zdKi1bFDQ.text: I did not expect this place to be so packed on a Monday night as it was! There were even people who drove all the way from Georgia to get to this place! It's pretty dim in here and there's a sudden drop going from the bar to the main dining area in the back. I hate layouts like this, I'm always confused if I should walk to the back where the host/ess is or stand around till they come up to me.  Anyways seated and ready for to chow down I had originally come here because I heard they have a killer French onion soup which I was really craving, and since I was already here I figured let's just splurge and go all the way with it.  This would probably be one of the few times a year I eat beef I planned to gorge on it and have a meat hangover the next day. I selected a NY strip encrusted with bleu cheese, and side salad along with the french onion soup of course. The salad came out first while I was working on the complimentary cheddar and crackers, the presentation for this is kind of lacking, and cutting it up into more edible pieces was quite a challenge with only a butter knife to work with, but the ranch more than made up for it. Creamy dreamy goodness and you can tell that it was made with love. Next came the glorious french onion soup, steaming hot and topped with a nice crust of cheesy goodness! The only fault I could find was bread was a bit too soggy and was in the process of dissolving into the soup, but oh god the broth was incredible! Beefy flavorful goodness that leaves you with a warm comforting feeling, this is the epitome the feelings I think soup should stir in you when eaten. The steak brought out shortly afterwards sizzling on a hot skillet amused me a bit. Because that just meant I'd be waiting the 7-10 minutes for a steak of that size to "rest" or risk ending up with a less than satisfactory steak. I think they should have mentioned that because most people would just dig in and that would be a disservice to the excellent quality of steak they offer here. After waiting around and getting stared at by some fellow diners for just sitting around while a steak was in front of me I finally decided to cut in to it and the flavors were right on point. Perfectly developed and seasoned, however I'd say go a bit easier on the butter that you brush onto the steak before serving. I ended up just scraping the bleu cheese off because the steak was done so perfectly that I didn't feel like it needed it.  The service throughout all of this was impeccable. Personable, charming, informative, and attentive without being intrusive at all. I'd say one of the best services I've received in a restaurant so far. I don't really like the way the restaurant is set up but I loved the rest of the experience. Return trips shall have to be planned.

rbGxw2lglMkpvSYyTa3zIg.text: I see a lot of good reviews here, but I cannot add to it. We came on a week day. We were not dressed up, but we were wearing good clothes. They took us to a back room and seated us at a table in the middle. We waited 15 minutes for someone to cone around with water and tell us our waiter would be with us shortly. After another ten minutes, we got up and left. I doubt they even noticed.

4pE-ryG85KncuA2q4SWXtw.text: Undoubtedly the rudest management in the City of Charlotte I wouldn't go there if was the only restaurant in Charlotte!!!!  I had a voucher from Liviing Social which was to expire in September 25th which I was going to use on the day but an emergency came up and I could not use it.  I called Living Social and asked what could be done they advised me to call the restaurant and ask for an extension to the following weekend which I did.  I asked for a manager and told him of my problem the answer was YOU HAVE HAD ENOUGH TIME TO USE YOUR VOUCHER GOODBYE!!!!!  There are so many fine steak houses in Charlotte that want to accommodate customers then why go to one like this.  After reading the other reviews on Living Social about the rudeness of the staff and their service much less there food I tore up the voucher why waste any more money on a 3rd class restaurant~~

u07z22G9NWIniOETDv6ZVw.text: I will start this review with the fact that I have had absolutely nothing to eat here.  This is because we made a reservation for 7:30 and upon arrival were snubbed.  We checked in with the host at 7:25.  At 7:32 an older man and his girlfriend walked in.  She immediately began rudely letting the wait staff know that they had a reservation and was concerned that they were not immediately seated.  At 7:34 she let them know again that they had a 7:30 reservation (same as mine).  The hostess then said, "right this way" and took them to their table.  As a reminder we were there before they were and had a reservation for the same time.  I inquired if there was a booth available since the couple that was just seated before us was put in a booth.  I was told that I had to request it for my reservation.  They then escorted us to a table that was a full 3 inches from the 4 top next to it.  At that point we started to walk out because we were not interested in eating with another party on our date night and were not happy about the way in which we had been treated.  The host intercepted us on the way out and apologized explaining that the person seated before us had been coming there for 40 years.  So, moral of the story, when making a reservation here first request a booth as part of your reservation and second pray that an extremely rude regular does not show up at the same time as the staff will rally around them and do nothing to secure a future regular!

seKbhkK7H-FCW42qEw7B0Q.text: Beef & Bottle  Great service, good food blast from the past.

JoH2Fjh1XlpjfIQhXWwTvg.text: If you like the early 1960s you will love this place if not stay away!  Food was average minus, walls were very dirty, service decent.  Would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.  I was told this restaurant was like Ruth Chris, don't believe it! Stay away.

Tki8-8LwdVmhDfJhAytexg.text: Old school place with great food and decent prices for an upper end steak house. One of my favs in CLT.

FDS_syazean457gk2TQCEw.text: After conducting an internet search while on a recent business trip for the best steak in Charlotte and wanting to avoid the high-end chains for a little something off the beaten path, I decided to try Beef and Bottle which was included on several Top 10 lists of the best steak in Charlotte. The first point of note is that parking is limited and there is no designated "overflow" parking so you have to take your chances parking in neighboring business' lot- I didn't have a problem, just a heads-up. Now to the service and food. After a brief wait for a table, I was seated in a small room with 5 tables with seating for two and one larger table. After being seated I waited at least 10 minutes before someone took my drink order and since I had plenty of time to review the menu I went ahead and ordered the ribeye with sauteed mushrooms and a bowl of she-crab soup. The soup came out quickly and was by far the best part of the entire dining experience- delicious! The service (re-filling water and drink) was average but very polite throughout the meal. The steak was average at best, but because it was $39 I would actually call it below average for the price. The steak, while cooked correctly at medium-rare, had very little flavor and was actually difficult to cut. It was served on a plate that reminded me of the old Western Steer / Sizzlin steak houses and I would actually equate the quality and taste of the steak to Western Steer / Sizzlin at twice the price. The bottom line is in my opinion Beef and Bottle is significantly overrated and overpriced.

uIyA6qTuAshD04G_CRfftA.text: I had read some of the reviews and usually take with a grain of salt that people are a bit picky/childish at times.  I am glad I ignored the low ratings as we had a wonderful experience.  In fact, it was one of the best evenings I have had in a few years.  The wait staff was attentive to us and did not rush our evening or bother for no reason.  It was a Monday night and not really busy, so would put into context, however the food was wonderful.  A build your own salad from a platter.  I selected the ranch dressing, however the waitress brought out a sample of others, namely the blue cheese which she said was not to be missed.  It was amazing.  We were not sure of wines, was brought a sample of each to try prior to a bottle which was half price that evening.  The food was perfectly prepared and an extra side was provided without charge.  We could not decide between three and only selected two, the cook sent out as not to miss either.  Cream spinach was incredible, usually not a fan.  We wrapped our evening up with a friendly chat and the last glass.  Thanked the staff for a personal and enjoyable evening at our own pace, what a great memory.  It's charm is not just with the caring service but also the building, something doesn't have to be shiny and new to be outstanding.

a5OqPplJpAUypZLAXLa15Q.text: What an experience. If I could give 5 more stars I would. It started with Terri. We paid for her incredible attitude and energy and the amazing food came with it... we couldn't have asked for better prepared steaks, seafood and incredible soup (French onion soup better than my favorite French restaurant in Charlotte). Terri gave us amazing recommendations and thankfully we followed them and had the best meal, to the point I already made a reservation with her on the 30th when my boyfriend's momma will be here! I highly recommend Beef N Bottle! It was our anniversary today and I couldn't be more pleased. Looking forward to 2 weeks from now. Thankyou Terri for an amazing night, you truly made the entire experience.

dgoPjCaGblI-KU8b2GjT3g.text: OH How I wanted to give B&B a better rating! Let me start off by saying that I AM a Big Fan of this restaurant! I've been here several times and each time has been really good. To me, this is "old school" steakery.....a Chicago or Vegas style steakhouse....dark, classic, limited menu but really good at what they do.  HOWEVER, this night, hummmm, they were off in a couple important areas. Let's start with.....  THE GOOD: The steaks! I have NEVER had a bad steak here. Seasoned perfectly and cooked exactly to Medium that way I asked. This was the 14oz ribeye. Just succulent flavors. Started off with the French Onion Soup. This was no reinvention of the classic here....great flavor and that yummy Gruyere cheese on top. I would have liked to see mine baked a tad more for that crunchy, slightly burned cheese on the top but that's just me. Their little bread sticks that come pre-buttered are yummy. Crackers and sharp cheddar cheese are more distractions than anything else but they are ok. Finally the Waitstaff. Sherry, who has been my waitress before, is always attentive, friendly and accomodating. Definitely a plus.  THE NOT SO GOOD: The Lobster Tail! This was just not fully cooked! It was rubbery, and next to impossible to eat. Had it not been for my Dad being there, I definitely would have said something to the Waitress. Normally I wouldn't sqwak about paying $19 for a GOOD lobster tail (and it was a good size), but this night it was a complete waste of money. The creamed spinach was cold and completely devoid of flavor. Finally, for some reason, this night must have been Rabblerouser night because my GAWD was everyone like yelling at the top of their lungs. I felt like I was in an English soccer pub watching Man U! Not exactly the quiet evening I was hoping for with my hard-of-hearing soft-spoken 85 year old Father!  THE SO SO: The fries. Not bad, not great. Average. The Caesar Salad. Not bad. Not great. Average.  Final thoughts - I just think Beef and Bottle had an off night. My advise to folks is always to mention items that don't live up to your expectation to the waitstaff or Manager. 9 times out of 10 (at least in this country) they will take care of you. I went with my Dad who unfortunately does NOT have a refined palate as he compares everything to the Golden Corral buffet (UGGGG) and thinks the salad is the best part of the meal. Oh well. Maybe I should have just taken him to Morrisons Cafeteria where he is most comfortable. But hey, my steak was great and I'd like to leave it at that.  I will definitely come back and see how they do next time. B&B you've got your "mulligan" from Paul.

photos.caption: Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States. Me and my Dad (he&#39;s 85)
Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ribeye Steak, Creamed Spinach, Steak Fries and a Lobster Tail
Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States. Delicious and classic French Onion Soup

E78RvfFb8dHxBPjb_3t3vQ.text: This is probably my favorite steakhouse in Charlotte. Last night I had the filet and lobster tail with asparagus and creamed spinach. The filet needed nothing; Cooked medium rare, it melted in my mouth. The lobster tail was perfectly cooked and the butter provided with it was delicious. I especially liked how the sides come separate for sharing with the whole table. On top of that, the mixed drinks were poured very strong, you get what you pay for.

XC8jWRlijzh7pjAtU9eIYw.text: Every time in CLT this is my go to. Alone or a crowd it is always perfect.  Old school steakhouse at its best!   Ribeye or Chopped Steak.  I'm in!

photos.caption: Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ordered the Chopped Steak in Charlotte best steak house.  Guess what, the best chopped steak in Charlotte!!!

HmY0wZjb441SV49f0UbkdQ.text: I really wanted to be blown away by Beef 'N Bottle. I grew up in Charlotte and have heard about it my entire life. I finally went with my boyfriend for his birthday and we didn't leave as happy as I expected. I knew what to expect-- a run down old school building that serves crackers and a scoop of cheese as soon as you sit down. I can appreciate that. It was fun knowing that the food and experience has stayed the same since the restaurant has been in business. We were sat right away and greeted within a moment or so. We ordered the Cajun Crab Dip and received a thoughtful explanation of how each steak is made. Once we ordered the crab dip, our server did not return to our table for a LONG time. In fact... the table beside us ordered, ate, and received their bill before we placed our order. My boyfriend had to get up and ask another server for help. I understand that it was a busy night and our original server seemed to have another large table, but waiting nearly 25 minutes to order is ridiculous! She was very apologetic and made it up to us with a free dessert (which we were too full to eat by the end of our meal.) For 2 steaks and an app, our bill was $100 which was to be expected. The steaks were great, no complaints there, but they justtttt weren't amazing. I've had better at other restaurants. The mashed potatoes were very thin and almost...shiny? It was weird. The sauteed mushrooms were whole mini mushrooms that seemed to be poured out of a can into a bowl of salted butter. They tasted good, but kind of grossed me out. After we finished, we sat for a while and waited for our server to return. The tables around us cleared and another server cleaned and flipped them all before our server came back to take our plates. It wasn't a bad or good experience. I'm not sure that we will be back for a while.

Uvhpw8H194uVM5uAPlq0RQ.text: This was our first time there and the service was bad and the food was mediocre at best. We made a reservation and we called earlier to informed them we would be running a little bit late. They said it would be ok but when we got there, they had given away our table and brought us to a wobbly high top table. Plus, the staff was very rude about it. I can tell they don't care about their customers.   Then to top it off, the steaks we ordered with overcooked, dry and tasteless. The sides and salads were bland as well. The place is a dive with overpriced food. If you want food that is worse then a chain restaurant like chilis for twice the price then this is the place for you. Next time I'll go to chilis.

qTflf9n2FJ64eBBQaMAuEQ.text: Best place to come with friends and family in a relaxed environment with delicious food!

3YeSHrkRSnk4OR-fW1gA0Q.text: Let's just address the elephant in the room up front - this place looks like a rural town strip joint from the outside. It just does. To those disappointed by the fact that there aren't any nekkid ladies inside, you can at least take solace in the surprisingly amazing fare that awaits if you score a table. And to secure a table, you'll either need a reservation or the patience to circle the lot for a parking spot and additional patience to wait comfortably on the padded bench in the romantically lit entry area. The prospect of said wait is a heck of a lot more appealing if you happen to be vying for a table on a Thursday night, ie while sipping on a half priced bottle of wine (so long as it's a bottle that's normally sub-$79 - you know, like Stag's Leap or one of the other gems on the menu).  Another aesthetic observation - the interior is dated and cramped... and actually pretty fabulous. I'm not sure how, but it just works. It's intimate and cozy, in a very 1970s kind of way.

trRTdeyji4qx92azNUgdmQ.text: This place was nice to visit. The food was great. It's a hole in the wall which reminds me of the places my dad would always take me. The rat pack and all the old legends are lined along the wall. I personally don't like paying so much for a steak but every now and again it's fun to wine and dine.

zRlSi15dgpN_aJ-pU8MoJw.text: Been to a lot of steak places over the years and went with a group of friends (5 of us) and heard quite a bit of build up from my friend who is local.    Visited the Yelp! page for them and felt pretty good going it (4 out of 5 stars and hundreds of reviews - good potential).  The reviews set me up to expect 2 things - 1) an expensive visit and 2) so-so service.    The place was busy on a Wednesday at 9p! pretty impressive!
