We were sat without 2 of our party and the waitress came over suffering from allergies and croaked out a greeting.  We said that there would be 2 more and would decide on a wine maybe when they came.  I looked over the wine list as we were seated.  Our other friends came in and were seated right away.  Waitress returned and I said we were talking about the bottle purchase - she insisted that she would take those orders and shut me down from talking to our friends about wine! She was definitely pushing cocktails before the meal! - Strike 1 (I was paying!)  We ate a few of the plastic-wrapped crackers with the pimento spread (unremarkable) and we then placed our orders.  My fiancee and I decided to split a ribeye (my fav cut) & shrimp scampi.  We asked if there was a split charge and if we could have it split in the kitchen - yes to both.  I also ordered the french onion soup to see if it justified the $2 up charge - but when it arrived it was not cut in the kitchen as promised (no big deal - but Strike 2).  The steak was cooked perfect - I got the baked potato loaded and my fiancee got the mushrooms.  Delicious sides.  The scampi was delicious and heavy on the butter - it was in a pool of standing butter... nom, nom.  There was a rim of fat / gristle around the steak though and tender?  no - not really.  I;ve aged beef at home before and the claim of 21 to 30 days wet-aged beef was not represented in the cut I got.  Not tough as shoe leather, but not as tender as a ribeye aged 3 weeks in my opinion. Swing and a foul to the bleachers...   The third strike came when the waitress tried to strongarm me into a 'Mandatory Minimum Tip' of 20% - taking the time to point it out on the bill and making sure I understood it.  Really?  5 people, a bottle of wine (not on the 1/2 price bottle night) and a Mandatory Minimum tip?!   I enjoyed visiting B&B, but go back again?  Really need a reason.  The Rat-Pack decor was fun, but not for the price & quality we got. The help was less than interested in my comfort than her mandatory minimum tip.  Should have left the tip at zero and refused to be strong armed - didn't.

7-jdsnEFlAkyxFU3KbfkLg.text: Went there as a party of 17 that made a reservation over a month prior. An hour and 15 minutes later we were finally seated but they sat us at 2 different tables despite the reservation to sit together.  It then took an additional 15 minutes for a server to come to our table who blatantly told us that no one informed her we were there. (how do you miss a table of 17?!)  At this point it was already 9:30 (with an 8pm reservation) so we decided to leave and go to Sullivan's steakhouse down the road. On the way out, the manager did not even so much as stop us or even apologize for the poor service. We watched several others walk out that night too. This place is relaying on their old school reviews and reputation and does not care about their customers at all.

CxYods5OcV-3bJhZ-WGmyg.text: Great service!! Dean is awesome! Great recommendations about what would work for the two of us. Love the retro atmosphere. Oysters Rockefeller and clam chowder were great. Prime rib was good too. Crab legs should've been steamed.

NLCO0KeRwN_N3Qv-qnVZ7A.text: We had a reservation for 7:30 on a Tues. Despite being packed, we were seated on time back by the bar. The atmosphere felt casual while the service we received was upscale and excellent (Sherry was our server and she was great).      The steaks and seafood that we ordered were all cooked perfectly and the sides and soups were SO delicious. I honestly can't wait to go back.

JEGBXwy8aRVoupkAFIJa8Q.text: Great steak for sure! I had trio medallions and another friend ordered 16 oz ribeye. We both agreed that the steaks were perfectly cooked to medium rare and seasoned beautifully. The sides were outstanding too - we had sauteed mushroom and asparagus, big portion and well cooked. Also liked the idea of salad buffet. Will definitely pay another trip when I crave meat again!

photos.caption: Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States. Trio medallions

V-2Hb6ocygX35nGy_DlyjA.text: Steak was very, very good. Services was very, very good. I ordered sirloin and they gave me a 12 ounce filets minion!  The place has its charms.   There was a bold guy when I came in, and he made me feel very unwelcome. Made me sit down and wait for 10 minutes even when the place had plenty of space.

photos.caption: Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States

kLSUGHr8y-kbOs6bJRtlDQ.text: Went back for my second visit and took my wife.  I'd raved about this place since the first time and I wanted her to see it, so we drove up from Columbia and spent the night in Charlotte.  Still love the atmosphere...nice and dimly lit, good place for a romantic atmosphere.  It is a little noisy, but not bad.  I once again ordered the Ribeye, medium rare, salad with buttermilk dressing and a baked potato. My wife ordered the small filet, house salad with blue cheese and asparagus.  We split a cup of French Onion Soup.  My wife took one spoonful and said it was too rich for her. She hated it.  I thought it was good...the beef broth base was a little strong but I still liked it.  She absolutely loved the salad and the blue cheese dressing. She liked how the salad was served with all of the salad items on a plate so you could choose which you wanted to add.  This is a nice touch.  She said it was the best Blue Cheese dressing she'd ever had.  Our steaks took a little longer than expected to come out, and when they did, the waitress said "Don't touch the inner dish because it is very hot!".  I took a bite of my Ribeye and the steak was warm, not at all hot.  My wife's Filet was good and hot and now problems.  It had a nice char on the outside and was done to medium as she requested. Her asparagus came very al dente, too much for her, and the stalks were not broken off at the large end, so they still had that hard, woody bottom to them.  Not good.  My steak was done to medium rare but I couldn't believe it was barely warm.  I touched the plate that was supposed to be so hot and it was barely warm itself.  I told another waitress about it and she took it back to have it heated up. She brought it back in about 3 minutes.  I swear they barely did anything to it.  It was still just warm.  I should've sent it back again but I ate it as it was.  I was very disappointed in the steak this time...not sure what happened.  It was my birthday and the waitress brought out a complimentary chocolate brownie with some whip cream and hershey chocolate frizzed over it.  Had a sparkler going in it when she brought it to the table.  Nice little touch so I took a couple of bites but didn't really care for it.   I'll still give this place four stars, but not the five that I gave it the first time.  I will go back and see if this was just a bad evening for them.  Sadly a little disappointed!

CgEsNK82QB5IQBeOlOXj9A.text: This is an amazing steakhouse. Reminded me of steakhouses of yesteryear.  The filet melt in my mouth. The pepper crusted ribeye had a tad too much pepper and wasn't nearly as tender.  The spinach was delicious! Definitely a great dinner choice.

IHWbLQyqQmyeS3vbmIxC_g.text: Delicious steak served on a drafty back porch area in February! It was basically a screened in porch area with wind blocking blinds pulled. Which would be fine. If it was May. To add insult to injury they had ceiling fans running. My (very yummy) steak was cold before I had finished and people around me were wearing coats during dinner. Wait staff was very polite but slow. Drinks went empty and we never saw the same server twice. I think we got lost in the shuffle of a shift change. The food is great but I really recommend spending your $100 in a place with walls, heat, and organized management. I won't be back.

vTFYM_grE4UwwINBC1CIbw.text: Amazing place, family atmosphere and fantastic food. Prices are a bit high though quality has been perfect on my few visits.

YQRua7yhY2ZDMM02OlYX5w.text: My wife and I usually go here for Valentines Day and birthdays. Consistently awesome food and service.  I do not understand why there would ever be a bad review for this place, I guess you can't please everyone! The sirloin is my go to steak here and it has been awesome every time.

A_taOeM9iP90i696X_9Iug.text: The trout stuffed with crab was totally amazing, loved it and the atmosphere and service was excellent as well.  Also had an old fashioned and they didn't skimp on the strong stuff.  Everything was fantastic!

pOJFJfYqVSgICLBU_K64_Q.text: 9/5 Update: went back for the second time to what I thought was my favorite restaurant. A colleague and I had appetizers, entrees, and dessert. Shortly after dessert the host came over and said we had occupied the table for too long and we could either relocate to the bar or leave as another party was waiting. Needless to say, that's beyond rude. Never going back.   If I could give this place 10 stars I would. I realize it's a steakhouse but I went for the marinated chicken with shrimp. Absolutely to die for! Marinated with an Italian seasoning and cooked to perfection. The rice pilaf was amazing and I had some sort of potatoe cake that was out of this world! I found the price to be consisted with the quality of the food. We had several appetizers including the crab dip which was wonderful! I can't wait to go back! Ohh, and make sure you make anreser

oINs1Rzvf7OOQIDqKZw6-A.text: This is a hidden gem in Charlotte. The outside does not do this place justice, but trust me, you will not forget about this place. I enjoyed the steak, scallops and asparagus. Amazing!!! We will definitely return.

RRj-2jGtzhFZpkRa95301Q.text: Came here due to its legendary reputation as one of the oldest steak houses in the Charlotte area. Very cozy wood paneling complete with candle-lit, intimate atmosphere. Steaks are very good, above average, fairly priced. Bottles of wine are easy to buy here with many options below 40 dollars but still with the high end options available. Service was decent, no standup bar area to my knowledge. The building could use a little update but I think they pride themselves on the older charm of this place. Worth checking out!

xPlKADKOJ_dNifARnro95A.text: A couple of pointers before you go here: 1) make a reservation 2) expect to spend a lot of money 3) it's old school so the environment feels like you time warped back to the 50's (this is a charlotte staple for this reason)  My father in law treated us for a celebration to beef and bottle.  We made a 6:00 reservation on a Friday night.  Our group was seated immediately.    The waiter brought the cheese spread and crackers out.  This was nice a unique old school approach.  For apps we ordered the shrimp cocktail and the crab dip.  The shrimp cocktail was subpar and the cocktail sauce was super spicy (if you like that kind of thing).  The crab dip was realllyyy good!    My husband and I split the 16 oz New York strip.  We added a salad and got the fried cheesy potatoes as a side.    Steak was pretty good, but the ribeye my father in law got was way better.  (We made a mistake)  The cheesy potatoes weren't what I was expecting.  They almost look like a crab cake.  They were tasty but a small portion.  The salad came out like a salad bar which was different and I liked it.  The homemade blue cheese dressing was on point.  We had excellent service and I'm glad we tried it, but honestly we will probably not come back because it's really expensive.

photos.caption: Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried cheesy potatoes
Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States. 16oz New York strip
Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States. Make your own salad

Sa1ip3sCZ6BGCA0NguQ9qg.text: We came to celebrate a birthday, with a party of 5. We were sat in the back room, which doesn't have nearly the ambiance of the front room. We arrived at 6pm for our reservation, and were seated promptly. From there the service deteriorated quickly. The service was the slowest, and our server kept making excuses about being low staffed, etc. The table right behind us had two very loud small children. Why would you bring small children to a high class restaurant? The table next to us had a very inebriated couple, she tripping over her chair, sitting on her boyfriend's lap, spilling drinks and food. It took us 3 hours for 5 people to get through the dinner. I can't recommend this as highly as I used to, even though the steaks were very good.

OozAn43xXqCENEyVvXMGxA.text: I have been to steakhouses around the world and the only thing this place has going for it is that it's not a chain.  Seriously, Outback and Longhorn have better beef. The inedible filet I was served tonight is an embarrassment to any steakhouse. I sous vide beef better than than this place. My husband took me here since we are new to Charlotte and I love steakhouses, but he knew and acknowledged the food was below par. I will say the creamed spinach and cheesy potatoes were good, but if the beef is garbage, I am done. They said sorry and to try them again, but I will never come back to this dump.  We showed with no reservation, but at 9:30pm, I saw no point. They put us in a room that looked like a trailer with others not dressed to impress. One and done.

fRZm3ZIuYGGzqC_ugpEnQQ.text: One of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte! From the outside Beef and Bottle looks a little sketch, but don't let it fool you! This steakhouse has been around for 50+ years and every time it's just as delicious as my last visit!   If it's your first time here you have to go with the filet combo ($40-$65 depending on side options). I always opt for the bourbon salmon. It's a kick of flavor in your mouth and so delicious! The filet cuts like butter- opt for medium rare. Solid. For sides you have to get the house salad. It comes with a platter of veggies so you can BYO. Plus all of their dressings are homemade. PS- Make sure you ask for a side of bread. It's infused with lots of butter. Crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. The loaded baked potato is also a solid side option- ask for bacon and cheese if you're feeling naughty.   They have a nice selection of beer and wine- lots of red options. And the best part- the bartenders aren't light on the pours!   Lastly, I recommend making reservations because this place is always packed! If it's your birthday make sure you tell them- you will get a free brownie dessert. Yummy! Enjoy!

sF7392w_NBadANnOfHCzDA.text: Mmmm, I wasn't blown away with the food. However, if you are a charlotean or have lived in Charlotte for a while, you have to at least make sure you visit once. It is worth checking off your list.    My favorite was the apple pie with the cinnamon ice cream and ask for their bread. It is absolutely delicious.   Visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States

3cT2TabCDGtJpM61GS72yg.text: Not too impressed. Steak was great! Service not so much! Gratuity is added on parties over 4. Our server added about 30 dollars in extras. I don't think he thought we would notice. We will think twice about going back. Interior needs updating for sure.

-ZI5Oip5vwfIEB4FuIZasg.text: One of Charlotte's first and best steakhouses and still a great place to take a date! Though it has old school feel and ambiance, those qualities do not mean a tired steak. To the contrary, Beef and Bottle has always had some of the best steaks and seafood in Charlotte, often better than those higher priced places downtown. With many great salad and appetizer options as well as great service and top of the line steaks and seafood, the Beef and Bottle is the old-school (no, switch that) the Classic option to enjoy a fantastically cooked steak.

vctr8smDaksdHzXTRmgFwA.text: Our waiter Adam was not friendly at all and wanted us to hurry.  He is very quick and even looks at you to make up your mind.  My flounder really tasted fish, and we had iced teach with was barely tented.    Was quiet disappointed.

1d6q0PTRxVb-EEFx9PLTrA.text: Driving by Beef N Bottle you wouldn't think twice to stop in and drop 40 bucks on a steak. The place does not appear fancy at all, it looks like an oversized shack. I was slightly skeptical at first but was assured that the place was going to be well worth it. I was not disappointed. The ambiance of Beef N Bottle is like nothing I have ever experienced in person but only through old school mafia movies. Dim lit with old advertisements and pictures of once shining Hollywood stars hanging everywhere could only bring back nostalgic feelings for the older crowd I'm sure. The whole experience was unique. From the cheese spread and crackers to munch on to the make your own salad at the table idea. We had frog legs and oysters to start. Both were absolutely delicious. Then came the steaks. Ordered medium rare and it was delivered. Absolutely perfect. One of the best steaks I have had the pleasure of enjoying. Service was wonderful. Attentive and extremely professional. Dont let the outside fool you. Skip the other places and come in.

photos.caption: Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States. 6oz filet and mashed potatoes. Pink lights make picture taking difficult. Delicious.

lwUeFZBh4Os2ao3OoUX17w.text: Had dinner here for our anniversary.  We made reservations ahead of time using Open Table. We arrived early and went to the bar for a drink. The host came and got us when our table was ready, which was a few minutes before our actual reservation time. Service was good. The waitress indicated she was new and in training, but you wouldn't have known it otherwise. She was obviously experienced. We had Oysters Rockefeller as an appetizer. They were good, but overdone - baked a little too long. We had the filet and scallops and the salmon. Both were excellent. We had peanut butter pie for dessert. The only negative was that they were out of our first two wine bottle choices. We were offered a red blend that wasn't on the wine list, as an alternative.  It was good and did not detract from the meal.  The atmosphere is interesting, as tables are covered in white table cloths, lighting is very dim, but most people are casual and it is pretty loud in general. We enjoyed it and will be back.

vbKYNci0SYs2K9yjwW6Gjw.text: This is by far one of our favorite steakhouses in town! The Delmonico is amazing. Highly recommend this and the creamed spinach. Make sure to get a reservation and specify which area of the restaurant you would like to be seated in. With a corkage fee, you can bring your own wine!

aQJzNLFd7143TCsDx9ip3Q.text: Really great food the steaks are killer and the service was great. Make reservations if you want a table.  We got lucky and found a table at the bar

wM1zlFBRSSUOYb2ebEMVCg.text: It's a shame because this place used to be such a good restaurant, a real Charlotte staple. The beef quality for example has gone down dramatically from even just a few years ago. Not to mention the food poisoning from the crab legs, ending a mediocre (at best) meal. Never again, not what it used to be. A real shame.

Z-h0jU3XlSxB8GQmaeVmqQ.text: Not a good experience. Very poor service.  Poor teamwork. Items prepared incorrectly. 4 hours to eat dinner.  Waitress could not remember our order even after writing it down. When the server was made aware that the food was incorrect all that was done was "I'm sorry you don't like your food" I spoke to the management of the problem they said " yeah I think we got the wrong person on that table" but not one thing was done or offered to try and make up for the situation. Poor communication between staff All members of management improperly trained in customer service and lacking a sense of ownership or concern. I was told that the majority of people like what they do and that my opinion does not matter to them.

mTTCdUdy47q4Fk4DMWR7DA.text: This place is a hidden gem! My son took me for Mother's Day and it was amazing!!! I definitely recommend the crab dip, shrimp and crab cakes. Our waitress let us know it's the first steakhouse in Charlotte! They have a new customer! I will back soon!

iAsD203KIrQrOECP5mI2Hw.text: Pay for prime, they serve select aka mediocre steak. It's a neat ambiance creating a fun experience but worse than the food is the customer service namely from Callie, the hostess. She should be moved to working in an area that is not customer facing. Very rude and curt when asked about changing our reservation time. While I wasn't a huge fan before, her lack of customer service has us crossing this one off the list. Check out Dunavant, Oak, Ruth Chris, even Outback for a better steak than Beef n Bottle.

hB8yKcTrTPXbf6WZBFHpLg.text: Food is excellent, great service!  Would love to see some Oregon pinots on the wine list...just one thing: why the ugly plastic flowers in the vases?  I know it's supposed to be ironic, but it's missing the mark.  Overall, best filet I've had in years!

xAzxrV0vynx158zMiB9VUw.text: Been to all the big name chain places. I rank Beef & Bottle 1#. It's the food, the atmosphere and the service.  Look past the exterior.  But call early they will fill up.

Te3SmjAcw8UCHj38KGcqXg.text: Always reliable, great service, fresh oysters & top notch steaks. Light on quality desserts & sauces for steaks but don't let that stop you. Thursday's are 1/2 off some wines so we enjoyed a great Sterling Cab for $30!

qAEnBbCGoi2ZHs--fKRPJA.text: Made a reservation 2 weeks ago for 17 people. When we called to confirm this week, they said they couldn't do 7, could we do 8. We all arrived at 7:45. They said we would be seated shortly. We went to the bar where the bartender acted annoyed when we ordered. We waited till 9:00 to be seated. Then we sat there for 15 minutes without menus. By this time, we called and found another restaurant. Our server showed up at 9:15 and said "I just found out you where here." As we told her we were leaving, she ran up to the manager and told her or him but he or she didn't seem to care. Not to mention, they placed us all at two different tables. Restaurant lost out on about $1500 last night. Went to a different restaurant that accommodated us and had a wonderful experience.

dhDimPdHWNFup56W_SuVBg.text: I pass by here every Monday on my way to bowling.  I always thought it looked old and dingy from the outside, but I finally looked it up once and it touted having some of the best steak in town.  Our anniversary ended up on a Monday where bottles are half off, so we figured we should try it!  I enjoyed it much more than I expected it to.  The place is small and dark, but clean and the staff was friendly.  The prices were reasonable for a steak house.  My ribeye was nicely cooked and the two sides that came with my dish were well worth it.  I'm so used to having to pay extra for your sides at a steakhouse, it seemed pretty worth it that they were included with your meal!  For entrees, a shared dessert and a bottle of wine, we spent about $80.  Not bad at all!  We'll definitely be back, probably on a Monday to enjoy their wine special :)

6mly0FS7TWvefLOaZnUZWQ.text: Steaks were good. Service left something to be desired. Was so crowded that this oldest steakhouse in Charlotte lost its charm. Probably will find a new steakhouse next time.

7HJcaYJsjAadtwE_s-6pRw.text: Not blown away for the price.  The Steak was good but everything else was basic.  The big thing was, the crackers as an appetizer with the cheese were cheep cracker packs.  Long Horns at least gives fresh backed bread.  The salad was very basic as well as were the other parts of the meal.  The service was lacking a little in the fact I ordered a ginger ale and never got it.  BUT, the steak was great.

nDilosq7JfEg6cgE7eMgkw.text: We were surprised! From outside this place looks bad and worn down, but inside is a whole different story.  Great service, lots of character, very good steak!

ClGWQWlXZDgxGOFOyVOxIA.text: As soon as we walked in I fell in love with the atmosphere. It felt like an old supper club in Las Vegas or New York.  They have old black and white pictures of Hollywood stars all along the walls and with lighting being low it gives you a back in tome experience. We did not have reservations, but we were able to walk in and sit at the bar for dining because we arrived at about 6 o'clock.  The food, oh my goodness the food! It's no wonder that the beef n bottle has stood the test of time. We ordered the shrimp cocktail for an appetizer and we loved it! The cocktail sauce was the best we've ever had. If your a fan of hit cocktail sauce then this is a must to order. They use extra hot horseradish with Texas Pete, Yes! For dinner they offer a few specials, tonight they had king crab legs and a filet, my wife loved it. I had the New York strip, it had a nice charred flavor and the cut was very generous.  We will definitely be back but next time with friends.

rNiZcSGfBkXsL_Zmmg1HNQ.text: This is STILL my favorite place for a filet mignon. I like to taste the steak not a plate of salt like most steakhouses are known for. Beef & Bottle has this going for them like NO ONE else.  I like to enjoy a more relaxed restaurant than the more pretentious places. I know I will get great service, incredible food and no attitude here.  A big thank you for allowing my managers & myself extra time at our table (and yes, I compensated the servers for taking up their table). We were having a business meeting over dinner & the servers were great.   Locally owned & operated establishments are my favorite to frequent. Try this one....I think you'll like it!!!

GR3LQ22Q9e9sFsW5BH3y1Q.text: We really wish we had skipped this one.  We were on a 2 week business trip and had a rule of no repeats.   The outside is sketchy, we should have known better.  We were seated right away, but service was slow.  The create your own salad was good, and had homemade ranch.  It all went down hill after that.  Not sure why I thought I could get good seafood here, but for $24 I do not want rubbery overcooked scallops.  I had the scallop scampi dinner and my friend had the shrimp scampi dinner.  The 3rd party in our group had chicken fettuccine which was rare for her because she had a burger and fries at least 12 times during the trip.  Her pasta looked much better than my scallops which were horrendous.  We were sorry we wasted our per diem here.

6bIe9FX-LRUXqMP0U7VsnQ.text: Completely average steak did not match up with the $32 price tag. Service was just average and I used to hold this place near and dear as a Charlotte icon.

kjcGwSeyziw6mkL8tbJtQQ.text: Amazing Steak as always!  Shrimp scampi had No flavor and came out cold and the  soup, lobster bisque, worst ever ( salt overload). But our server, David was awesome! Been coming for 30 years and will continue!

chixtdM4iEsm9ciu2bBsVw.text: Heard many good things about this restaurant and saw a Living Social deal so we decided to give it a try. We made a reservation for Saturday at 5:30 for a party of four. Greeted by the staff and had a great waitress. My husband and friend ordered the French Onion soup suggested by the server who said it was great but "takes a while." Those who ordered it enjoyed it.  All of us had steaks and they were very good as one would expect with prices of $25-$45 for main dishes.The salads are unique with a "build it yourself" set up. Dressings are made in-house. The side dishes were nothing special. Mashed potatoes were bland, asparagus looked wilted.  After dinner, we wanted to see the dessert menu and have coffee. The waitress said, 'I'm sorry but this table is reserved so you'll have to move to the bar if you want dessert." WHAT??!! I have never experienced this before and was shocked. I told the server that it was extremely rude to expect us to move. She went to ask the manager again to make sure and we were told that we still had to move if we wanted dessert. The manager never came over to explain or offer any concession.  So, will I go to this restaurant again? Probably not. The steaks were good but not good enough to be told we needed to move before our meal was complete...especially when our bill for four totaled $168.00 with the tip. That was with a $20 Living Social deal and only two glasses of wine.  In my opinion, offering a Living Social deal says that you're trying to increase business. Perhaps, if you treat your current customers with the respect they deserve and allow them to finish their meal and savor the experience you would get repeat business and save yourself the cost of additional advertising.  As for dessert? We left and went to Amelie's in NoDa and discovered a True gem in Charlotte...so for that, I owe Beef and Bottle gratitude.

f0WtjWkm1LmcxW2geyyH7w.text: Solid and meticulous service from Chip. The steaks were perfectly cooked. Was a very successful dinner. We are coming back to try all the other delights!  Beware. You best call ahead. We were here on Monday and it was packed!!!!

42jUMIYzlcrnu3JvUH76Yg.text: While the outside will probably make you question why anyone would eat at Beef & Bottle, I had only heard pretty good things so I decided to try it out. Sadly, I wasn't as amazed as I wanted to be.   It is a very cool restaurant, you are definitely transported to a different time, but it would never be my first stop in Charlotte for a really good steak. The food was good, but not great, especially for steakhouse prices. The highlight of the meal was our dessert, it was featured that night and its really all I remember (salted caramel brownie with cinnamon ice cream topped with chocolate sauce - it was aaaamaaazing!) I wish the rest of the meal had stood out as much as the dessert.   Worth a try if you decide to try every steakhouse in Charlotte but definitely not if you're expecting the best meal ever.

1yX-ClnsZhZgyP3MStPwhg.text: Great atmosphere, they dim the lights for a romantic vibe and the seating is cozy. The staff is very friendly. They food was great, we tried the beef short ribs and filet tips. Would highly  recommend for a date night.

OozUa6W79v5pqDz9b0ouYw.text: If you are driving by, you wouldn't notice this place. The building is old and really looks more like a dump.  First impressions can be very misleading though!   We went there after receiving a recommendation from a coworker.  With reservations, we were immediately seated. Low lighting, soft music playing. Romantic/upscale, yet rustic feel.  You make your own salad at your table. Came with lettuce and toppings to share. I enjoyed that. Our steaks were to die for!  Wait staff were very pleasant. Before tip, I think our bill was $120, so not a place we would go to eat everyday. More of a celebratory-dinner location.  We thoroughly enjoyed the evening together there.

UsJnq8jMIa-74wJ7zhRgYQ.text: If I had to describe this restaurant in one word I would say unpretentious.    I'm in town on business and tonight I just wanted a simple meal of a really delicious steak and salad without all the pomp and circumstance that goes along with it at a place like Morton's or Sullivan's.  I had thought of seeking out the more casual Outback or Longhorn, but the food quality there is less than desirable.  Beef & Bottle really fit the bill.  It looks like a dive on the outside, but on the inside it's dark and cozy and a heck of a lot more welcoming than any of the aforementioned chains.  The steak was of very high quality, and I felt it was well worth the price tag for what comes along with your meal.  For $34 I got a fresh, crisp salad with a delicious house-made dressing, a tender, juicy filet mignon cooked to a perfect medium-rare topped with melted blue cheese, and a creamy baked potato on the side.  The service was warm and friendly, and the manager made it a point to make the rounds and be sure that everything was up to par.  So if you're in the mood for high-quality, simple food executed well without a side of attitude, do yourself a favor and check out Beef & Bottle.

5zgBH7hZQEThrnj6dlZtbQ.text: Beef 'N Bottle is about the most amazing steak house in Charlotte.  Don't judge a book by it's cover.  By the looks of the outside you'd be hard pressed to stop your car for a further look. What it lacks in curb appeal, it sure makes up for in food and service!  I've eaten here many times over the years and everything (yes everything) is delicious.  Martinis are excellent, wine options go on for days and the steaks are out of this world amazing.  Their shrimp scampi (to me) is a contender for the best item on the dish.  When in doubt, order a steak.  You won't be disappointed.  Be careful, this place is addicting.  And you;ll never want to eat at another steak house in Charlotte ever again, they'll spoil you for life.

R_Z8bL_2R_llV-RlDBYUWQ.text: It was ok, but I've definitely had better steaks...especially for that price.  The restaurant has a cool, old school vibe. The crab dip was fabulous, but the steak was very tough and just average tasting. There are better places in Charlotte to spend that kind of money on a good meal.

hyp1LoIETbvuBuN8gmblaA.text: We looked past the neighborhood, the old building, the dark, noisy interior (that had a door directly at the end so the winter air came through every time someone went in or out) and focused in the amazing steak we were told we'd find there.  I ordered the filet ($42) which came to me rare though I ordered it medium to medium rare. It was a softball shaped thing that would've benefitted from some hand-trimming.  My husband's strip steak was barely edible. Once you removed the fat on the sides and hacked through to the the meat, you realized that this steak was about 6oz.  Everything else was fine but not spectacular. I'm mystified by all the reviews stating how wonderful a place this was for special occasions. It's a pretty dumpy little place that has a weird room at the entrance with a man working alongside computer equipment looking for all the world like a campground check-in hut.   The bill (his strip, my filet,1 glass of wine and 1diet coke) was right at $100.  In that range, you could go to one of the many places Charlotte has to offer.  Every experience is unique. I heard so many wonderful things about this place and really though it might hold a candle to Peter Luger's in NY (best steak in the world, hands down) but no. Maybe it was an off night or all the cows were suddenly chewy.  To each his own and some people might find the laid back atmosphere appealing. For me, a $100 dinner should have crystal and gorgeous ambience, skilled waitstaff and the most mouthwatering, tender cuts from a cow possible.  Here, we felt there was a chance that the Chocolate Silk Pie could be chewy.

uI8oy5wlv2cNPCEd1yvPTA.text: Interesting spot.  This place carries off the atmosphere of a 50's supper club.  The wife and I both had steaks and both were delicious.  The sides were great and cocktails were well made.  What's not to like?  Well, you really, really, really need reservations here.  We dropped in on the weekend and managed to get a spot at the bar for dinner.  I'm more than ok with eating at the bar (I actually like it better than a regular table), but when a place is this crowded, it becomes difficult.  If they manage to find a way to do crowd control, this place will move up to 5 stars for me.

K76FNxRtoGjOWLIw_P0cow.text: We have been to this restaurant many times over the years and had excellent meals.  About 3 years ago, we had such a bad meal, we stayed away.  A couple months ago we thought we'd give it another try.  We had reservations for a booth and arrived 20 minutes ahead of time and were promptly seated.  After we ordered our cocktails, the waitress pushed us to order.  We generally like to enjoy our cocktail before we order our meal.  We were informed that we were only allowed to keep the table for 1 1/2 hours.  My husband asked for an exception because that was ridiculous.  Since they said no, we decided to enjoy our cocktail for 1 1/2 hour and eat elsewhere,   My husband engaged in a friendly conversation with another table. The manager came over and told us we had to leave because of this.  I couldn't believe he insisted we leave for talking to another patron, but said if we didn't leave immediately he would call the police. He was nasty and totally disrespectful.      Many people try this restaurant because it is an institution in Charlotte, however, this was sold 3 years ago and has a new owner.  That explains why the quality of food and the treatment of patrons has gone down hill.  We have eaten at Morton's, Ruth Chris and other fine restaurants and have never been given a time limit at our table.  Actually expensive restaurants expect people to linger.  This new owner charges high dollar for mediocre food.  He wants to turn tables to make money rather than insuring a great experience for the customer.  he is relying on the long reputation of a previously great restaurant.  I give him a couple of years before the place closes.  I have talked to too many people who had poor food there that won't return.  What a shame.

_c7eJkT_gYmKBkCWv0rtmw.text: My son and I wanted a place to dine last minute New Years Eve, after calling around, everyone was booked obviously weeks in advance. I remembered a little jewel of a restaurant from the past and looked it up on line. It was still going strong !  Called, and they were booked also, but told me they has some high tops(small 2 person tables) in the bar area that were first come, first serve.  So we headed out, and arrived around 8:00pm.  Place hasn't changed outside, nor inside in thirty years.  Movie stars framed on walls, white linen tables and booths,separate back room with small bar and 2 tv's.  Was greeted at the front door, and welcomed as family.  Led to the high tops and didn't even have to wait to sit ! You could sense the dimly lit atmosphere and old school Sinatra music was foreplay to the food orgasm that was soon to happen. The totally new kitchen addition that was added months prior hidden behind aged walls with so many stories to tell of celebrities that have dined here over the decades.   The wait staff was genuinely friendly and eager to help and even the ones that walked by would recognize others and say hello, sometimes adding to a story or experience, treating everyone as family. I quickly realized this place would be a great addition to my regular dining spots, even though it's located directly across town from where I live and work(45 mins).  Anyway, great steak, fish selection with abundant sides.  Salad is huge if that's one of your side choices(two sides included) I ordered the filet mignon and crabcake combo ($40.00) and this is the only place that can cook it my way every time ! (I prefer medium to med-well, pink inside and no butterfly)Mashed potatoes and asparagus (both in separate dishes as they are plentiful) The wine selection is extensive, as is the beer menu.  They have a corkage service also if you want to bring your own. Guests I have brought have eaten Lobster, and other items and always said the food was great. I tend to stick with the steaks. The friendliness of the entire staff is another reason to return, but the food will keep you coming back.  So, if you like non pretentious cozy atmosphere with great people who will remember your name and treat you like family, and superb food at reasonable prices,then this place need to be on your radar !  Since, I now try to dine here every other week or so.   Thanks Ron, Rick and staff !!   See you next week...

nnrHK7Ir3YDmItyk50F0MA.text: The Ribeye medium rare+ and the creamed spinach side were outstanding.  Hillary, our waitress, was friendly and helpful.  2nd visit to B&B and I will be returning.

_BcnbkN8R9tCZ6YnY4HgNQ.text: This restaurant was by far our favorite during a recent stay in Charlotte. Being a Nebraska girl, I'm a bit skeptical about steakhouses and how they prepare my meat. The cook knocked it out of the part with my medium rare filet mignon and King crab legs! Prepared to perfection. Our server was amazingly attentive and her wine knowledge exceeded my expectations. The owner, Rick, was so hospitable, he even gave us a historical overview of the establishment. Thanks Beef and Bottle for a fantastic evening and a lovely memory of Charlotte. We will be back in November!!! Amy, Robyn and Cristi

7jfDJIBeucRREJkohySvLw.text: I visited this place because we heard great things about the steak. Unfortunately, the cuts of meat were average and my steak was over cooked twice. I ordered my steak medium rare, and both times it came out medium well to well. The second time the steak came out gray and cold.... I have no idea how that is even possible. The waiter was very nice and apologetic, and certainly earned a decent tip, but I won't be going back to a steak joint that doesn't know how to prepare a steak.

-Lx2c4PXJsMip15a9kYpLQ.text: I've heard about this place for months now and finally had a chance to try it out.  My best friend and I went to dinner for a girls night, we loved the way the outside looked- nothing fancy, but clean. That generally bodes well. So we get inside and are asked if we had a reservation, which we didn't, but were seated right away.  Our server was Chip.  Chip was a FANTASTIC server, I've never had someone spend so much time explaining the menu, the specials, and made sure all my questions about the cuts of meat were answered.  It was half priced wine night, we split a bottle of moscato and it was delicious.  My friend ordered the filet with Caesar salad and fried potato bites, she was very pleased.  I ordered the Delmonico with salad and fries. I was completely blown away! It was cooked perfectly medium and was so juicy and tender.  Normally when I order steak out I use sauce and I used none for this steak. I am seriously impressed.  We shared the apple pie for dessert which was also delicious.  Thank you, Chip, for giving us a wonderful dining experience!

YeY2s5Z2u9SkIPv4-gPgEw.text: So many positive reviews I had to try it with a work colleague.  It was as advertised.  Hillary was a great server.  Food was great.  From the salad dressing to the onion rings to the steak.  Delicious! Cooked perfectly and this place won't break your budget.  I will dine here again

156OQC5iDV7HCcR4VjbefQ.text: I always wanted to try this place and finally did so earlier this week.  As others have said, it is very old school.  The food, service and ambience were all great.  You can go to a big name steakhouse and pay A LOT more.  Save your money and go to Beef and Bottle.  You will not be disappointed.  And make sure you get the blue cheese dressing for your salad.  It is homemade and out of this world.

EdAse9tEMrJNBi9PG9Ukdw.text: My husband and I were celebrating 19 years of marriage and wanted to try something new. Made a reservation same day and was excited as I had heard good things about this place. Got seated right away but in the side room which was interesting. The tables were crammed in there, but I was with my husband and I was ready for a nice dinner. There was cheese and wrapped crackers for us to enjoy on the table. Let me highlight that I love dive diners and am not in any shape or fashion a rich snob. However, the cheese spread reminded me of cheezwiz and although I love me some captain wafers, bread would have been nice. Our waitress comes by and tells us that she guess we are her table and that they got the numbers all messed up. Oh ok, thanks for that info. She then takes our drink order but seems confused. I order a glass of wine and my husband asks if the OMB on tap is the copper. She says that they don't have OMB but they do have Old Mecklenburg and that she does believe they have copper. Ok, not a good sign, but my nice husband said that sounds great and thanked her. We order our food and all throughout the waitress informs us of every upcharge with the dollar amount that is included with our order. I was dressed casual dressy and my husband looked nice. We weren't in black tie outfits but we didn't just roll out of bed. I am in my late thirties and by all means can afford the two dollar upcharge for my husband's loaded baked potato. I don't need to to make sure that is ok. She brings out drinks and my husband's beer is wrong. She of course had already jetted and he couldn't tell her. He was sweet and waited patiently. My wine tasted like rubbing alcohol and was obviously the bottom of last night's bottle but I drank it and didn't say anything. Our soup and salad comes and I tell the waitress that my husband's beer was wrong and she says ok and brings him the right one. When she does she informs us that they had the wrong label on the taps and that is why she brought the wrong one. We were like ok, thanks and no problem.  The salad was a plate of lettuce and a plate of fixings. I thought it was wasteful and a bit of a pain to serve it this way. The fixings were large and I had to cut up everything before mixing it with the lettuce. This was a lot of work and I didn't use majority of what they brought. Our steaks come and again the waitress drops it off and jets. I ordered medium rare and eat a couple of bites from the outer part and notice that it is pretty chewy. I cut in the middle and find that my steak is cooked medium well. I then have to wait over 15 minutes for another server to come by so I can tell them. He says do you want them to take it off your bill or do you want another steak?  I wanted to eat my steak. I told him i would like another steak. I waited another 15 minutes and a different waitress brought me my new steak which was rare, not medium rare, but honestly at this point I didn't care. It was better because I was taking it home anyway and it would be fine when I heated it up. I did tell her that I was disappointed that our waitress didn't stay around to see if my steak was cooked to my liking and that she was no where to be found for the last 30 minutes. She said that she understood and would let the manager know. I didn't care to tell the manager but thought maybe I could spare some other couple this experience if I was honest. Of course the manager never came by. Our waitress did finally come by to give us our check and to box our food. I told her we would box it ourselves. We paid and I did leave her 11%. I normally leave 20-30% but she was awful. I will never be going back to this place. The beef was not cooked right and the bottle stunk.   Was a pricey crappy meal. Pay a little more and get your money's worth at Ruth Chris!  Pay less and get better service at Texas Roadhouse.

DKWDYZGEWg_A4eXZSrLdiA.text: David was our server and he is a rock star!  The wife's birthday and our first visit after 5 years living in Charlotte.  Why did we wait so long?  This place is great!  The filets were cooked to perfection and off the charts. The sides were top notch.  The salads with the homemade dressings were yummo.  And the bread.  Did I mention the bread?  Was thin, flat, buttered and great!  This place is so cool.  Especially the original front dining room.  It has a late 50s / early 60s feel.  Dimly lit and comfy.  Cool pics of iconic entertainers on the walls.  MAKE RESOS!  If you have not been...ya need to go.  A high-line place and worth it.  We will definitely be back!!

HP6qzJTvQ4VT7LPj7MRH2A.text: I was looking for a steakhouse in Charlotte to entertain a colleague from work. Beef & Bottle is a very nice "old school" steak house.  Don't let the exterior discourage you. The interior is a step back in time. The service is excellent, the wine list is priced fairly and the steak is great. You won't break your expense account.   Each meal includes a salad, side & Texas toast. The oysters are on par with the good ones you'll eat in New Orleans.

vZPIAPevbK8FRzVpI7cvCw.text: What a treasure! Every time I go there, it takes me back to the old days. I love that not much changes at Beef & Bottle. The food is ALWAYS good, the drinks are ample and the ambiance is great. Part of that ambiance is the darkly lit booths but I think the lighting needs a little improving (it's hard to read the menu in the dark) but the wait staff was eager to explain specials, so that's easy to overlook.   I LOVE Beef and Bottle! I sometimes forget about it but every time I return I can't wait to go back again and again!

1Q72-y__T7WJnvCTh-0Ppw.text: I've been to this establishment twice.  The first time we did not have a reservation.  We bellied up to the bar and waited, and waited and waited...eventually a table opened.  I had no complaints that night.  The food was lovely as was the atmosphere.  Fast forward to tonight.  We had a 5:30 reservation for a birthday celebration.  At 7:09 we were told that we needed to leave as the table was spoken for.  Now granted we were winding down anyways, but A) this was a terrible business practice and B) yes the table was spoken for, BY US.  They knew we were celebrating a birthday and did bring out a very lovely birthday surprise for the birthday girl.  But for 60 bucks a plate I do not expect to be rushed out the door.  So now that we've gotten the service outta the way - onto the food, this is a restaurant after all.  Well, my meal of tenderloin tips was super salty but still pleasant.  The dessert (key lime pie) was really good.  My dining companions had the special - a prime rib/ shrimp combo.  They said the shrimp scampi was really good, but they've had better prime rib.  I'm just flummoxed, why would Beef and Bottle risk alienating customers?  I sure as heck won't be back.  Oh and I got sick from my meal - not sure if it was me or them, but after being rushed out the door I'm gonna say it was them!  I will not be back.

2sV8vbQpbh_waHgXoK8jBg.text: First let me say my review has nothing to do with the food, because the food was excellent.  We had been at Lego fest all day and wanted a good steak. It was a group of 6 (2 children included)After research we decided on this place.  From the moment we walked in we immediately felt unwelcome because we had children. The hostess was not friendly everyone else was sat before us even though we had reservations....  Customers of the restaurant were even overheard making comments " wow kids in this place". From the time we sat down everything seemed to be a problem. The server constantly repeated that we had children.... Almost like as if  if we're a problem that we had children.  Our waitress was not attentive at all from the Start. The service by our waitress was Awful our drinks were constantly empty... We had to  ask the same questions over and over ... We had to ask her over and over for simple things like drinks, bread, or crackers. After 20 minutes after being finished with our dinner....  the bust boy came by (which I add was the nicest gentleman of all the staff). We had to ask him for our check he then told us that our waitress was in the other room.... Whatever that meant.  Also the waitress hand wrote her tip on our ticket ... Which she wrote in 21.00 on our receipt because I guess she felt she deserved 20%. She counted our 2 five year olds that didn't order anything in our group therefore she could add her own tip for a group for 6 or more.   Needless to say we will never be back... For the simple fact of how we were treated.

Xc6lLUqe97GVKVlyqtYahg.text: It's been years since we dined here, and glad we came back. Other favorites from a bygone era such as Lamplighter and Epicurean are long gone. I'm not sure why we've been away so long.  Walking into the restaurant is like being in a time warp--back to the early 60s when the Rat Pack ruled Vegas and Hollywood stars were larger than life. The decor is old. The publicity pictures plastering every square inch of the walls are even older. The lighting in the main room is dim. It's all part of the charm of the place.  Kitchen, however, is apparently state of the art after a major renovation. We didn't see it, but the results delivered to the table were delectable. French onion soup--terrific! Black and bleu ribeye--awesome. Server was terrific and very knowledgeable. Gave great advice re selections.   Will be back. With friends next time.

RQxftv8vElLBKeJgBpCx-w.text: Great place to eat. So far I've been here twice. Most recent was for my anniversary. The staff is so nice and welcoming. The food is great. They start you off with homemade cheese with crackers. The shrimp cocktail appetizer is amazing and the steak is some of the best I've ever had. You have to try the cheese fried potatoes they are unlike anything you've ever had. I  would highly recommend!

u9gtc3wjTcrggSToUIJCPQ.text: My favorite place for steaks in Charlotte. They don't nickel and dime with family style overpriced sides or push bottled water. The filet tips are outstanding! Meals come wit salad and sides. The salad toppings are brought to the table, you pick the toppings. Reasonable prices.

sM4wWdZCXzcKVOv6PBm0uw.text: Went to Beef 'N Bottle for the first time for a double birthday party. We were really looking forward to it. We were seat on time and a had a nice waitress. We ordered frog legs, escargot, and seared tune for appetizers. Each and every one was flavorless. Very disappointing. No bread, only soft cheese spread and crackers.  We ordered a New York steak, a Ribeye, a Delmonico, Trout, and Crab Cakes. Steaks were average. Not very juicy and quite a bit of waste. The trout was flavorless. The Delmonico was tasty buy also not trimmed very well. Crab cakes average. Side of sauteed mushrooms were whole and cooked in a wine sauce that was unpleasant. Fried cheesy potatoes were bland. Asparagus was OK. Cheesecake dessert was supermarket quality. No alcohol ordered and bill came to $285.00 including tip. Chain steakhouses had better steaks and sides. Not returning.

Gxr8_Tq2aEFFd7MCD7voAg.text: Had dinner here tonight service was excellent  My filet was very good dessert was very good  My companion has  scallops which she said weren't cooked enough and didn't taste very good We both took doggie bags home but the scallops didn't smell very good so we had to throw them out This is the first time we ever had a complaint about this restaurant  We will go back agsin

5dIN_pwgGodbMVsf3W4dTw.text: We have eaten here twice now as a family of 4 the first time and a family of 5 the second time. First time was on a Friday night around 8 PM and the second time was on a Wednesday night around 8:30 PM. I must say the old adage of "you get what you pay for" certainly applies at this restaurant. Expensive BUT worth every penny spent!! The appetizers and main dishes (steaks) are SUPERB!!! The fried oysters are some of the best I've eaten in over 20 years! Service is fantastic BUT the place is usually packed and very noisey (about the only thing I can find fault with). I would highly recommend this steak house to anyone who has the money to spend on a great dining experience. We WILL be eating there again in the near future!

AP7mKamSeqeNSIHZU14npA.text: Dinner Aug 14 Great local place with tons of history and old character and charm. Place has been around since George Washington ate there with DaVinci or something like that. They give you some pretty decent cheese spread & crackers to start with (always love the little freebies!) and they will give you more if you ask. salad dressings are made fresh there - that's a good thing and they bring out all the salad add-ons family style so you can add as much or as little as you want. Wait staff was excellent! Food was okay - sorry...i really wanted to be over the moon with the food, but it really just okay.  The Ribeye was cooked perfectly at Med Rare but was a super fatty piece of meat and really lacked any discernible flavor.   I would go back though as it was charming little place and I like eating at local mom & pops!  Next time I would try some appetizers & the fish/seafood.

1PlvxUdEeUOwPqkmUJhPHQ.text: This was a great steak. Very tender and juicy and great flavor. Old 50s mobster feel on the inside. Very cool and being from out of town I'm glad I experienced it. Would recommend.

j4sce86PYJRRbCXIBvAAiw.text: Disappointed. Was really looking forward to coming because I have heard great things. Food was mostly great! One steak was extremely fatty, I wouldn't recommend the New York strip. The server we had, Dave A. tried to charge us for several items that we did not order thinking we would not notice. When we called him out he tried to say other waiters rang it in our tab which was clearly a lie because it was listed out by seat and it was the exact beers we ordered. Doubt I will be back.  ALSO- the waiter told us that gratuity was included with parties of 4 or more. This wasn't done in the system it was manually written out by the waiter.

rUbnyRzsLw3ziR6dqs2Q4Q.text: I've been here several times over the years, most recently a couple of weekends ago. We lucked out and were seated in the main dining area even though we made reservs the day before. Our waiter (David I believe) greeted us quickly and was on the ball with our byob wine. That's right, you can byob with a $15 corkage fee.   We started with the crab dip (spicier than you would expect!) and we all got steaks. Everything came out correct and we were all very happy with our food. I had the 6 oz. filet with baked potato and loved every bite.   I think everyone knows about the ambiance, but just in case - think wood paneling and a major flashback to the 50s/60s. Oh and don't let me forget about the pub cheese & crackers + a plate of veggies for your salad. Oh for the good ol' days.   My only gripe is the prices. It is a little hard for me to spend the same here as Del Frisco's. But as my husband keeps reminding me, they are doing something right if they are booked out weeks in advance - so what do I know! I'll go once in a while for the nostalgia factor, but not every time I'm craving filet.

jyAxiLrwh3Tmj6TPZGKydA.text: Been looking forward to coming here for a long time. Won't be coming back. I ordered a ribeye and my son got a NY strip, both medium rare. Mine was almost raw and his was well done and dry. It's not difficult to cook a stake to order. Way too expensive to be making these kinds of mistakes.

photos.caption: Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States. NY Strip, Ribeye

RPdu6NRM0HaUHfzJeYCPRA.text: It's a hole in the wall with history. Nothing fancy. I did think the price of the entrees was high for the atmosphere. The service was good and some items were a hit and a miss. The oysters were meaty and one of the best I had in Charlotte. The shrimp cocktail had a BIG kick. The ribeye entree was on the salty side.

OwOCYRH-8BjcRp_LDEplnA.text: Huge disappointment. Service was okay, just not what you'd expect from such a nice and expensive restaurant. Neither of our food was cooked how we ordered it however I'm giving them three stars because when I mentioned something about it to our waiter they handled it very well and took them back to be re-cooked. It still wasn't amazing. For the price I just feel as if the whole experience and food was lacking.

pxyosiiFjuMHU6t3-7Fx9w.text: First experience here could not have gone any better. Amazing food, ambiance, and service. Ordered:  Oberon Cab Sav - Bottle Baked Oysters Rockefeller Salad (Italian)  Filet + Lobster Tail Loaded Baked Potato  Everything was perfect. Easily the beat steak I have had in Charlotte. We will be back!

RIQLNfvUlqY0jOyY-ctZWg.text: After 14 years in Charlotte we decided to try it. The reviews were inconsistent so we figured we would judge for ourselves.   In summary it was a sh$& show. 2 stars was generous.   I don't want to go into all the gory details so here is the quick and dirty version.   Ambiance - road motel meets gas station meets bonanza. It was so cheesy that they spray paint their bulbs to a red dim light rather then spending an extra .$15 for a colored bulb.   Service - horrible. I've had much better and attentive service at fast food joints. Water refill asked 5 Times.; Wine-Delivered wrong bottle; clean plates-had to beg other wait staff to address. Pathetic.   Food - meh. Crackers with weird cheese scooped with an ice cream scooper. Onion Soup was a solid 3-stars. The salad was very strange even though the blue cheese dressing was good and the veggies were fresh - it was presented in a weird cafeteria style help yourself mode. However that was probably the highlight of the food. The steaks were a choice cut and were fairly bland. We certainly did not feel they warranted the $45 price even though that included a side and the cafeteria style salad. We opted for the apple pie with ice cream and that was edible but certainly not memorable.  Miscellaneous- you get bread after your meal entree arrives which is the first time in over 35 years of dining that I had seen that. The bread itself isn't traditional rolls or bread but very thin and garlicky toast which we were not fans of. The glassware and stemware was of the cheapest quality. The knives, forks and spoons appeared to almost bend by look alone. Glassware was Walmart.   If you want a cheesy old steakhouse that caters to very "mature " patrons, this is your place. If you want a good steak with phenomenal service try Del Frisco's or Sullivan's.   The 5-star reviews boggle the mind. You have been warned...  We will certainly never be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States. Interesting &#34;bread&#34;
Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States. More waiting...

Uz22e50qc6SaLF_JFIN4NQ.text: This was a very old building and needs updating. The back room was very loud and when the waiter is eating off a served plate it's a bad sign. The food only subpar.

3eO9pcelnODca5q34zxkag.text: Thank you to EVERYONE who recommended this to us.  Sooooooo good!  The BEST steak in Charlotte, for sure!  We started with the shrimp scampi, which did not disappoint.  Let me rewind to the wine selection...great selection of wine and we happened to go on half priced wine night.  the cheese and crackers are decent.  Taste but move on.  You seriously want to save your appetite for the steak, wine ,and dessert.    The salad was just okay for me but the dressing was fantastic.  Homemade and so yummy.  Husband got the French onion soup and I got a little starter jealous.  Definitely, go with the French Onion Soup!  It was not too salty, the croutons and cheese were perfection.    I got the loaded potatoes and he got loaded mashed potatoes.  I thought the potato was a waste, because all I wanted was to finish the steak.  I ate it.  Hubs devoured his mashed potatoes.    He got the filet with red wine butter.  I got the filet with the blue cheese crumbles.  Medium rare, is where it is at.  Best temp for this steak and perfectly cooked!  We both loved our choices.    We got the SuperTusxcan wine...perfect with the steak.    We had a bit of an overly cursing neighbor.  They quickly put an end to his evening, in the most subtle way.  No drama in this establishment   Such a great meal and great recommendation from the best yelpers!  Thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States

q8Dts0IRN1A6gO4l3NPGMw.text: Truly a Charlotte gem! We go on Mondays for half price wine night - which really just means we get two bottles instead of one! Service is spot on and the food is exquisite. Always perfectly prepared. Last night our server was David and he was excellent. Do yourself a favor and go here if you haven't been.

SYzv4QQ3JOhYAF6woC8Uag.text: Again, I have to make a disclaimer that I don't eat steak.  However, I had a bite of my mother's steak and WOW!  I just might eat steak here!  This was my first visit.  My mother was in town and as a somewhat late Mother's Day dinner, I took here here.  I happened to have made reservations the day prior, and I'm glad I did because there was a sign on the door that night saying the restaurant was working on a reservation-only basis.  I'm not sure if this happens a lot, but knowing this, I highly suggest you make a reservation, even if you think it may not be needed.  The server asked if we had visited before and when we said this was our first visit, the server gave us some basic history, recommended the most popular sides, and gave the night's special.  The ambiance is low lighted with white linens.  Looks upscale inside but I certainly felt comfortable dining in less-than-business casual dress.  I sat in the club area, in the back by the bar.  It was very loud back there.  I can't see that area as being intimate or romantic, as this restaurant suggests on their website.  Crackers of the saltine, Club, and Melba Toast varieties are complementary at the start of the meal and are served with cheese butter.  I ordered the clam chowder and fried flounder with onion rings and rice as sides.  The clam chowder was thick and chock full of clams.  Unlike many clam chowders I've had in the past, this had zero presence of "sand."  In addition, there was a slight smoky flavor from bacon.  The flounder was lightly breaded and fried.  It was fried to a perfect crispness outside and still flaky and moist on the inside.  The tartar sauce, a very simple thing to make, was fantastic!!  I also must add that the tartar sauce was not needed since the fish was so flavorful.  The onion rings were thick and sweet, but I found the breading to not have much flavor.  The rice was just OK.  It looked appetizing and was flavorful, but I was off put by the stickiness like it was leftover from the night before.  The server was knowledgeable, friendly, and attentive.  I broke my take out box for my onion rings.  When I asked for a new box, the server just gave me a fresh order of onion rings.  Hands down the best dining experience I have ever had.

kK3zEGtGt3xT3bPxnQCIhg.text: Took my Dad (out of towner) to this restaurant due to the previous experience I had and how delicious I had remembered the steaks being. You have to have the right expectations when you visit this restaurant. The outside of the building is unassuming and you could easily pass it without knowing they have some of the best steaks in town. The inside is very dark and kind of kitschy with the rat pack posters and signed pictures of famous actors at each dimly lit table. Christmas lights are strewn throughout and ceilings are very low. You want intimate, you got it. I previously remembered the service being outstanding. This visit kind of caught me off guard. I Asked my server to tell me about one of the wines by the glass on the menu and was subsequently responded to with a "well, what do you want me to tell you?" coupled with a puzzled look. Didn't really set the right expectation off the bat and my Dad and I both looked at each other bewildered. The server later tried to redeem herself after she realized she probably pulled her "back of the house" attitude to the "front of the house" where it didn't belong. Get the Delmonico steak. It's flavorful and really quite good. Their sides are pretty spot on as well. Bring your own bottle of wine if you want anything decent. Their wine list is lack luster for a steakhouse. I don't want to steer anyone away from this restaurant, just want to set the right expectation.

X0wtGE1EWkJVENazAjQi2g.text: If you like really old school you will probably love Beef 'N Bottle. If you like today's take on a classic steakhouse, you'll probably be unimpressed with the place. The cocktails were good though pricey, the service was very good and the steak and salmon were good but not great. The crackers/cheese spread (seriously at this price point?), house salad and side dishes were uninspired, the restaurant is VERY dark and the place hasn't been remodeled or updated since it was built in the 1950's. The median age of clientele the night we were there was over 60, looked like mostly regulars who've been going there for decades. We had the throwback experience, but we won't be back - many better alternatives around Charlotte in my view.

_NO2gT_oeQ1k-XvzS3NGEg.text: This was GREAT! Very old school and fun quaint atmosphere. I love the crackers and cheese that they give you at the start of the meal.  The steaks are fantastic - well aged and seasoned, and the best part is that your sides/salad are included instead of a la carte as with most high ends steak houses.  The creamed spinach is to die for... and the steaks were just as good, if not better than Ruth's Chris-level restaurants.  I had the 12 oz Delmonico and my friend ordered the 16 oz Sirloin. Both were cooked perfectly!  Great service from Edwin and his friendly counterpart, Chip.  I will definitely come back!

OAvND41pipzVB5d635Gavw.text: Super yummy! Great steak, mushrooms, spinach - great service and fun old school atmosphere!

9wiTD2YVUVgrAK1BvyidZA.text: I was surprised I didn't like this place because if heard great things about it. The food and ambiance we subpar in my opinion. The restaurant was dated and the food quality was not the best either. I did Luke they way they survey their salads family-style though. That was about it.

5ek9S0n2YObFclDF_qWoCg.text: Excellent service and food!  We had the filet mignon and the prime rib and the New York strip with a few favorite house sides...no matter which you picked they were all fantastic selections!  We'll be back again.  The owner and the staff especially Mrs.Lisa was a pure delight.  Thank you so much for making our dining experience an unforgettable one.

z7OP1fnUhf4y80yt0gxRng.text: Dinner was amazing, first time dining at this establishment and I will be back. For it to be a Tuesday night it was very busy, so I know to now make reservations. We only had to wait about 15m for a table which wasn't too bad. We ordered the Cajun crab dip, it was yummy. I love the fact that all the salad dressings are made in house. The presentation for the salad was unique, it's never been presented to me in that fashion. I had the ribeye and loaded mash potato for dinner. Finally an establishment that knows what a medium steak is supposed to be. It was so good, and nice and pink. Or waiter Seth was talkative but I enjoyed it because he was so upbeat and I loved that. My husband ordered the seafood platter fried, and he said he enjoyed it, while I didn't try it everything appeared to be cooked to perfection. He's a picky eater so I was worried he wouldn't enjoy it, but luckily he did. So score!
