EDMzh5G7oVa02-T9sNdgqQ.text: I been wanting to go here forever. It's fancy with white linen cloth, our waitress Hillary whose is also our bartender was great. The conversation with her is pleasant yet personable but just enough that it's not drag out. I ordered the prime ribeye steak with the lobster tail. It was perfect. Steak was medium done which hit it on the head. The lobster was done right and have a nice sweet taste to it. The potato was just the way I like it. Sour cream and butter, nothing fancy.  My wish is that they can step up their salad a bit. I like that you can make your own with all the fixings. But for a place like this. I was expecting a nice spring mix or some else than just iceberg as the base. However their homemade ranch dressing was to die for. Wish I could've buy a jar to take home.  Everybody should bookmark this place. It's fancy but still have a laid back feel. Not soo stuffy. I would stop by for lunch one day!  Advice: it's best to make reservation!!!

Bm6Em7DD02l3sRduPMQMJg.text: This was the 2nd time we have been.  Both for Birthday Celebrations.  We had a reservation...don't go without one.  Had to wait at bar for a while, but that was no problem.  Waiter was very friendly, but it did take a long time to order between bringing wine...entire meal took 3 hours, so order when you see your waiter.  It's hard to hunt them down because they are busy.  The cheese dip is awesome, ask for an extra one to take home if you have leftovers.  The salad dressings were fantastic.  My 6oz filet was perfect.  Melted in my mouth.  My husband got the black and bleu ribeye.  The steak was great, but not as good as the filet.  Each entree comes with a side, but they are good sized, so plan on sharing with your family.  The waiter brought an ice cream/brownie for my husband's birthday with a sparkler.  That was a nice touch.  We also had the chocolate silk pie...awesome.  Only complaint was that our salads came out about 2 minutes before our steaks came out.  The waiter apologized and just said that he didn't want to bring us cold steaks by having them wait back in the kitchen.  He offered to redo any steak if got cold before we were able to eat it.  I went straight for the filet and put the salad to the side for later.  Glad I did.  Mine was hot.  My husband finished his salad and his steak had cooled too much.  He didn't complain about it though.  Ambiance is old school, but who cares, the food was pretty amazing and you feel like you are in good company with everyone around you.  It's not the least bit pretentious.    Makes for a perfect birthday celebration and it won't break the bank.

yhyNSZSkeZ0vFFLicll8mA.text: I have heard about this place for years and the chefs for a very upscale particular (but will not be named) restaurant Uptown personally labled this as the absolute best place in Charlotte to get a steak.  Thanks to a Living Social deal, I got to experience this myself.  As other reviews have mentioned the exterior does not appear that it has been updated in at least three to six decades. There are no windows outside so the place looks very shady. Or, or just like an old school steak house where the Rat Pack would have dined.  Once you walk in you can tell this place is something special. It is pretty dark, seemingly illuminated by only the candles and single light at the booth tables (there are actually more, you won't trip in the dark). The ambience seems like the perfect place for a special anniversary or to conduct underground business deals. At times I wasn't sure if someone was going to propose or the FBI was going to bust in.  As for the food, I wish I had a bigger budget because even with the Living Social deal, this place was very expensive for two people. My roommate and I had $40 off and still spent $60 combined on our meals and desert and tip (full amount regardless of deal). If I had more I would have been daring on some starters because they serve frog legs, escargot and baked oysters.  However, I loved what I got. I will say it was a gloriously tender ribeye steak served medium to absoulte perfection. I'm pretty handy on grill and have eaten a ton of steaks and I think this is the probably the second best one I have ever had. Truly delicious. I don't know how much more one can say. Seriously top two steaks I've ever eaten (the best was in Knoxville, Tennessee of all places).  The wait staff was a little slow to get us started but once they did, they were fully attentive and if our waitress couldn't make it to our table in time, another passing by would top off out water or clear a plate without hesitation.  Because we could only use one LIving Social deal at a time, my roommate and I will be back. And I CAN NOT WAIT!  (Why a four star and not a five? Price and price alone. I'm typically a penny pincher so it is tough for me to spring that much and give a five star to a place most, including me, can't afford. Still worth every penny if you can.)

oIfpkysa04YbMwCitTrltQ.text: My boyfriend took me here for my birthday over the weekend. The food was so amazing and boyfriend truly enjoyed their steak so much he talked about it all nite. Their cheese butter was delicious also needless to say we will be going back....

P9fRCCTG_YQTvhzK_jxvfw.text: Charlotte's best restaurant. It may seem like the kind of place and the kind of food your grandparents would have enjoyed in a date night in the seventies, but when you get it right the first time... Their creamed spinach is luscious, salad comes with thickly cut everything (even radishes!). There is nowhere to go in town for a better prepared surf & turf & glass of wine.  Keep an eye out for the most enthusiastic, delightful busboy in the SouthEast - Chip. He's always there & always working his tail off with a huge grin.

HtOT9rU8gjamMJAGW1ejxA.text: Old school doesn't quite do this place justice.  How about, old school to the Nth degree?  Yep, that does it.  A group of friends and I met for dinner and drinks this week and of the 4 of us, 3 of us raved and one was kind of meh.  That's what she gets for ordering fish at a place called Beef and Bottle I guess :)  I went with a cup of French Onion soup to start and had a combo small filet and fried shrimp for the entree with onion rings for the side.  All entrees come with a salad which is a plate of iceberg and then another plate for the table to share with onions, peppers, cherry tomatos, celery, cucumbers....  The dressings are homemade and I went with the blue cheese which was a mighty fine choice.  The soup was good, not too salty and had a crunchy, melty topping of cheese on top.  I was wishing I had gone with a bowl vs. a cup!  My steak was cooked a perfect medium-rare with a decent char and had good but not great flavor.  Next time I'll opt for a NY Strip I think.  The fried shrimp were also good but not great with a decent taste but they were a little dry.  We happened to show up on half-price wine night and it applied to both bottles and glasses which was nice.  They don't have an extensive wine list by any stretch but, it's serviceable.  What we all liked the best was the atmosphere.  Dark, with little candles casting just enough light to read the menu and see your food while still allowing us all to look about 15 years younger.  The service was casual and friendly and fit the place perfectly and the joint was packed almost the entire time we were there and everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves.  Not even close to the best steak I've had in Charlotte but, that's not everything in a meal.  No doubt that I will come back.

0TlJRJc3vryGkr6BN1Z2HA.text: We had eaten here a couple years ago and kind of forgot about it. My fiance's old school dad was in town and we thought we'd take him here and we're so glad we did! Don't expect your typical stuffy steakhouse. This place is straight out of Goodfellas. The walls are decorated with 50s movie stars, there are no windows and the place has most likely not been updated since it opened in 1958. But don't let the exterior fool you, this is one of the best steakhouses in Charlotte.   We started with the oysters and they are huge!! Served with their homemade cocktail sauce that serves quite a kick.   The salad is pretty basic and family style. But the entrees... Holy wow. Best steak I've ever eaten. Ask for yours black and bleu! The creamed spinach was one of the best things I've ever tasted and the baked sweet potato should be served as a dessert!   Our server, Lesley, was very friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. My fiance's dad even said he doesn't want to go back to Del Frisco's or Sullivan's and only wants to go back here for steak. Needless to say we'll be back!

Y8PKrEJ5uj1qzVLX8KxQkA.text: Was taking a prospective client out to eat after a convention and chose Beef and Bottle as it had the highest rating on Yelp for steakhouses in the general area. As we pulled up the outside of the building certainly didn't represent the overall experience. As our server said once seated you think you are pulling up to an old school strip club. Don't let the outside deter you though.   Our server made the experience one of a kind. Forgot her name but she was spot on and gave some excellent recommendations. Each entree comes with salad and a side. All dressings are homemade, the 1000 island was very tasty. They also bring out crackers with a sharp cheddar cheese ball.   I ordered the snake in the grass, the special of the night that was a 12oz ribeye topped with sauteed spinach, onions and melted Parmesan. THE BOMB!!! ($32)  All cooked perfectly. Server suggested loaded mashed potatoes which were a great addition.   My table of 4 all said they'd definitely come back again. Dropped one star due to dated exterior and interior. Very dark inside but what do you expect for a steakhouse established in 1958...except maybe update some along the way!!

0p_LnvW2AvDuP5d6elbbsQ.text: Wear your Sunday best. They need to get a better looking building for the atmosphere they are presenting.

8eEOZfwn8jNwA8RIWP5_Wg.text: Love this place! The food is always fantastic and the waitstaff is top notch.  One of the best filets in Charlotte! Great wine & drink list.

uFBUxU3_GKut1Pcwbsf4uw.text: I am not a hard person to please and I have NEVER reviewed any establishment or product in my life however my second experience at Beef and bottle was so disappointing I had to post....  1. Management was initially oblivious and uninviting when finding our reservations after giving first and last name. 2. Interior and exterior is outdated and dirty. 3. Unappealing white Christmas lights hung aimlessly around the restaurant as ambiance? LOL  4. Crackers with canned cheese instead of fresh bread and butter? Might as well serve lance crackers out of a vending machine.  5. Tight and cramped seating arrangement.  6. NY Steak was very bland.  7. Cheddar potatoes were FROZEN and not fresh without any Cheddar taste.  8. Vegetables for the salad were separate and not properly cut. (Is it common to have chopped celery on a salad??) The Ranch was awesome!  9. Wait staff was friendly however inattentive with water.  10. I would like to know their health sanitation score because later that night I did not feel well.  I see my opinion is unpopular on yelp but I hope this review was helpful. Thanks for reading.

Phrt_n6YgpHnQKo_nQyqsw.text: Not sure how this place doesn't get 4-5 stars every time. This place is amazing. As you walk in the front door you immediately feel the old steak house ambiance. The three different areas of the restaurant also provide a great variety of environments for any occasion. We prefer the Atrium since it feels more casual, and has a couple tvs set up. The service is exceptional, and the food is great. The crackers and soft cheese are a unique touch. The price is also pretty reasonable compared to other places, and most entrees come with soup/salad & choice of side. The wine list is solid, but we prefer to bring our own since the corkage fee is only $15. Hands down, Beef 'N Bottle is our favorite place in town for any occasion.

MzZtkhe3ebxZig2laPiQ7A.text: How I have lived in Charlotte for 7 years and never eaten at this establishment is beyond unbelievable. A steakhouse that welcomes tank tops and cargo shorts (who still even wears those?!) or a fancy dressed up couple is my kind of spot.  The steak is delicious and perfectly cooked and the price on the menu proves that. If you want a cheap steak, don't come here. They also offer BYOB and offer a corking fee of only $15! Well with it if you're with a group. The staff is attentive and the environment is unique. They kitchen was recently completely remodeled and when we asked about it, the manager let us take a look. Who does that!? I highly recommend Beef and Bottle to anyone and everyone no matter what your wearing or who you're with. Just go get you some steak and let this place impress you!

qW4quPBcj7ktC1BeX6OaCg.text: Very vibrant atmosphere! Had a great time here, food was delicious. Ordered the filet mignon and it required no sauce so that's a plus. I recommend the mushrooms and asparagus as sides. Service on the other hand wasn't so great. Monday's and Thursday's were half price wines so come on those days a major bonus.

t8DR4TSB-Toy0BIBklayew.text: Went to B&B 9-24-2016 to celebrate a friends B-Day.........table of eight.  Had tried to go a month earlier , but no luck with reservations. We are a group of NATIVE Charlotteans (rare) that have known B&B to be our "go to" place for a dependable great meal and ambiance.  We have had many good times and fabulous food in the past years. Maybe the days of "old" are over with B&B too.    Reservations were @ 6:30.  A few of us were late.   This is the KICKER......Did not know until we got there when the lady that had made our reservations had been TOLD........we had to leave by 9:00 o'clock ( I think 9:00, it could have been earlier) as they had other reservations coming in after us !!!!   When I arrived and my friend said.........Hurry, we have to hurry.........we are only given until 9:00. (or whatever)  I was flabbergasted, shocked, outraged, & plain Shell-Shocked !    What ?  I (we) have dined at some of the premier restaurants in Charlotte as well as other Cities , and have NEVER been given a TIME LIMIT......(because they have to "Turn A Table" ) !!!!! So.........OK.........salad was already served.  I had not been there for maybe 10 minutes, was looking at the menu and they waiter came to take our order........Others had ordered immediately after they sat down knowing we were on a time limit.......... The food arrived quickly...........and because we were seated in the BACK where there is a big screen TV, a group of about 10-12 came in to watch a BALL GAME.    naturally, they were LOUD....to the point that the waiters apologized to us........damage done.   We could not even hear each other talk to try to have a conversation......PLUS.......we were hurrying as fast as we could.   The waiter asked if anyone wanted coffee & dessert, someone said."Do we have time".......he said "Oh yes, the other party arrived and we seated them in the dining room."   GREAT............and here we were in a SPORTS BAR listening to screaming  and eating like we were on our LUNCH HOUR !       As we were leaving.another waiter seeing what we had gone through apologized and said, please come back, etc.     The waiters were great..........speaking for myself, the food mediocre at best,  Other said their food was "good".   Disappointed does not even cover the experience.  And the wonderful food and memories of the old B&B in the past are a fading memory. Speaking for myself, I will not go back.    There are PLENTY of SPORTS BARS in Charlotte! No, I knew I was not going to Morton's...........but, I didn't think I was going to a LOUD Sports Bar where we had a TIME LIMIT on how long we could stay !!!!      So INSULTING !

ANOHK1o7xaeaLyjXtuC_bg.text: This is a pretty cool restaurant atmosphere in what felt like no mans land Charlotte.   If you like a dark, classic feeling environment that plays Sinatra type tunes at a low level, has plenty of intimate booths to sit in, stiff pours, and steaks, you probably can't go wrong here.   The outside bar that is still roofed and has a/c is nice and bright if you prefer a little more lighting and they have big tables for a more family/large group parties.  Unfortunately I did not try a steak, but the meal I did have was pretty good, and will definitely be back to try one.

pY8imKizOmoOtxXdI7o4Hg.text: I wanted to find a place that was a little funky/different for my H's birthday so after searching around I came across this place.  I was thrilled at the idea of an old school steakhouse.     It has taken a couple of days for me to get over the urge to gag when thinking about my experience.  Now let me say that first off the service was terrific, the cocktails were on point.  We also brought a bottle of wine, it is really great that you can byob for a $15 corkage fee.  The shrimp cocktail had very fresh shrimp, good size, good value the sauce has huge kick of horseradish.  YUM!  The French onion soup was delicious with just the right amount or cheese and bread with a very rich flavor. I will definitely go back for the soup.  What was not so great was the steak, I am so very bummed because I liked the old worn-in vibe of this place.  The meat was worse than stew meat.  I ordered the 3 medallions, one has horseradish, one has blue cheese and the third has wine butter sauce.  The meat was not good quality, there was no flavor and there was no sear on it to help with flavor/texture.  My husband had the ribeye, this is where my gag reflex kicks in.  I saw him take a fork of meat from the plate to his mouth and a huge, quivering piece of fat was on the fork no meat.  His face went white, he hadn't seen how bad the piece was because it's very dark in the restaurant.  I did see it though, and started gagging.   He had to slyly spit it into his napkin. He tried a second piece, all gristle I gagged again when I saw that piece.  There was not an edible bite of steak there.  In addition to that, he ordered medium, and the meat was cooked to just a bit over rare.  The creamed spinach was not anything special.    Go here, have a cocktail, have some appetizers but do yourself a favor and don't have steak.  Our tab was $135 for two manhattans, two entrees, two soups and one split appetizer plus $15 for corkage fee so very reasonable for a steakhouse as far as price but honestly the meat quality was terrible.  Blech.      If you want a good steak, this is not the place for you.  :(

MMlzxHWpEiQGWS3D5FerIw.text: I was pleasantly surprised by my recent trip here. Going in I had heard a fair amount of mixed reviews from my friends and colleagues, so I was not sure what to expect.   Walking up you can tell that this place has been here for ever - definitely looks every bit of 60yrs old. On the inside it looks about the same, very old with lost of old pictures on the walls. Our group had a reservation for 830 and we were quickly sat as soon as everyone arrived. Our drink orders were taken shortly after we were seated and the waitress also opened up the bottle of wine that we brought for dinner(they have a $15 per bottle corkage fee). We ordered the large shrimp cocktail to start for the table, which comes with a warning on how hot the cocktail sauce is. Personally, I love a very spicy cocktail sauce which this certainly delivered and then some. For my steak I ordered the Ribeye with blue cheese as well as a Caesar salad and a side of asparagus, both of which come with the steak. My steak was cooked perfectly and tasted good. Everyone else at the table enjoyed their meals as well. Overall the meal was very enjoyable and for the price its a pretty good deal. I do have to point out that the one area that we all felt was lacking were the drinks from the bar, hence the lost star. We ordered 3 cocktails and two had issues, specifically: old fashioned had chunks of honey? floating in it(appears they use honey vs simple syrup) and the martini with blue cheese olives came with hollowed out olives and no blue cheese(never scene that before)

WVFcywRLMBNYA2B6EbmHAg.text: This is a classic Charlotte place whose time has passed. When I moved here decades ago, this was already old and an institution. It still rests on that laurel. Stripped of its history and reputation, this is average steak (for top prices) in a trailer.  I take out of town guests here from time to time for the historical interest. When I got on Open Table recently to do that, I was shocked to see a note from the restaurant indicating that time was limited to something like an hour and a half for meals. I guess I'm getting old, but the notion of paying $200 for a meal and then getting kicked out after an hour and a half is a bit much. Once I saw that, I decided to book somewhere else and doubt I would return.   At any rate, worth checking out as a memento of what a top steak place was like in Charlotte before there were many other good restaurants here. Your basic steak and iceberg lettuce place. Extra point for the old-timey cheese spread. But now it is really an amusement park or roadside attraction, rather than a great restaurant. It is not what it was, but continues to believe it is.

9JcJVKSPHTrvO-qX0NekCA.text: Ok, the good: the food is amazing, the atmosphere is awesome. We love the dark seating, private booths and Sanatra music playing. This was my husbands 1st time here, he loved the old steakhouse feel, the boys club feel...The price was not bad for two with cocktails. Ive had more expensive meals that were not as delicious or enjoyable. Ok now the the bad: OMG the service was so lousy!!! We had a server seat us that i wish would have stayed with us but no, we got Miss. no where to be found, short, curt and obviously did not want to work that night! We actually would've had more drinks and probably gotten dessert but this woman could not even fill up our water glasses....she was MIA for most of the night! The servers around us actually spoke to their tables and were sweet and fun but this lady obviously did not want to have anything to do with us? Very confusing?  Beef N Bottle is a staple in Charlotte, I've been here many times in my 30 years here, however this by far was the worst experience!  Ill still come back and give it another shot, i just hope i don't get Miss. ray of f@$king sunshine again!

P8jpIwB3cfnQhM3ZgZfFtw.text: Did not feel impressed with the experience we had for Father's Day. All the food felt salty and over cooked. The steak tasted like something I could grill at home. The dessert was a waste of money and reminded me of something I could get at Walmart. The raw oysters also tasted dirty and old. Just an overall bad experience. Will not be back.

-cMO8J4U1a2UJRhznUh1Ow.text: I loved this place. 5 stars. Hands down. Old school. The place may not look like much like on outside, but ambiance is awesome and food is phenomenal.  I had the filet and lobster tail which was excellent. My wife had the trio medallions. I added the red wine and butter to filet which was an add on. Nice salad. Cheese spread is good. Creamed spinach is excellent. Order filet medium rare. Lobster with drawn butter. How can you go with one? We'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States

HOfU_zfvSMnXG_iM0X55Fg.text: I travel ALOT for work, and when I travel I always am looking for good restaurants. Beef 'N Bottle has been around for a long time and I can see why. All of their beef is dry aged, and cooked to perfection. I am a prime rib connoisseur, and I have to say that out of the 50+ restaurants that I have eaten prime rib at, Beef 'N Bottle takes the cake. I am absolutely blown away with how fantastic my steak was.

28TCksIn6F9b9rZW_RgcZQ.text: Terrible!! It took an hour before we even got the salad!!!  DRINKS: Hendrick gin soda- nice and strong Don Julio tequila soda- also good  SALADS: Cesar- good, but Cesar dressing was off. A strange zesty flavor.   Romain cucumbers- good, one bad leaf. Ranch- decent  MAIN ENTREES:  Filet mignon - my friend said it sucked!!! It was like Golden corral or a cafeteria's steak. . Not what a steak should be.   Fetechini Alfredo- gross, not even flavorful. A watery not be even a cheese flavor.   SIDES: Mashed potatoes- really bad. Not moist or hot. The flavor was off.   Fried cheese potatoes- the best here, but still not great. Like huge tater tots.

Wp6o2mf7tMEwKwkdP4KwxA.text: My first experience at Beef n'Bottle was almost perfect.  Truly one of the best steaks that I've ever had...  Here are my tips for first timers:  *Don't snooze on the bread, crackers, melba toast served with cheese spread.   Eat it!!  *Order a salad, they will bring you a plate of greens and a platter for the table to select the veggies that you'd like to put on your salad. Try the thinly sliced radishes, even if you don't usually like them, they are so good.  The veggie platter concept is different but a neat concept.  They make all of their dressings in house.  Trust me, they're great!  I tried the Ranch (very creamy) and balsamic vinaigrette (very tasty).  *Talk to your waiter, ask for their opinion.  They are very knowledgeable about the different types and cuts of meat.  Based on our server's recommendation,  I ordered the Delmonico. (Insert heart emojis here)I ordered my steak medium and it came out perfect in my book.  The steak was one of the most flavorful, juiciest steaks that I have probably EVER eaten. I like this place because their entrees do come with sides and a large onion ring, not like the other fancy steak places that have you order a la carte.  I chose sauteed mushrooms as my side: great choice for me and I will order both again and Again and AGAIN!     Service was very good.  Chip, Our server was personable and efficient.  However, he was spread too thin on the night that we were there, not his fault! We enjoyed speaking to him as he's worked there a long time and clearly enjoys his job and is very proud to be part of the BNB family.   This place is not fancy at all on the inside: think old school and dark and don't be scared away by the exterior either! One of few issues here was that it gets very loud and I believe its because of their low ceilings.  It was borderline uncomfortable towards the end of our meal, I couldn't concentrate on our conversation. Hence the loss of one star.   All in all, Im kicking myself for not coming here sooner.  Im glad the best friend and I came here for my birthday celebration and I cant wait to come back!

BjV7SFhAFeijj53YYXTj_Q.text: We had a Birthday celebration here last night, the food was amazing, the service was outstanding and they were very accommodating with our request. bonita our server was funny while courteous and professional. Thank you for a great time!

cpBIRvUGIDr6NYJMxF0DRQ.text: One of the best steaks we have had in a long time. My husband and I always try to find local restaurants every where we go. We decided to try this one for our anniversary. It did nor disappoint. The food and the atmosphere were amazing and waitress was very attentive and friendly. She made us feel right at home.  If we every have the opportunity again we will definitely be back.

TEc-UtwZSS0vDl7n-2AohQ.text: We have visited this place several times. We love the food and service we get here. Let's start with the things that keep bringing us back. The steaks are among the best prepared steaks in the Charlotte area and my wife's favorite steak.  The cream spinach, crab dip and cheesy potatoes are amazing. Those are our go to sides or apps. So, the look of the place is weird. It's dark, not romantic dark, like dungeon dark, but the service and food make up for it. We last few times we have eaten here, Baker has been our server and  honestly we would ask for her everytime because of how good she has been.  They also have a good wine selection. If you want a good local, quality steak and fine dining experience, this is the place. However, you will have to let go of how you expect fine dining places to look.

photos.caption: Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab dip

RyeZH7u7FMgDWkAnUTCm2w.text: You can't judge a restaurant by the building it's in! I was a little worried when we walked in, and there weren't many folks there (it was about 5:30), but boy did the crowd start to fill in and it became packed by the time we left around 8! It's a tiny little place, super rustic, but the service and food were outstanding. We cannot wait to go back! The salad/homemade dressings were a great start. You also HAVE to order the onion rings as an appetizer.. we were obsessed! We all got steaks (duh) as our entrees which came with a side and everyone thoroughly enjoyed their meal. Definitely don't miss this place! It's a gem.

photos.caption: Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ribeye w/ creamed spinach - delicious!
Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bar area - no bartender, so servers came by periodically to get our drink orders

8tgw92xp0Leuli3MlrxV3g.text: On the outside you'd never think this place was anything more than a run down gin mill. Inside it is small cramped noisy packed with diners and great food. We were nervous knowing this birthday dinner would cost $700 at least. We had shrimp, oysters Rockefeller and crab aopetuzers. Delicious. The spinach had a tad  to much nutmeg. We ordered the malbec red and it was so good we got a 2nd bottle. The steaks are aged and everyone was pleased although the lighting was so dim I could not see what I was carving. It didn't matter as I brought 3/4th s home. The birthday boy got a chocolate cake ice cream combo and the rest of us each got a bite of a lemon cream cake. Service was accurate and very fast.

jW_iLspEtlRKExLM_kllrg.text: {{Insert drooling emoji here}}  I had heard about Beef N Bottle from people for years, but it never came up in the "Where should we get dinner?" conversation. Finally got a couple friends (one of whom swears by Beef N Bottle) and made the pilgrimage.   You walk inside and are immediately transported to an episode of "Mad Men". I mean seriously, I wanted to light up a cigarette, grab an old-fashioned, and talk about how The Beatles are corrupting our youth! It is quite dark in there with a lot of candle lighting and no exterior light.   It was a packed Saturday night, and there was a sign on the door that stated you had to have a reservation before 9pm. Uh-oh. I slid in anyway and asked if there was any bar seating. Luckily I was able to locate a high-top table to secured it toot-sweet. The service was nothing spectacular but the food... oh the food.  Forget mouth-watering, drool-inducing is more accurate. I got a 6 oz. filet mignon and a baked potato and could have died a happy man after that meal. I do not remember if it came with a salad or not, but I had one and it was great. The baked potato was delicious, but the filet was just out of this world. Hands down the best steak I have had in years.   I just alerted my wife that we're going there for my birthday this year!

photos.caption: Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States

dvX4oqdwQOUYNz8sAhGFvg.text: One of my favorite places in Charlotte. I still swear by Beef N Bottle as the best steakhouse here.   It's not fancy at all on the outside. It's has an old Chicago, mafia type feel inside. The service is always top notch. I've never had a bad experience.   Your experience starts with a basket of crackers and this cheese-like spread. Don't judge it, eat it. You're welcome in advance. If you like horseradish, you must order an app that involves their homemade cocktail sauce. So damn good. I usually go with oysters. They are monstrous, huge in size.   You've got to get a steak when you come here, but their shrimp scampi is so ridiculously delicious. Solution: get a combo. And if you don't see one on the lost you like, create your own. I always get the delmonico (all steaks come with an onion ring on top) and shrimp scampi, with a loaded baked potato and salad. The salad is a plate of iceberg lettuce. They bring out a plate of veggies and you can top yours however you want. You're probably thinking, why would I want to get a salad then? Well, it's because they make all their dressings. Stupid good. I go with the blue cheese.  For dessert, warm apple pie and cinnamon ice cream. I don't care how full you are. Also of note, half price wine on Mondays. You can also bring in your own wine for a reasonable corkage fee. However, I recommend starting with a dirty martini with blue cheese stuffed olives.

photos.caption: Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States. Extra dirty martini with blue cheese stuffed olives
Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States. They have the most amazing cocktail sauce!! And these oysters are massive
Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States. All the homemade dressings are so delicious

Tb9CPSsBAiXo5LnLbik0mA.text: Always an incredible meal and friendly service!

D2BgDs3qfd53S8SY-MBZcw.text: Last night four of us met up for dinner and to discuss a project we are working on. We ended up going to the Beef and Bottle here in Charlotte.  I would describe the experience this way:  Parking,- ample and very well lit Service,- PERFECT from the moment we entered until we left Atmosphere,- PERFECT Food & Drink,- PERFECT, PERFECT, PERFECT!  We didn't have reservations, but they managed to get us seated promptly.  My recommendation? Make a reservation ASAP. Go, enjoy yourself, and order anything on the menu. You will not be disappointed!

f9rjT9Yv1_a1BaWn-I2VhA.text: Went for the first time for my birthday  2 days ago and ordered a steak med well ..... got it rare  .... our waiter never came back so by the time I could get it cooked longer everyone was done eating! The waiter had a bad attitude and became agitated ..... very bad service !!!

WGxWrbJOTRK1auP1lYB9hA.text: This is my new favorite place! My husband and I ordered the cajun crab dip, 6 oz filet and crab cake combination, 10 oz filet Oscar style with creamed spinach, mushrooms and mashed potatoes. The salad came with a huge plate of toppings, as well. I would recommend this place to anyone and especially any of the items we ordered.

-L02SVvv4FosdiGwsHx1MA.text: BNB has just officially solidified its spot in my mind as one of the best eating experiences in Charlotte. Heaps above sooooo many others. Do notice though that I said EXPERIENCE. If you are looking for modern uptight decor, an inventive menu, or a cheap dinner, then no, this isn't the place for you. However if you can enjoy an old school, " if it ain't broke don't fix it" kind of vibe then you will be in pure heaven here.  Sure the outside looks dated, but perhaps it's because this place has been around since the 50s so yeah...it IS old. I appreciate that they have kept it old school outside as well as in instead of giving in to the current treatment of so many great spaces (see: Doubledoor, Tommys Pub, The Steeple, and the majority of Southend) which is mow it down and build something generic.   The menu is the same way, classic upscale dining straight out of your Grandmas first cookbook on how to entertain for guests, complete with melba toasts, oysters rockefeller and one of the best darn martinis I've ever had. The steaks are king here however, perfectly seasoned to the perfect temp and unlike most steakhouses that cost this much for an a la carte steak, the ones at BNB come with a salad AND a side. The salad is served as a plate of lettuce per person and a plate full of veggies to go on top. Everyone can customize their salad to their liking and might leave a few extra veggies for dipping in the delicious homemade dressings. When it comes to the sides don't miss the creamed spinach, it is sooo good.   Not only is the food and atmosphere awesome here, the service is top notch as well. Personable and real without coming across as trying too hard, our waitress was once of the best I have had in a very long time. Just attentive enough without hovering, it was just the kind of service I look for in fine dining. She really went above and beyond and knew her stuff.  As long as you know what you are getting into (and are excited about that) you will adore this place. So throw on your best vintage dress (or suit) and enjoy a meal out like in the good ol' days.

5bgJgVwvLPjjcRe0e5of7w.text: I certainly miss the old Ranch House Steakhouse. I was so pleasantly surprised to find another restaurant left in Charlotte with the ambiance and fabulous steaks and seafood. My family dined at the Beef n Bottle last night to celebrate a birthday. It was everything a revered steakhouse should be: the ambiance was vintage; the wait staff very informed, helpful and efficient; the steaks and seafood entrees were prepared and served perfectly. In observing other diners it was not difficult to surmise that this restaurant was a cherished destination for many others. I cannot wait to go again. Be sure to make a reservation if you want to be certain to be seated.

b3YCx_Ffijad7_UKxrK4jw.text: BOOOOO... I never heard of a restaurant that doesn't have takeout ..SMH so I went in food was horrible worst mistake.. some people in Charlotte seam like they just don't know better.. I don't know why the good reviews

TfLfmDNqy89ViM6dJJQmfw.text: As out of towner's finding the oldest steakhouse with it's old school atmosphere, delicious food, wonderful wine selection we were thrilled. We had no reservations but were seated immediately. Our server was friendly and attentive. My steak was cooked to perfection. My shrimp scampi in the butter/wine sauce was slurp worthy!   If any negatives...would be the very close seating arrangements. If on a date reserve a booth or the table next to you will hear everything. We didn't care and actually met a couple very nice people.  Definitely a hidden gem in Charlotte!

Ys01bppAFjNEfLP37WiwvQ.text: Amazing in every way. Great staff, great food, great ambiance. We were accommodated for a reservation on short notice with no problem. A blessing for sure. Our steaks were the best I have ever had. Homemade cocktail sauce and salad dressings were awesome. This is my favorite place to go for special occasions. Old school Charlotte the way I like it.

1cTboQrIqaI-fu7Bt0mpLg.text: One of the best in Charlotte! The atmosphere is like no other restaurant. A complete "hole in the wall" and that makes me love it even more! Appetizers, salads, STEAKS and dessert ... everything is delicious! Love the crackers and cheese to start. Such a classic place! Must try for everyone!

XozRxyfWf78XjfYKPxCaDA.text: In total for the amount of money you spend in beef 'N Bottle you can go somewhere much fancier and get the same food.  I give 1 out of 5 star to their salad. Their silverware is cheaper than the one you might find in $1 stores. Their food is good. Their bathroom is a disaster.  This place need renovation and some upgrade.

Dw48-imcE_p7nnUSH90P6w.text: I have to give this one star and I will write why. some of this is fact and some is my opinion.  fact: the place from the outside looks like garbage if not a trailer. then when you get inside of the place it looks very fancy. the staff it self is very hickish so do not expect high end people to serve you because it's not going to happen.  the food is also very expensive and the taste is far from up to par with the price! I had their 10 oz filet and I can't say it was any better than a outback if not outback was better.  my wife had salmon which she said was not fresh. btw, she was born and raised on an island in the Philippines.  my friend had the sea scallops and shrimp mix. both not fresh at all and half left.  my other friend had the frog leg dinner which they claim to famous for, I tasted it and almost threw up. that one we had taken off the bill.  the deserts are 100% garbage as well, I cannot put my fingers on it but it seems like they buy frozen stuff from someplace.  now here is the part that gets me . we walked in on a Monday and it's packed! why?! it's terrible and expensive to boot. I did notice most people were not from North Carolina, and it seemed to be business trips so perhaps it's near their hotel and they are not paying and don't care? very few locals.   anyway beware it's horrible

wsK2Y5xh8W8ifsUBEUniMg.text: This place continues to underwhelm. Yet, I continue to be forced to go here with family (party of 6, 9, and 7 respectively) who like it for some reason. This was my last time. This is a detailed review not for the faint of heart. Continue at your own risk. Overall points of interest are toward the end.  The Ugly Truth about my last THREE visits: Three visits in a row my order has been messed up. The last two I ended taking an undercooked steak home in a box because the kitchen can't manage to cook a medium rare OR a medium steak properly. How hard is that to do? 4 steak in two visits, first two were ordered medium but presented burnt/charred at Well Done level then replaced with RARE ones which I took home and cooked properly later. Each of the last 3 visits I ended up filling up on apps, sides, and a couple bites of desert. I've tried different cuts (Filet and Ribeye) but it made no difference. I always order my steaks from here with seasoning added because they are extremely bland if you do not.  Overall:  APPEARANCE/AMBIANCE - D- Restaurant looks like a hole in the wall from the exterior and the layout of the interior isn't much better. It's always EXTREMELY loud inside because it's a small restaurant. Back patio is a little better than the front. I would NOT take a date here expecting a quiet romantic evening. SERVICE - A -  has always been excellent, friendly, knowledgeable and timely. Table is pre-bussed, food arrives neatly and timely, tempo is always nearly perfect. FOOD QUALITY/TASTE - C Appetizers are good quality and taste great but I believe are overpriced. We love the shrimp cocktail but it's on the expensive side. Salads and dressing are very nominal. I've had better at lesser places. Steaks are good quality but bland unless you order it seasoned... Then pray it's cooked properly. Lobster was overcooked and rubbery Deserts are all excellent. Haven't had one I didn't like. But by the time I've gotten to this point on each of the last 3 visits my meal has been ruined. KITCHEN - F - details are posted above. 3 visits in a row with something on my order not cooked properly. NOT acceptable anywhere. COST- overpriced for what this place is. They should invest some money in kitchen help and COMPLETE renovation.  Personally, I would save your money and go to Longhorn, Texas Roadhouse, etc or spend a little more and go to any one of the big chains (Ruth's Kris, Mortens, etc) Hope this helps someone decide where (or where not) to go for dinner.

bf7oM5eXB6W0PqShcXlALg.text: Service was amazing, steak was AMAZING, great wine, great crab dip, crab cake was sub-par. Couldn't even finish it

QiIlBY959K5FQKgAnIaZBg.text: First time here tonight.  Yes the outside looks a little rough but he inside is great and has a throwback feel to it, Rat Pack Etc.    Steaks were cooked perfectly and the service was fantastic!  Really great night, we'll be back

LIup_7owprGKww25b3UK0w.text: Definitely NOT worth the price.  Food was good, as good as Sullivans, but the price was astronomical and certainly not as classy as Sullivans.  The annoying thing is that they automatically add a 20% gratuity for parties of 5 or more.  We had five in our party, service as mediocre at best, and had to pay the gratuity for exceptional service (and he calculated it incorrectly so paid 22% !!! ).  Dark dank atmosphere added with the noise level...needed hearing protection...way too loud to carry on a normal inside voice conversation.  Will not return.

Y6m9dSx_7kA6mxFwmmI2NQ.text: Below are the "lowlights":  * Restaurant is dark and dingy.    * Seated in the corner of a small dark room. * No rolls.    * Asked waitress if salad would have blue cheese crumbles and she said "yes".    Salad came with no crumbles.   And, I was disappointed it was a "salad from a bag".     * Ordered a ribeye medium rare.    Steak was tough and knives were dull.   * $35 bottle of Merlot was "low end".     So, I left  1/2 my steak on the plate and went away an "unhappy camper".      I'd had a much better experience at other restaurants for  1/2 the price!    $140 for two was waaaaay too much.     On the bright side our waitress was very nice.     Restaurant did not respond to my complaint letter mailed to them almost a month ago.

73KfmYpLuwbIP-Pkhw3LeQ.text: The Beef and Bottle is old South Charlotte, not a chain.  They do steaks extremely well, yes sir melt in your mouth well.  The salads are simple but fresh and the salad dressings I'm told are made in house, wow!  It's not cheap.  I've been going four or five times a year for 20 years.  On special occasions with my wife, she likes it to.  Not the best part but certainly a perk, the drinks!  They make a proper high ball that keeps the conversation going even if you've been married 25 years.  Keep it going Beef N Bottle!

kjzqNfvGfLPlYzwlhdKTjA.text: Old school steakhouse straight outta Goodfellas.  The Freeway was backed up so Mrs. S and I tried slithering down Juarez alley aka South Blvd towards home.   We both spied the building at the same time and just gave each other that look.     That look that married couples give each other that says "What the Hell  was that?" and "Let's turn around" simultaneously.  Turns out it's an old school surf and turf joint from 1958.  We were 45 mins ahead of dinner hour so we scored a table.  Hey. you know this kind of joint.  Walls covered with black and white prints of  movie stars from the 40's and onward.  Frankie,  Sammy, and Dino right there with Rita Hayworth and  even Liberace.  Lights down low and piped in tunes from the rat pack and anything 50's.  Started with a Manhattan which I have to say was fabulous.  We both opted for seafood platters.  Look, maybe the steaks are great,  I don't know.  The seafood was similar to Calabash style and was very good.  Places like this have been doing it forever and they've got their bread and butter dishes down pat.  Our server Seth .... well Seth abides. nuff said.  Long and short, foodies may find the place lacking.   Seafood was spot on and I'm guessing steaks are too.   No haute cuisine but hey, fuhgetabouttit.  Food is good enough and the atmosphere just  added ten points to my testosterone level just for sitting there.   Didn't see Joe Pesci  in a corner booth but maybe next time.  Bill for two with wine and cocktails $91 before tip.

H1jFMJR9m7sNf_ZWW6xUyw.text: In this age of "grade inflation," some people are going to look at these three stars and think that's a bad score.  It's not.  Beef & Bottle is A-OK.    Decent food.  Decent price.  Good service.  Nothing earth shattering.  Glad I finally went.  I was hoping it'd be a little classier in terms of the clientele's manner of dress.  We had on coats and ties, and there were old Baby Boomers in shorts at the next table.  (Oh, well.  I don't expect much from that generation except constant disappointment and amazement at their complete lack of regard for the rest of the world, but I digress...)  Bottom line: for this much money, I'd rather go somewhere else.  Been there once and am happy I did, since it's a Charlotte institution (and we don't have a lot of those).  But I have no need to ever go back.  That's not a bad thing.  Three stars, man.

aJkALKmmdRf1IGQozSWYUQ.text: Absolutely love this place. Best steak and best atmosphere. Make sure to call for reservations as everyone eats at this steakhouse. Also note that the waiters, waitresses and bar staff are all top notch.

photos.caption: Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States

HO8ezJ4pwoR9SS_K0gpLjw.text: Classic steakhouse with excellent food. The interior looks like a scene out of the 1950's. The steak is always tender and cooked to perfection. The creamed spinach is also delicious. One of our favorite places to celebrate special occasions.

IvYsuzeQC3hA7zFT4FbjoQ.text: I had the best steak I've had in a long time. Service was great, atmosphere was awesome, and the prices were to be expected for this type of steakhouse. The history in this place really seem to set the setting. Highly recommend this to anyone

zoZJHVsVRRF6HZXpYNpRuA.text: Reservation is a must. Came on Tuesday at 8:30PM and were glad we called ahead. Prices are high for the location and ambience but steak is great. However, would like to be served fresh bread rolls instead of saltine crackers when paying $48 per entree...

7jBJYvHUHvaMyFj1bpzLQA.text: One of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte! Their steaks have so much flavor. Most of the other steakhouses in Charlotte - which are chains - require you to order your sides separately and your bill can get very expensive. You definitely get the most bang for your buck here. The food is always good and it is not overpriced!

tIQBYKBPATRqp4PdQs579A.text: My boyfriend and I were escaping the hell known as Charlotte Restaurant Week from a well-known steakhouse chain after being shoved into a tiny table in a ridiculously loud restaurant, and decided to come to B&B for a good steak.  I'd never been, and it lived up to it's charming, old-school reputation.  The wait staff was terrific and friendly, they squeezed us in at 9pm, no questions asked, the petite filet was moist and delicious and perfectly cooked, and the stead fries were crispy and fantastic.  The prices were reasonable, and we had a wonderful (and quiet, and better lit) dinner.  Would recommend to anyone for the quality of their steaks (my boyfriend got the ribeye and said it was terrific).  And THANK YOU for not participating in Charlotte Restaurant week...very few do!

3tHqo0rJil02d75VklI9fA.text: Everything everyone said was True - very old school, crackers and port wine cheese for openers, no windows, like a double-wide with food!  All of this would be charming, cool, retro if the food were GREAT.  It wasn't.  It wasn't terrible, just okay.  I had the kabobs and found the dish plain and without flavor.  Dont know how they cook, but had no charcoal flavor or other seasoning.  Daughter had rib-eye, which was better, wife had filet I think.  None of it was great, which begs the question of why you go here - it ain't for the atmosphere and the prices are not cut rate so ... um ... yeah.

DuZ-GXFyy1F5wGT3H-taoA.text: The Beef & Bottle restaurant is a landmark in Charlotte. Unfortunately I've been once in the 20+ yrs I have lived in Charlotte. Driving by the restaurant isn't a decor you recognize, but going off of reviews from friends, coworkers, yelp, and other search engines made me realize I have missed out after all those years. The food was incredible for a fine dining restaurant with a set back in time. Black and white photos cover the walls inside the dimly lit atmosphere. The music was a turn off for me and sounded more like a soda shop than a an elegant experience. Service was fantastic. Most importantly is the food. My boyfriend and I ordered the prime rib, mash potatoes, and a salad. Cooked to perfection and leftovers are always a pleasure. I definitely will be back and will pass on the recommendations to friends and family just like reviews were given to me.

RRXMRVMfh_l_ZxCetSKPbw.text: This place is about as old school as it gets. Don't let the exterior (shabby sheik) fool you. This would be the Charlotte destination foe the Rat Pack. If your goal is finding the best steak in Charlotte, this is your spot.

Lj6f2AWCZnLlVcvH6nY1xA.text: Well, here we go, I am going to state my opinion of Beef and Bottle. Who asked you ?? You ask..Me  and if there is any more people out there like me who have been driving by this well know institution on South Blvd for 8 years now. About 5 months ago there was the "Living Social " for this very restaurant! I was scared but excited to try this place which looks like an industrial construction building but so many people on Face book had raved about  and said buy  the Living Social  for this treat! We arrived with a reservation tonight, a Tuesday, it was packed! The place is exactly as described in the prior reviews...its a time warp its stuck in the 1960's , not a bad place to be --kind of cross between my Dads old Basement office and a run down previously fancy supper club.  We did sit for quite a while before anyone approached our table. Our waitress was friendly and took our drink orders and informed us of the specials this evening. We had 5 people in our party. We ordered a varied amount of the specialty items (steaks) off the menu. The salad , which is served plain is accompanied by a nice tray of fresh vegetable and very good homemade salad dressing. It was a long stretch of time though between our drinks and our salad. Next the steaks arrived..My husband had the 6 oz filet...medium rare, My daughter the Ribeye, rare, my daughters fiance had the Sirloin well done and our other friend had the Shrimp Scampi. I ordered the 30.00 New York Strip, encrusted with Horseradish sauce.-----RARE. Well ,my steak was medium at least..if not to the well done side. I cut it in half right away, to stop the cooking process..it was about 15-20 minutes until the waitress came back around to ask how everything was when I informed her of the doneness of my steak. She took it back and said she would have a new for me. Everyone continued to eat at my insistence..although I didnt think that a RARE steak would take too long. Well 25 minutes later my steak came out...I immediately cut into it --starving and salivating! Medium----AGAIN...The owner came up behind me and said..how is your steak I was told it was to well done the first time...He looked down and said...Uh Oh ..this is not RARE..And he picked it up and said it would be replaced and I would not be charged. Another 20 minutes went by..the steak that came back was okay ..medium rare and small and very very grisily I ate about a third of it and it had to spit out four mouthfuls because I could not chew it. The creamed spinach that I got with it was not good..it was cold when I received it and the flavor was not creamy or good. The steak was taken off my check..but for a place named "BEEF AND BOTTLE" I think this was a Faux Pas! I will not be returning and now when I pass this weird little place on South Blvd I will be glad I am not wondering anymore.....

1GwWpKlNLu-S6i3bFzZ5uA.text: What is so great about this steakhouse?  Yeah it's been around a long time but that's no excuse to overcharge for a steak.  Prices are too high for what you get.  $38 for a fatty12 oz ribeye that came out medium when I ordered medium rare.  Better off going to chain steakhouse.

UfaMahdm4fjGYFRl48kZnQ.text: Our first time here.  Decor was very cool.  You could bring your own wine (cork fee is $15) - very cool.  Food was decent - the one thing I would question is menu vs. portion size. I ordered the 12oz Ribeye - ordered it rare. I know the weight is determined prior to cooking, but that steak came out to me at about 6oz.

gZyCJJvOZJTLJOWfMGn8ZA.text: I went here one night when I was craving a good steak and I didn't feel like going to Sullivan's.  I had passed it for the last 10 years and never been in and now I'm upset I didn't go sooner.  You walk in and you expect to see Cary Grant or Fran Sinatra sitting at a table in the corner.  It's dim lights and great Rat Pack music from the 40's.  Friendly service and a great old school atmosphere.        We started off with a french onion soup.  Not fancy but very tasty.  The food here is the center point of the dining experience.  No frills just good quality food.  The salads came and I loved it.  They serve you a pate of lettuce with the dressings and veggies on the side so you can put on your salad what you like.  Great concept.  Great Blue cheese dressing.      I had the NY Strip rare and it rocked.  Best steak I have had in Charlotte.  The thing I love is when you order rare here it really is rare.  Not Medium or medium-well like some other place that serve you a steak  on a hot sizzling plate and charge high prices for crap food.  Perfectly cooked here at the Beef and Bottle.  My friend got the Prime Rib medium rare.  It just melted in your mouth.  I also had the backed sweet potato that was awesome.  My friend had the onion rings.  They are the bomb.  Most of the steaks come with an onion ring on top.  Thy bread is toasted and buttered french bread.  So good.      Also there is another review on here that talks about the orange butter that is hard and sticky.  To my surprise it's not butter it's cheddar cheese spread.  It's on all the tables with crackers to nibble on while you wait on your food.  I guess some people need to get out more.  Cheese is not butter.  This place serves real butter if you ask for butter.  All ingredients are high quality.  A hidden gem in Charlotte.  I will be back as often.  This place rocks...

gklthit4sRIR28u6qiKetg.text: Steaks were awesome. Melt in your mouth. Better yet when we asked to sit in the dining room rather than the back room they went out of their way to accommodate us

INkGshLbfow-9oWAxJfXKQ.text: Very average.  Cheese and crackers upon arrival was nonsense but the French Onion Soup was good.  The pre meal salad was weird.  They brought a plate of lettuce with a side of vegetables and a pot of dressing.  This was unnecessarily complex.  I could understand if they brought an array of exotic veggies that people wouldn't like, but it was staples like cucumber, onion and peppers.  The Ribeye steak was well cooked but non nondescript.  Half price wine night was the highlight, and the only reason it got 3 stars. Better than an OutBack, worse than a prime steakhouse.

cQnYe-tvXgYZn4VDV1BDwQ.text: One of the worst experiences I have ever had at a restaurant. Came with friends and it was disastrous. From the trashy red haired lady at the host stand, to the highly rude and unprofessional staff I can't decide what was worse. I was rushed out of their so quickly it was unbelievable. The waitress, which was an older blonde lady, what she didn't know could fill a book. To cap it all off, this older guy who I'm led to believe was the manager, an old bald guy basically told me I had to hurry up. Rudeness personified. The salads were rotten and the way it's presented is so redneck trash. Brings out a plate of rotten lettuce and vegetables, the veggies were from another table because it still had dressing on it which means they re-use them which is absolutely disgusting. What if that person was sick?  They don't care at Beef N Bottle. The quality of steak is really low BTW, barely choice. Really tough and full of gristle. Low low quality restaurant. Will never go back.

ulGmsWPzSi1bwaRZ0iwdig.text: Truly looks like a strip club from the street. Would never have walked in to the place were it not for Yelp.   The experience is a bit schizoid. You enter through the rear parking lot into an atrium and then pass through down a step in to a dark dining area. Our greeter looked approximately 16 and didn't quite fit in the overall club-y vibe they seem to be going for.  Similarly schiz-y were the customers who were dressed in date nite dinner-out clothes as well as shorts and t-shirts. I am not sure who the target market is as there were small kids around, which seemed out-of-place, as well as middle-aged couples who were clearly regulars.  Food is steakhouse circa 1972. Dishes are straight up what-you-see-is-what-you-get. What they do, they do well but there are absolutely no surprises.  Steak or shrimp, salad, potatoes and some kind of side veggie.  Didn't try the desserts as we were stuffed from the meal.Overall service was pleasant and well-modulated.  Not sure if this is a place to take a date as it is solid, but not stellar.

rXovTz1HplsM-SUUK6Hq9Q.text: Food quality somewhere between a Texas Roadhouse/Western Sizzlin and an outback.  The service was slow, steaks heavily seasoned, and presentation was poor.  The sides were good, and the atmosphere was nice for something different (hole in the wall) but the food was below average.  Typically in Charlotte you get what you pay for, at Beef & Bottle price is no indication.

WASSIuglUJUm3gaoJdeV7g.text: I think the best thing about this place is the service! The staff was exceptional! The food on the other hand was just eh whatever and we had to pay 3x average prices for it. Not my favorite place to eat and I don't think I would go back. It was so dark in there that you could barely see your hand in front of your face. It wasn't romantic... just irritating. Makes you wonder what people are hiding when it is 'that' dark. I think overall the place is hit or miss. The last time we went the food was exceptional. The recent time. Just eh. It's too expensive to try again for a 'hit'.

JQreCWxTANebsbwPuKLTog.text: Thanks to the great reviews here, I ate dinner at Beef -n- Bottle tonight.    I loved the weird (yep, I describe it as weird) ambiance.  The front dining room was completely full so I was seated in the "atrium."  The atrium reminds me of an old windowed-in porch we used to have in my family's lakehouse when I was a kid - it was very casual and luckily air conditioned.  The service was attentive but not overbearing and the food was fantastic.  It wasn't fancy by any stretch of the imagination, but the food was top-notch.  I had the Ribeye, medium-rare and a baked sweet potato on the side, served with a generous dallop of cinnamon-sugar butter.  I could feel my arteries hardening - and it was a fantastic meal.  This place may not be on the caliber of a Mortons or a Ruth's Chris from a service and ambiance perspective, but wow the food was good.  Big thumbs up!

jgaZF_fDLph7V2L26YrPYQ.text: The staff is unfriendly.  They seem miserable and make the person dining feel awkward.  The food was mediocre.  It's a neat atmosphere, however the staff killed the vibe.

FFZGrjbZocr19QfES0q3HA.text: I would give 3.5 stars if I could. It is definitely a classic venue and it has that appeal.  The raw oysters were good as was the shrimp scampi. Frog legs were ok and I was not impressed with the oysters Rockefeller. I had a ribeye medium rare for my entree and it was a decent steak. I had apple pie a la mode for dessert and it was ok. I would eat there again but would choose other places in Charlotte first. The prices were reasonable though.  I will push to 4 stars because of service.

9RAu4pK7ogUXeba4buPmVA.text: We loved it!!  I had the ribeye, h. had filet and b. had filet w/bleu cheese topping - awesome.!!!!  We liked that it was not dressy or pretentious, and LOVED the atmosphere.  H. and I plan to go back for a romantic dinner, which is what it inspired in us.    We are not big partiers but were happy with our drinks there, and the timeframe you are given on busy nights- plenty of time to enjoy a great dinner.  Do call for a reservation though on Fri.-Sat., it  was packed!!  :)  So don't believe everything you read - we had no problems, and it was fun and Fantastic food-!!!  :)

8e7XiTZmcbQO7pp8S0e2aA.text: Very disappointing. The smell of vomit as you enter the front door sets the stage. I ordered a $32 ribeye. What I received was a $15 steak that can be found at longhorn steakhouse. The creamed spinach was runny.  I had to find out from the waitress who was serving the table next to me that you can get 2 sides instead of the salad.  My waitress barely described the specials let alone tell me something else and I had already ordered the Caesar salad.  The menu states it is "homemade" but as I found out for "the other" waitress, the Caesar dressing is the only one not made in-house.  This restaurant has rested on their laurels for far too long. They need to clean up the act.

PdfLX1U-HRh6YepnAMeIKw.text: Great Scott! I traveled back in time and didn't need a Delorean OR 1.21 jiggawatts of electricity! All I needed to do was eat at the Beef and Bottle.  Old school? Based on the wood paneling and framed, yellowed photos of such greats as Neil Diamond, Frank Sinatra and, who is that? Bert Convy?, the Beef and Bottle was settled and collecting dust when Old School was in kindergarten. Sure, it's not exactly SWANK (the piano bar seems more converted trailer/walled in patio than anything), but I'm not exactly a swank cat. I tend to travel the other side of the tracks. (And by "other side," I mean the underneath.) To wit, I thought the strange rear entrance, the presence of barbed wire and, yes, the wood paneling, actually were POSITIVES rather than negatives.  The food? Tasty. Not too expensive. Actually the steaks were priced around those of Longhorn and Outback rather than a Ruth Chris. However, the sear and crust on my ribeye were superior to those chain joints, so point goes to B&B. The meat was cooked to spec, medium rare. Sure, the most nouvelle the menu gets is the presence of shrimp, but hey, sometimes the occasion calls for a salad of iceberg lettuce and gloppy ranch dressing. That last sentence sounds insulting, but I assure you aspiring Foodie Douches, it is not. I meant it with great sincerity.  In fact, the only thing I found to gripe about was the intensely low lighting made the menu difficult to read though, I'm sure, it makes your date much more attractive. I'll give Beef and Bottle a solid 4 stars. I think I'll be coming back when I return to town.

fBoyNNPOrSCPa2Pd2YG3rQ.text: The manager ask us to leave before  we were finished with our meal saying they need the table.  Not a very nice way to end the meal  I guess they need  the money to keep the place open not looking for repeat customers!  Will not return due to the rude service.

Vk1Gj7gLKRMEINZewsbuCg.text: Beer and wine only, ok. The appetizers looked good but were very disappointing. The crab dip tasted like tuna and the oysters Rockefeller tasted like Lipton mix. The filet trio dinner was tasty and my hubby's filet and lobster tail were cooked properly. Our server was attentive and polite. Atmosphere is definitely it's original state from back in the day, but not in a good way in my opinion. I'm also not a fan on the unisex bathroom. For the price we paid ($165) I'd rather go to a different steak house.

photos.caption: Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States. Filet trio is a good way to sample.
Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States. Surf and Turf is solid.
Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States. Appetizers look better than they taste.

oM8MVSDpAOibX6nusoc6Ug.text: Unique, and worth visiting.   My suggestion: Make a reservation for the dining room, yet go early to have a drink in the bar.  The bar area is reminiscent of an addition to your grandparents' house. What is this structure? Fascinating. The drinks are stiff, and the bar itself can accommodate perhaps 8 people.  Service was quality. On a busy holiday night, Diane was both acting bartender and acting server. She was calm, professional, and informative. She made no excuses and enhanced my experience.  Appetizers: Crackers and cheese spread are on the table - and not unlike the snack-size cheese & crackers with the red plastic stick you may have had as a child. Shrimp cocktail with the Two Napkin Cocktail Sauce ("one for your mouth, one for your brow") is a multi-level experiential item served in a silver holder. It requires some muscle to free your shrimp.   Steaks: I can vouch for both the NY Strip steak and the Filet Mignon. Delicious, cooked to order, and above all, left me feeling great afterwards. Ruth's, the Palm, Del's, etc. all tend to make me want to lie down when I am finished.  Salad: This is a neat experience with a nice touch. All entrees come with a choice of Caesar or Traditional salad.  For the traditional salad (I've never ordered their Caesar), you get lettuce on a plate along with a tray featuring radishes, cucumbers, tomatoes, celery, and onions. You get to build your own salad.   I've not had any sides that surprised me - positive or negative.  Men's Bathroom: The decor is striking and from decades past. Bold uniform tile, in-wall toilet paper holder, mood lighting, and the lack of a sink. Yet there's a color poster of Marilyn Monroe from the 1990's with the "Marilyn Monroe (TM)" in cursive. A black & white 8x10 of Ms. Monroe seems more befitting.  When I asked the managerial-looking gentleman in the red shirt about this, he said "EBay."   I am unsure if that answered my question.

photos.caption: Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States. Men&#39;s Bathroom. Sometimes frequented by women.
Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States. Julio Iglesias welcomes you to the restroom waiting area.

5JsOHKJiRYynWel45OT6Yg.text: Birthday party of six. Food was excellent, the service by David was perfect. The only reason for four stars is that I thought the prices were too high. Other than that--excellent!

6dann6Wb71VY8xPN42_M2w.text: You definitely don't know you're pulling into a hug-end steakhouse when you pull into the parking lot. However, when you get inside, you immediately know you're in for a good meal. Your servers are you waiters, bartenders and busboys. They do it all. The food is reasonably priced. I had the oysters on the half shell and they were fresh and clean. The cocktail sauce is excellent! My entree was the salmon salad. It was a lot of lettuce and a small amount of salmon. The veggies are not chopped or sized for a salad. Instead, you get large slices of veggies; maybe people like cutting their own toppings - not me. The balsamic dressing was good, though.   Parking is limited.

photos.caption: Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States. The oysters were clean and fresh, and the cocktail sauce was perfect.
Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States. The salad was enormous, but it was mostly lettuce. The toppings weren&#39;t cut for a salad and the protein was very small.
Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States. The oysters are fresh, clean and delicious.

sVY57wFLO6Bv_E5gSQE2VQ.text: Beef and Bottle always delicious and never disappoints. My favorite steakhouse in Charlotte. Not a fancy place, but has the best steak and shrimp scampi in the city. The make your own salad, home made Italian and blue cheese dressing is so good. Its nice to go to a steakhouse where a salad and side is included with entree.  B & B is a little place that reminds you of a scene from Goodfellas. Definitely a old school staple in Charlotte.

zj5PN05jCReS9rJmLANfiw.text: This was our forth or fifth time eating at beef and bottle. Our first visit was amazing but with each visit after it has declined. The first time or two we thought it was a bad night and understood because we both had been in the service industry years ago. But tonight took the absolute cake for worst dining experience ever. Let me start by saying we saw a large table that had arrived 15-20 minutes after us get their food before us. We had been sitting there over an hour when our food finally came after we  finally said something to our server. The servers response when we asked her if they had forgotten about us was "no, you just came at our busiest time." It was like she was blaming us for their mistakes. We had reservations. She was just rude. Our salads were served long before the table beside us but their salads were cleared long before ours and it wasn't because we had not finished our salads before them. I ordered my filet med only to get it burnt on the outside. It had such a horrible after taste that I only ate 2 bites and told the server to just take it back. There was no way I was going to have my food ruined again. I ate maybe 4 bites of my baked potato that was very flavorless. I'm not sure if it was the Caesar salad or the blue cheese crumbles that my fiance had tonight but he woke up in the middle of the night sick to his stomach and belching which is an indication of food poisoning. I had lost my appetite and wasn't hungry when we left but later woke up hungry and made myself a peanut butter and jelly sandwich. I'm now waiting to see if my 6 year old wakes up sick to know if it was the Caesar salad or not. Btw they don't normally serve bread but if they do (which they did tonight) then you know that your food has taken extremely too long to serve.

n9goW9IN0z-mdoHD3tHrKw.text: This was another successful "Foodies and Fellowship - November Edition," event organized by a good friend of mine here in Charlotte (FYI -  every other month my friend invites a group of Charlotte locals (transplants) to a evening out for dinner at a random restaurant in the Queen City; an unique way to fellowship and try out a different/new restaurant).  Back to the review: Don't judge a book by its cover or in this case don't judge a restaurant by it's exterior design - which can be said for Beef 'N Bottle. This restaurants old fashion and traditional building holds inside one of the best tasting steaks I have eaten in a long time.  I can see why it is a Charlottes award winning steak restaurant.   I ordered the NY Strip, medium cooked, along with a side of cheese broccoli. The meal comes with a salad; only the slices of veggie comes on a platter for you to choose from.  The restaurant was slightly dark and tight, which added to the ambiance.  Our waiter was energetic and did an excellent job breaking down the menu.   I enjoyed myself.

photos.caption: Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States. Steak

mAwcN7R14DjZp_tOyJUYnA.text: I came to Charlotte for the farthest thing from a good time.  My Sister Nancy has 2 BrainTumors and I'm out here to be with her and help my Mom to care for her.  Last Thursday evening I Googled Best Steakhouses in Charlotte and this " Hole in the Wall" place called the Beef 'n Bottle came up on top of one of these lists.  I called my Niece Sara and asked her and her Husband Jon if they had heard of it which he had so we decided to check it out.  What a fantastic decision it was.  You can go to Ruth's Chris, Morton's or Flemings for the same experience pretty much every time. It's always good but always the same.  Every once in a while you will find a place like Beef 'n Bottle where time seems to have stood still.  We went on Sunday evening so it wasn't crowded as we needed a break from the stress of my Sister's condition  We were seated immediately upon arrival at The Doris Day Table which is one of there most popular we were told.    Our Server Hilary with one "L" was also our Bartender.  She started us off with a rundown on how things worked there and gave us some of the History of the place.  I had a fantastic Makers Mark Manhattan Up and Jon had an Old Fashioned.  Then came the Apps.  I had their Oysters Rockefeller and Jon and Sara had the Scampi and a Spread if some sort that was Delicious.  Sara had the Filet Medium Rare and Jon & I each had their Beautifully Marbled Ribeye cooked to a perfect Medium Rare to Medium which paired up perfectly with a 2011 Hess 19 Block Howell Mountain Cuvee Meritage.  Hilary tended to us and gave this West Coast Yankee a taste of True Southern Hospitality.  Rick Bouman one of the Managing Partners came over near the end of our dining experience for a visit as well.    We ended up taking some leftovers home as the fairly priced large Portions were more than enough for us along with a piece of their Famous Key Lime Pie.  If you want a Memorable Dining Experience that you won't find everywhere, please try out George Fine's Beef 'n Bottle.  Tell them that Bill sent you.  You'll be glad you did.  I know that on my next trip out to be with my Sister again where I'll be having Dinner at least one night.  Thank you for the "Fine" (pun intended) evening Hilary, Rick, and I hate to say I'be forgotten our Young Busman's name once again.  See you again soon.  Cheers!   Bill

photos.caption: Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheers!
Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States. I Selfie in some pretty good company
Photo of Beef 'N Bottle - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Hess Howell Mountain Cuvée

hi8CLWZT2sgeu8tmo5IApA.text: Had to finally try this place after hearing so many locals recommed it. Take my advice skip this place and head to Del Frisco's, Ruth's Chris, or Oak. This place was just terrible. The packaged cheese crackers to the build your own salad. Oh my...while the food was meh you can find much better in Charlotte.

rpsEAIEv_3CvnpPW63xuAA.text: Beef N Bottle is one of the last remaining old school restaurants in Charlotte.  We've been several times and it's always a great experience with excellent food and well worth the $50+ per person.  Last night we went for my fathers birthday.  Our party was 9, we were seated at a folding table (yes a literal folding table) with my father sitting in the main aisle of the room we were in.  The restaurant is small and has always been a little tight, which previously was just part of the charm.  But last night was too much.  It was like being in coach on an airplane.  We were packed in so tight with the tables next to us that the waitress couldn't even get to all of us.  My father had people's asses and serving trays right next to and over his head the entire night. It seems like with the seating and the table time limits that they're trying to squeeze more blood from a stone and maybe it's just how things have to be. We'll think twice about our next trip and definitely make sure ahead of time that our seating isn't going to weird.

MpYrEPHPspRJ9aQl46zm6A.text: This place has a lot of hype but we didn't care for the food. It's a great place if you don't want to see the guest you are with :)  Food was just okay nothing special enough to come back for

4jeXzA90IKprF7BudGkcOQ.text: This is now my favorite steakhouse. The service here was amazing. They were able to accommodate us even though we didn't have a reservation. Our waitress was so sweet and really personable. Now to the food, we order a half Oysters but our waitress forgot to put in the order so she gave us the Shrimp cocktail and let me tell you I hate cocktail sauce but their sauce is so good. The shrimp were massive. I ordered the black and bleu ribeye cooked to perfection and just the right amount of Cajun rub and bleu cheese. My friend had a NY strip and he never eats all his food but he killed the whole steak so that was my confirmation for him that it was good. I was really pleased can't wait to go back!

PZjFzJBkuAHjAp4WcOlvRg.text: Always loved this place. Clearly any restaurant lasting 60 years is an icon. However tonite I rate it low. We had a party of 12 celebrating the holidays, like many other patrons. We booked a 6pm reservation and all arrived on time. We ordered many drinks and bottles of wine, several apps and were having fun. Then everyone ordered entrees which were good but clearly coming out of a rushed kitchen (sides were hot, steaks were not). No one complained. At 7:55 we were ordering another round of drinks but were told we could not because the next reservation (8pm) for our table had arrived. We could not order any more drinks nor could we even fathom having dessert. It was time to go, here's your check, please leave. Mind you, the servers were not at fault. The manager (owner?) said a "2-hour experience" is a typical reservation for the holidays. End of story. So, several hundreds of dollars later we left and bid Beef & Bottle farewell. Forever.
